original: zag pa med pa nyid la /üîΩlam shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid la / lam shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of the pathüîΩare the aspects of the truths of origin and path.

original: nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of the path of bodhisattvas are contaminated because they do not completely abandon afflictions.

original: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The aspects of omniscience of perfect buddhas are uncontaminated.

original: mdzod du ni dri ma med par bcu drug las gzhan pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po nyid pas na de ltar 'dir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mdzod du ni dri ma med par bcu drug las gzhan pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po nyid pas na de ltar 'dir 'gal ba med do //
translated: In the Abhidharmako≈õa, the phrase ‚Äúother than the sixteen stainless aspects‚Äù means that they are antidotes to the afflictive obstructions alone.

original: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni gong du bstan bcos las /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni gong du bstan bcos las /
translated: The thirty six aspects of the knowledge of the path are taught in the treatise above:üîΩThe aspects of cause, path, suffering,

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: and cessation are taught to be

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni ;
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni ;
translated: eight, seven,

original: / lnga dang bcu drug ces gsungs so //
analyzed: / lnga dang bcu drug ces gsungs so //
translated: five, and sixteen.

original: zhes te kun 'byung ba dang / lam dag ni sngon du bshad pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: zhes te kun 'byung ba dang / lam dag ni sngon du bshad pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The aspects of origin and path are taught first because they are causes.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa dag ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa dag ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Suffering and cessation are the results.

original: de la kun 'byung ba'i brgyad de /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba'i brgyad de /
translated: The origin is eightfold:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang zhi ba dang @127a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang zhi ba dang @127a * //
translated: free from attachment, free from agitation, peaceful,

original: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med par brjod de /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med par brjod de /
translated: free from desire, free from hatred, free from delusion, free from afflictions, and free from sentient beings.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i phung po lnga po rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i phung po lnga po rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates previously explained are the origin.

original: 'dir chags par byed pas 'dod chags te /
analyzed: 'dir chags par byed pas 'dod chags te /
translated: Here, attachment is the cause of the origin.

original: chos rnams thams cad la ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa la /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa la /
translated: In the superimposition of intrinsic nature onto all phenomena,

original: 'dir 'dod chags de dang bral zhes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags de dang bral zhes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: here, the freedom from attachment is free from attachment.

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi phyin ci log gi sgro btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi phyin ci log gi sgro btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the superimposition of error onto all phenomena of the origin.

original: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Agitation is the cause of the afflictions.

original: rnam par rtog pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la /
translated: It is conceptualization.

original: de la 'di med pa ni kun nas ldang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di med pa ni kun nas ldang ba med pa ste /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúwithout‚Äù means without the arousing of the mind.

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of the discrimination of all things that arise, there is no grasping.

original: zhi ba ni kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang chos kyi khyad par rnams don dam par nye bar dmigs pa med pa nyid la de'i phyir na 'dod chags med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zhe sdang med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: zhi ba ni kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang chos kyi khyad par rnams don dam par nye bar dmigs pa med pa nyid la de'i phyir na 'dod chags med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zhe sdang med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù is the ultimate non-apprehension of the signs and the special qualities of all things that arise. Therefore, there is the perfection of non-greed, the perfection of non-hatred,

original: gti mug med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and the perfection of non-delusion.

original: skyon med pa zhes pa ni 'dir yon tan gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes pa ni 'dir yon tan gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúFlawless‚Äù here is because of the three virtues.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad pa'o //
translated: It is the exhaustion of greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without afflictions because of the absence of all afflictions.

original: kun 'byung bar yongs su btags pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pas sems can nyid du nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal de la med pas sems can med pa ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung bar yongs su btags pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pas sems can nyid du nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal de la med pas sems can med pa ste /
translated: Since there is no designation of origination, and since there is no grasping, there is no sentient being in the suffering of affliction.

original: kun 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid la chos dang gang zag gis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i yang dag pa'i mtha' nyid la chos dang gang zag gis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The reality-limit of origination is emptiness of the person and of phenomena.

original: lam gyi bdun ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis rjes su rig pa dang / kun tu tha dad med pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bdun ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis rjes su rig pa dang / kun tu tha dad med pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / ma chags pa'o //
translated: The seven of the path are: immeasurable, recognition of the two extremes, no difference, not dependent on another, no discursive thought, immeasurable, and no attachment.

original: lam ni tshad med pa dang / chos rnams thams cad kyi kun nas ldang ba ni kun rdzob tu skye ba la /
analyzed: lam ni tshad med pa dang / chos rnams thams cad kyi kun nas ldang ba ni kun rdzob tu skye ba la /
translated: The path is immeasurable, and the universal ground of all phenomena is the conventional arising.

original: kun nas ldang ba med pa ni don dam par skye ba med pas nye bar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba med pa ni don dam par skye ba med pas nye bar bzung ba'o //
translated: The absence of universal ground is the ultimate non-arising.

original: lam ni mtha' gnyis rjes su rig pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni mtha' gnyis rjes su rig pa ste /
translated: The path is the recognition of the two extremes.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis rjes su rig pa med pas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis rjes su rig pa med pas so //
translated: It is non-attachment, since one does not cognize either existence or non-existence.

original: lam ni kun nas tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni kun nas tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: The Path is non-differentiation,

original: tha dad pa @127b nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa @127b nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since one does not perceive differentiation.

original: lam ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ste /
translated: The Path is not dependent on another,

original: des theg pa dman pa la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des theg pa dman pa la mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is not dependent on another vehicle.

original: lam ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: The Path is non-conceptual,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams rjes su mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams rjes su mi dmigs pas so //
translated: since one does not perceive conceptualization.

original: lam ni gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: The Path is immeasurable,

original: gzhal du med pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is based on the immeasurable reality.

original: lam ni chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni chags pa med pa ste /
translated: The Path is unattached,

original: chos rnams thams cad la chags pa med pa nyid pas dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad la chags pa med pa nyid pas dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: since it is non-apprehending, due to non-attachment to all dharmas.

original: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni /
translated: The five of Suffering are:

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: impermanence, suffering, emptiness, insubstantiality, and the absence of marks.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The five aggregates with outflows are suffering.

original: de la mi rtag pa ni rtag par 'gyur ba med pa nyid ces pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa ni rtag par 'gyur ba med pa nyid ces pa ste /
translated: Impermanence is the absence of permanence,

original: chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa dang ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dus ma byas pa dang ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: the non-production of all phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste /
translated: Suffering is like space,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal stong pa dang / sdug bsngal bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal stong pa dang / sdug bsngal bdag med pa ste /
translated: free from its own characteristics, suffering is empty, suffering is selfless.

original: 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa gsum de la med pas sdug bsngal mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa gsum de la med pas sdug bsngal mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Since the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, arising, aging, and impermanence, do not exist in it, suffering is without characteristics.

original: 'gog pa la bcu drug ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la bcu drug ste /
translated: In cessation there are sixteen.

original: de ltar yang 'gog pa ni stong pa nyid kho na rnam par dag pa nyid la stong pa nyid la ni dbyer med de /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'gog pa ni stong pa nyid kho na rnam par dag pa nyid la stong pa nyid la ni dbyer med de /
translated: Thus, cessation is only emptiness, pure itself, and emptiness is indivisible.

original: dbye ba po rnams dmigs su med pas de'i phyir na nam mkha' bzhin du 'gog pa ni mtha' med pa dang / mu med pas rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: dbye ba po rnams dmigs su med pas de'i phyir na nam mkha' bzhin du 'gog pa ni mtha' med pa dang / mu med pas rgya che ba ste /
translated: Therefore, like space, it is infinite and boundless, since the divisions are not perceived.

original: dus gsum gyis kyang yongs su ma chod pas go rims bzhin du de'i stong pa nyid bcu drug 'dir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyis kyang yongs su ma chod pas go rims bzhin du de'i stong pa nyid bcu drug 'dir ro //
translated: Since it is not limited by the three times, its emptiness is sixteenfold here, in the order given.

original: gcig pa nyid de 'dir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de 'dir gsungs pa ni /
translated: The single identity is stated here:

original: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa nas ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'di ni nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa nas ji srid du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar zhes pa'i don te /
translated: This is the perfection of inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of intrinsic nature.

original: 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ni ji ltar rigs pa bcu drug gi nang du bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa rang gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ni ji ltar rigs pa bcu drug gi nang du bsdu ba'o //
translated: Here, the emptiness of things and nonthings, of their own entities and other entities, is included in the sixteen as appropriate.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams ni brgya rtsa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams ni brgya rtsa bcu ste /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are one hundred and ten.

original: gang du bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gang du bstan bcos las /
translated: As the treatise teaches:

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the close placements of mindfulness

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par //üîΩslob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin du //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par // slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin du //
translated: The last is Buddhahood itself.üîΩThe disciples are the Bodhisattvas,

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: and the Buddhas are the thirty-four

original: sum cu rtsa dgu @128a * //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu @128a * //
translated: and thirty-nine,

original: dag tu bzhed //üîΩces te / de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dag tu bzhed // ces te / de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: respectively.üîΩThe thirty-seven are taught in terms of the disciples.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi re re zhing dmigs pas med pa de'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi re re zhing dmigs pas med pa de'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfections of each of the elements leading to enlightenment are the perfections of the aspects of the latter.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: The perfection of the application of mindfulness of the body, up to the perfection of right concentration.

original: nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The thirty-seven are the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment based on the path of the disciples.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / bden pa bzhi dang sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu rnams mi dmigs pa la re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / bden pa bzhi dang sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu rnams mi dmigs pa la re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of each of the three doors of liberation, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the four noble truths, and the ten such as giving, is the perfection of nonapprehension.

original: 'di'i stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa nas ji srid du 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa'i sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa nas ji srid du 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa'i sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The perfection of emptiness up to the perfection of intuition are the thirty-four based on the bodhisattva path.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin zhes pa ni stobs bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin zhes pa ni stobs bcu ste /
translated: The perfection of the power of the aspect of knowledge of all aspects is the ten powers.

original: 'dir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa nas ji srid du zag pa zad pas mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi bar ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa nas ji srid du zag pa zad pas mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi bar ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Here, the perfection of power is the power of knowledge of the possible and impossible, up to the perfection of power is the power of knowledge of the extinction of the outflows.

original: brdzi ba med pa nyid ni stobs kyi don to //
analyzed: brdzi ba med pa nyid ni stobs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of power is that it cannot be crushed.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of fearlessness is fourfold:üîΩthe perfection of fearlessness in the full enlightenment, the exhaustion of contaminants, the obstacles to the Dharma, and the Dharma that leads to definite release.

original: mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar chad kyi chos dang nges par 'byung ba can gyi chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du zhum pa med pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar chad kyi chos dang nges par 'byung ba can gyi chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du zhum pa med pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the meaning of fearlessness is the absence of timidity.üîΩThe perfection of the analytical knowledges is fourfold:

original: chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: the perfection of the analytical knowledge of the teaching, the perfection of the analytical knowledge of meaning, the perfection of the analytical knowledge of the expression, and the perfection of the analytical knowledge of brilliance.üîΩThe perfection of the analytical knowledge of the teaching is the knowledge of all the teachings.üîΩThe perfection of the analytical knowledge of meaning is the knowledge of the meanings of all the teachings.

original: thams cad du chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa la /
analyzed: thams cad du chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa la /
translated: The perfection of the analytical knowledge of the expression is the knowledge of the expressions of all the teachings.

original: de ni chags pa dang thogs pa las 'das pa nyid de de ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni chags pa dang thogs pa las 'das pa nyid de de ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i don to //
translated: The perfection of the analytical knowledge of brilliance is the knowledge of the teaching that is appropriate, timely, and free of obscurations.

original: de la gsung rab yang lag bcu gnyis ni chos dang / de'i brjod par bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: de la gsung rab yang lag bcu gnyis ni chos dang / de'i brjod par bya ba'i don no //
translated: The twelve branches of the scriptures are the Dharma, and their subject matter is the meaning.

original: chos kyi ming gi tshogs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang 'gro ba drug gi skad ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: chos kyi ming gi tshogs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dang 'gro ba drug gi skad ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The etymologies of the collections of names, etc. of the Dharma, and the languages of the six destinies are the etymological explanations,

original: de rnams so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands them individually.

original: chos la sogs pa rnams @128b gzhan la ston pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni spobs pa de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos de thams cad la ma 'dres par spyod ces pas ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa rnams @128b gzhan la ston pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni spobs pa de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi chos de thams cad la ma 'dres par spyod ces pas ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: The direct realization of the individual correct knowledges of the Dharma, etc. is eloquence, because it is the teaching of the Dharma, etc. to others.

original: gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the practice of all the Buddha dharmas without admixture, because it is not shared with others.

original: de'i rnam pa ni bco brgyad yin pa'i phyir de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni bco brgyad yin pa'i phyir de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: It is the perfection of that, because its aspects are eighteen.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang / ca co dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum mo //üîΩsems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs pa dang / ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang / ca co dang / dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum mo // sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs pa dang / ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The three perfections of the absence of error, the absence of babbling, and the absence of loss of mindfulness.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo //üîΩ'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba rnams yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo // 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba rnams yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The three perfections of the absence of the non-concentration of mind, the absence of various discriminations, and the absence of non-discerning equanimity.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni drug go //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni drug go //
translated: The six perfections of the absence of loss of aspiration, striving, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and liberation.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste de'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum mo //
translated: The three perfections of the going of knowledge in front of all actions of body, speech, and mind, and the following of knowledge.

original: dus gsum pa thams cad du ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
analyzed: dus gsum pa thams cad du ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
translated: The engagement of knowledge in all three times without attachment and without obstruction.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The three perfections are the perfection of the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'dra ba dang bsam pa dang gzhal ba la des sbyor ba dang / 'brel pa ni 'dres pa la /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang bsam pa dang gzhal ba la des sbyor ba dang / 'brel pa ni 'dres pa la /
translated: The word mixed means that the Buddha is connected with the similarity of disciples, the intention of disciples, and the evaluation of disciples, because he applies himself to them.

original: de las yang dag par 'das shing shin tu 'das pa ni ma 'dres pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las yang dag par 'das shing shin tu 'das pa ni ma 'dres pa'i don to //
translated: The word unmixed means that he is not mixed with, and is completely beyond, those.

original: chos kyi ji lta ba bzhin de nyid du gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi ji lta ba bzhin de nyid du gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The word thus-gone means that he has gone to the reality of phenomena just as it is.

original: de'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The word perfection means that he has gone beyond that reality, because it is the aspect of that reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kyi de rnams kyi bden pa nyid la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kyi de rnams kyi bden pa nyid la /
translated: The word all means that he has gone to the reality of all the phenomena taught by the Buddha.üîΩ The word truth means that he has gone to the reality of the truth of all those phenomena.

original: rang gi sems kyi bdag nyid kyis sgom par byed cing gnas par byed pa'i chos thams cad ni rang 'byung ba la de'i rnam pa'i phyir ni de'i pha rol tu phyin pa las byung bas 'di'i khongs su sdud pa'i don tam /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi bdag nyid kyis sgom par byed cing gnas par byed pa'i chos thams cad ni rang 'byung ba la de'i rnam pa'i phyir ni de'i pha rol tu phyin pa las byung bas 'di'i khongs su sdud pa'i don tam /
translated: All phenomena that are cultivated and abided in by the nature of one‚Äôs mind are self-arisen because they arise from the perfection of that. The meaning is that they are included in this.

original: rang gi 'dod pas 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni rang 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-arisen‚Äù means that they arise here by one‚Äôs wish.

original: de'i phyir na yum chen mo las chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid nas nye bar bzung ste zhes gsungs pa de'i 'dir ni rgyur gsungs te /üîΩchos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid @129a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yum chen mo las chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nyid nas nye bar bzung ste zhes gsungs pa de'i 'dir ni rgyur gsungs te / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la zhes pa ni chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid @129a * //
translated: Therefore, in the Great Mother, it says, ‚ÄúHaving taken up mastery over all phenomena . . .‚Äù Here, that is stated as the cause.

original: med pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are devoid of entityness‚Äù means that all phenomena are devoid of entityness.

original: de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang sgyur ba'o zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang sgyur ba'o zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe mastery of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äù is the intention.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'o //
translated: The realization that all phenomena lack an essence is mastery over all phenomena because it is not dependent on others.

original: rang 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: The aspect of self-arising is that of others.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas kyi zhes pa ni don gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang sangs rgyas kyi zhes pa ni don gcig go //
translated: Omniscience and buddhahood are synonymous.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa tha ma ni yum chen mo la 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa tha ma ni yum chen mo la 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Here, the final aspect of buddhahood is the great mother, and here it is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Omniscience.

original: chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa thams cad dang de rnams kyi ye shes de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam tshol bar byed ces pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la brten nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang rnam pa thams cad dang de rnams kyi ye shes de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam tshol bar byed ces pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la brten nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam
translated: The search for the path of buddhahood that knows all phenomena by their nature, all their aspects, and the nature of the wisdom of those phenomena is the aspect of omniscience.

original: pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu ste /
analyzed: pa ni sum cu rtsa dgu ste /
translated: It has thirty-nine aspects.

original: med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ba'i rnam pa ni brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ba'i rnam pa ni brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The aspects of nonexistence up to the aspects of apprehension are one hundred and seventy-three.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgro btags pa ma lus par log pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nyid kyi ngo bo la gdul bya'i bsam pa'i khyad par gyi ngor de dang de'i ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgro btags pa ma lus par log pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nyid kyi ngo bo la gdul bya'i bsam pa'i khyad par gyi ngor de dang de'i ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag
translated: The generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the cessation of all superimpositions such as permanence and impermanence, is established as different by way of the different divisions of that and that cessation, in the face of the differences in the inclinations of the disciples.

original: pa ste / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la ji ltar rigs pa'i rnam pa rnams dang 'dres pa rnams la 'di ni ji ltar rigs pa ste /
analyzed: pa ste / de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis la ji ltar rigs pa'i rnam pa rnams dang 'dres pa rnams la 'di ni ji ltar rigs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is mixed with the aspects of the twenty-two generations of the Thought of Enlightenment, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bshad pa ni /
translated: The four verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe form of the application, etc.,‚Äù explain this.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs la gang du thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa nas kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gsum gyis sbyor bas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs la gang du thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs su ni gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa nas kyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gsum gyis sbyor bas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The section on the realization of all aspects in the chapter on the occasion of all-knowledge is stated in three and a half verses beginning with ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching by way of the opposite:

original: nyan thos rnams kyi la rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi la rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas should meditate on the opposite of the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô all-knowledge.

original: de la dang po'i sems bskyed pa gsum ni /
analyzed: de la dang po'i sems bskyed pa gsum ni /
translated: The three first productions of the thought

original: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: are the giving of the name,

original: yang dag bgrod la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag bgrod la mkhas pa ni //
translated: the skill in the means,

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
translated: and the realization of all aspects.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: They are asserted to be conducive to liberation.

original: ces pa'o // sems bskyed pa bzhi po ni drod la sogs pa'i @129b nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi la drod la sogs pa rnams la re re bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi /
analyzed: ces pa'o // sems bskyed pa bzhi po ni drod la sogs pa'i @129b nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi la drod la sogs pa rnams la re re bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi /
translated: The object of observation of each of the heat, etc., is divided into small, medium, and great, so there are twelve aspects.

original: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis bstan pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs so //
translated: The seven verses teach the aspects of impermanence, etc.üîΩThus, the object of observation of the four kinds of generating the Thought, without making distinctions, is impermanence, etc.

analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi yang ste /
translated: The seven verses teach the aspects of impermanence, etc.üîΩThe

original: tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i drod la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gsungs pa la /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i drod la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gsungs pa la /
translated: The verses state the four aspects of heat and so on that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa'i skabs la'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa'i skabs la'o //
translated: The prose explains the path of seeing in terms of the knowledge of the path of bodhisattvas.

original: sems bskyed pa lnga po ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes pa ni mdor bstan la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lnga po ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes pa ni mdor bstan la /
translated: The fifth generation of bodhicitta is the path of seeing, the ground of Very Joyful.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs dang lam shes pa'i skabs kyi bzod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs dang lam shes pa'i skabs kyi bzod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gis ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The six verses beginning with ‚ÄúAcceptance on the occasion of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù explain this in detail.

original: nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyis mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa ni lam shes pa'i skabs kyi chos shes pa la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyis mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa ni lam shes pa'i skabs kyi chos shes pa la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa lnga ste /
translated: The path of seeing of the listeners and solitary realizers is explained in detail in the section on the knowledge of the path, in the five verses beginning with ‚ÄúAcceptance of phenomena on the occasion of the knowledge of the path.‚Äù

original: thams cad shes pa'i skabs su ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa'i skabs su ste /
translated: The path of seeing of the bodhisattvas is explained in detail in the section on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar 'di nyid kyi don gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni legs par bzhag pas gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di nyid kyi don gyi rnam par gzhag pa ni legs par bzhag pas gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the presentation of the meaning of this is well-established, not elsewhere.

original: kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa 'di rnams kyis /
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa 'di rnams kyis /
translated: By these aspects of the three omnisciences,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma de stod par byed pa'i le'u ni bstod pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: the chapter that praises the Bhagavatƒ´ is the ninth chapter.

original: // / rnam pa rnams kyi sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rnam pa rnams kyi sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The application of the aspects should be stated.

analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ma ni thos par yang rnyed par dka' na ji ltar na sbyor ba gsungs zhes pa bstan pa bstan bcos las /

original: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba skrun //
analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba skrun //

original: zhes te / sngon du sangs rgyas rnams la sman la sogs pa rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams dang / de rnams la yang gnas dang skyed mos tshal dang mal stan dang ston mo la sogs pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed nas tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis gang 'dir bcom ldan 'das mnyan pa de ni ma tshangüîΩba med pa'i bsnyen bkur la /
analyzed: zhes te / sngon du sangs rgyas rnams la sman la sogs pa rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams dang / de rnams la yang gnas dang skyed mos tshal dang mal stan dang ston mo la sogs pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed nas tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis gang 'dir bcom ldan 'das mnyan pa de ni ma tshang ba med pa'i bsnyen bkur la /
translated: previously, the Buddhas were served with medicines and so forth, and the roots of virtue were generated for them with abodes, gardens, beds, feasts, and so forth, and those endowed with ethics, learning, and so forth, who were served by the Blessed One here, are not incomplete in service.

original: gang gis ji srid du 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de ni de ltar yang sangs rgyas la sogs par yang rigs pas /
analyzed: gang gis ji srid du 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de ni de ltar yang sangs rgyas la sogs par yang rigs pas /

analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /

analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas te /
