analyzed: dad pa med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Faith, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes yang dag par yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes yang dag par yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the conviction that the teachings of the Tathagata are not erroneous.

original: gzung bar 'dod pa ni bzod pa spong bar mi 'dod pa'i ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar 'dod pa ni bzod pa spong bar mi 'dod pa'i ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the wish to grasp the teachings and to abandon their opposites.

original: don dang gzhung dgal nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa la brtson 'grus ni spro ba'o //üîΩdge ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo rnams kyi gnyen por ni bag yod pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las thob pa'i tshig rnams kyis nges pa nyid kyi dngos po la de nyid 'di las gzhan du min zhes pa rtogs par byed pa ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: don dang gzhung dgal nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa la brtson 'grus ni spro ba'o // dge ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo rnams kyi gnyen por ni bag yod pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las thob pa'i tshig rnams kyis nges pa nyid kyi dngos po la de nyid 'di las gzhan du min zhes pa rtogs par byed pa ni mos pa ste /
translated: Exertion is the enthusiasm for listening to the scriptures and their commentaries.üîΩCarefulness is the realization that the teachings are true, that is, that they are not otherwise, through certainty gained from direct perception and inference.

original: gang gis mi 'phrogs pa nyid la kun tu gnas pa ni sbyin pa'i las la gtso bo ste /
analyzed: gang gis mi 'phrogs pa nyid la kun tu gnas pa ni sbyin pa'i las la gtso bo ste /
translated: The principal activity of generosity is to abide in the state of being unspoiled by any of the four: attachment, hatred, delusion, or laziness.

original: phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be taken away by adversaries.

original: yongs su ma dris pa ni the tshom gyi gnas la'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dris pa ni the tshom gyi gnas la'o //
translated: The unasked is the object of doubt.

original: chung ngu ba ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: chung ngu ba ni byas pa ste /
translated: The small is the done,

original: gang gis dri ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis dri ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: by which the question is also so.

original: 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This, etc.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag phan tshun gyi rgyu nyid du nges par bskyed pas 'di rnams la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni sbyor ba po rnyed par dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag phan tshun gyi rgyu nyid du nges par bskyed pas 'di rnams la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni sbyor ba po rnyed par dka' ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of an Omniscient One are ascertained as being the mutual cause, and so it is said that ‚ÄúI pay homage to them.‚Äù This is the difficulty in finding the author.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas ni sbyor ba'i go skabs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas ni sbyor ba'i go skabs te /
translated: Then, etc. is the opportunity for the composition.

original: de yang bsdus na ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa nyid la rgyas pa ni bstan bcos su /
analyzed: de yang bsdus na ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa nyid la rgyas pa ni bstan bcos su /
translated: Moreover, it is summarized in the cultivation of the Thought of Enlightenment itself, and it is extensive in the treatise.

original: gzugs @130b la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs @130b la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because form, etc. do not abide,

original: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //üîΩde yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir // de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: because the application to them is stopped,üîΩbecause their suchness is profound,

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: because they are difficult to fathom,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs kyi phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs kyi phyir //
translated: and because they are realized with great difficulty and over a long time.üîΩBecause of prophecy, irreversibility,üîΩrenunciation, absence of obstacles,üîΩnearness to enlightenment, swiftness,

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
translated: and because of the increase and decrease of others‚Äô welfare.

original: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
translated: One does not see phenomena and nonphenomena,üîΩand so on.

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: One does not see form and so on as inconceivable.üîΩOne does not conceptualize the signs of form and so on,

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bo rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen sbyin pa byed //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bo rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen sbyin pa byed //
translated: their nature, or their result, which is the gift of jewels.

original: de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
analyzed: de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
translated: That is the pure stage and its boundary.

original: zhes te / sbyor ba dang bcas pa rnam par bshad pa rnams kyi rang bzhin las sbyor ba'i phyir na tshad med pa'i bar gyi de rnams la sbyor ba dgag pa'o zhes rjes su 'brang bar byas la /
analyzed: zhes te / sbyor ba dang bcas pa rnam par bshad pa rnams kyi rang bzhin las sbyor ba'i phyir na tshad med pa'i bar gyi de rnams la sbyor ba dgag pa'o zhes rjes su 'brang bar byas la /
translated: The nature of the explanations together with the preparations is the preparation for the immeasurables. Therefore, one should understand that the preparations are negated in the immeasurables.

original: de rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir dang // tshad med pa'i phyir ni de rnams la sbyor ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams zab pa'i phyir dang / gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir dang // tshad med pa'i phyir ni de rnams la sbyor ba bkag pa'o //
translated: Because of their profundity, because of the difficulty of fathoming their depths, and because of their immeasurability, their application is prohibited.

original: de'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: His application is stated:

original: koo shi ka 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'dir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, Kau≈õika,‚Äù etc.

original: spyod pa ni yid la byed pas so //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i ni mdor bstan pa la /
analyzed: spyod pa ni yid la byed pas so // gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i ni mdor bstan pa la /
translated: Practice is by way of mental attention.üîΩThe non-abiding in form, etc., is the brief presentation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes mi gnas zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes mi gnas zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn form, etc.,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-abiding‚Äù is the extensive explanation,

original: mngon par zhen pa med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is ‚Äúwithout manifest attachment.‚Äù

original: mi gnas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi gnas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-abiding‚Äù is the application of non-abiding in form, etc.

original: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúForm,‚Äù etc.,

original: mi sbyor ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dag gis yin la de ltar na mi gnas pa ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi sbyor ba ni ming dang mtshan ma dag gis yin la de ltar na mi gnas pa ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
translated: is non-application by way of names and signs. Thus, non-abiding is non-understanding.

original: gnas pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Abiding is due to the absence of conceptualization. This is the application of the absence of application to form and so on.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn said to the bodhisattva Maitreya, ‚ÄúMaitreya, it is just so.

original: zab ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zab ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: The profound is due to the profundity of the suchness of form and so on.

original: zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of the profound.

original: gting dpogs par dka' ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gting dpogs par dka' ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to fathom is due to the difficulty of fathoming form and so on.

original: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges par 'byed pa nus par 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na gsungs pa ni gzung par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges par 'byed pa nus par 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na gsungs pa ni gzung par dka' ba ste /
translated: Well then, isn‚Äôt the perfection of wisdom asserted to be able to bring about the separation from the obscurations? It is said that it is difficult to grasp.

original: nges par mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: nges par mtshan mar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is difficult to grasp because it is difficult to apprehend its characteristics.

original: de las ni rnam par rtog pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rnam par rtog pa med de /üîΩde'i phyir na gting @131a * //
analyzed: de las ni rnam par rtog pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rnam par rtog pa med de / de'i phyir na gting @131a * //
translated: From that, conceptualization is the perfection of wisdom, but it is not conceptualization.

original: dpogs par dka' ba'o zhes pa ni gting dpogs par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dpogs par dka' ba'o zhes pa ni gting dpogs par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to fathom. This is the application of the difficulty of fathoming.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la tshad med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la tshad med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The phrase because form and so on are immeasurable is the application of the immeasurable.

original: gzugs zab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase form is profound and so on.

original: mi gnas pa ni mngon par zhen pa la sbyor ba mi byed pa ni yang dag par mi shes pas so zhes pa ni zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni mngon par zhen pa la sbyor ba mi byed pa ni yang dag par mi shes pas so zhes pa ni zab pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase because it is not a basis means that it is not a basis for the application of attachment, because it is not known correctly. This is profundity.

original: mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is not an application means that it is not an application of attachment.

original: de bzhin du gting dpogs par dka' ba nyid ni sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gting dpogs par dka' ba nyid ni sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase it is difficult to fathom means that it is not an application.

original: de ltar tshad med pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshad med pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, the phrase it is immeasurable means that it is not an application.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase when this was said and so on.

original: skyon cir 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: skyon cir 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase what is the problem? means that it is an inquiry.

original: 'dri ba la lan ni yum chen mor gsungs pa dran par byed do //
analyzed: 'dri ba la lan ni yum chen mor gsungs pa dran par byed do //
translated: The answer to the inquiry is to recall what is said in the Great Mother.

original: de brjod pa ni de yang thos nas 'di la dad par mi byed cing so sor spong par byed pas des ngan 'gror yun ring du gnas nas tshegs chen po dang yun ring por mngon par byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ni tshegs chen po yun rings kyis
analyzed: de brjod pa ni de yang thos nas 'di la dad par mi byed cing so sor spong par byed pas des ngan 'gror yun ring du gnas nas tshegs chen po dang yun ring por mngon par byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ni tshegs chen po yun rings kyis
translated: The statement that refers to the fact that, having heard that, one does not have faith in it, and rejects it. Therefore, one remains in miserable realms for a long time, and one will become fully enlightened after a long time and with great difficulty. This is the application to great difficulty and a long time.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩde skad ces gsol zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o // de skad ces gsol zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.

original: rgya chen pos lung bstan par 'gyur nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rgya chen pos lung bstan par 'gyur nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.

original: gcig ma yin zhes pa ni gzhung nor pa can la /üîΩgcig ces pa ni ma nor ba'o //üîΩbrnyes par 'gyur ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig ma yin zhes pa ni gzhung nor pa can la / gcig ces pa ni ma nor ba'o // brnyes par 'gyur ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.

original: thugs byung bar byed par mi 'gyur ba ni brten par byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩyun ring por theg pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thugs byung bar byed par mi 'gyur ba ni brten par byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba'o // yun ring por theg pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.üîΩThe statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The statement thus have I heard refers to the application to realization.

original: yang nas yang du ni dpe mang du'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du ni dpe mang du'o //
translated: Again and again is the many examples.

original: ming mthun pa ni kha phyir bltas pa'o //
analyzed: ming mthun pa ni kha phyir bltas pa'o //
translated: The same name is the outward-looking.

original: yongs su ldog pa ni rnam par ldog par 'gyur ba la rab tu thob pa la ldog pa med pa'i sbyor bas sbyor bar 'gyur zhing rnyog pa med pas rab tu rtsol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su ldog pa ni rnam par ldog par 'gyur ba la rab tu thob pa la ldog pa med pa'i sbyor bas sbyor bar 'gyur zhing rnyog pa med pas rab tu rtsol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The reversal is the application of the non-reversal of the attainment of the reversal, the application of the non-cessation of the attainment, and the application of the non-defilement of the effort. This is the application of irreversibility.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa las /
translated: For example, up to...

original: nyan pa la zhes pa'i bar ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nyan pa la zhes pa'i bar ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Up to the listener is the application of the definite emergence.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas mnyan pa zhes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa nas mnyan pa zhes pa'i bar te /
translated: Having said this, up to... listening.

original: sdong po ni phung po la sdong po dang ri dgas kyi mtshan ma ni rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdong po ni phung po la sdong po dang ri dgas kyi mtshan ma ni rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The trunk is the aggregates, and the deer sign is the peak, etc.

original: ji ltar yang na gal te yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang na gal te yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Just as, or if, is the meaning of again.

original: mthar thug pa ni nges pa'o zhes pa ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni nges pa'o zhes pa ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The final is the definite. This is the application of the uninterrupted.

original: @131b 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @131b 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is like this: for example,  and so on.

original: rnying pa rnams lhags pa zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa las nye bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rnying pa rnams lhags pa zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa las nye bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The old ones are called approaching because they are applied to manifest enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is like this: for example,  and so on.

original: snyom par 'gyur ba ni ngal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snyom par 'gyur ba ni ngal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Being exhausted means being tired.

original: sdug bsngal ni na ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni na ba'o //
translated: Suffering means being sick.

original: smra ba nyid ni smra ba'am smra bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba nyid ni smra ba'am smra bar bya ba'o //
translated: Speaking means speaking or what is to be spoken.

original: nyams ni stobs so //
analyzed: nyams ni stobs so //
translated: Strength means power.

original: grogs ni skyes bu dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
analyzed: grogs ni skyes bu dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
translated: Companionship means sleeping with a man.

original: gang gi phyir sngon gyi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon gyi zhes pa ste /
translated: Because of the former,  and so on.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu la brten pa ni kun rtog pas kun brtan pas de skyed pas so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu la brten pa ni kun rtog pas kun brtan pas de skyed pas so //
translated: Improper mental activity is based on the cause of desire, because it produces it through conceptualization.

original: nges par skyes pa ni 'dod chags skyes bas so //
analyzed: nges par skyes pa ni 'dod chags skyes bas so //
translated: Definitely born means born from desire.

original: bsgoms pas ni kun tu sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni kun tu sbyor bas so //
translated: Meditated means through fetters.

original: mang du byas pa ni yang dang yang du de ltar byas pas so //
analyzed: mang du byas pa ni yang dang yang du de ltar byas pas so //
translated: Repeatedly done means doing it again and again.

original: dga' zhing ni rjes su yi rang ba ste zhes pa ni myur du mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩde skad ces gsol ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dga' zhing ni rjes su yi rang ba ste zhes pa ni myur du mngon par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o // de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The rejoicing is the application to one's own swift enlightenment.

original: gang du gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa po med pa nyid de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: gang du gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa po med pa nyid de ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The marvel is the absence of any other benefactor.

original: ci gal te zhes pa ni yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gal te zhes pa ni yang dag par bstan pa dang yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: If one does not do the teaching, the encouraging, the delighting, and the exalting, then what?

original: ji ltar zhe na legs par yongs su gzung ba ni rjes su gzung ba yang dag par khas len pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na legs par yongs su gzung ba ni rjes su gzung ba yang dag par khas len pa'o //
translated: The proper reception is the acceptance of the proper reception.

original: legs par yongs su gtad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang dag par gtad nas thos pa la sbyor la yongs su gtad pa de la yang de rnams kyis bslab pa'i phyir sbyor ba zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: legs par yongs su gtad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang dag par gtad nas thos pa la sbyor la yongs su gtad pa de la yang de rnams kyis bslab pa'i phyir sbyor ba zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The proper entrusting is the entrusting to the Bodhisattvas after having applied them to the hearing, and the application to the training in that entrusting. This is the application to the benefit of others.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Subhuti said so it is, Bhagavan and so forth is the application of non-increase and non-decrease.

original: chos ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of not seeing such things as Dharma, non-Dharma, and neutral dharmas is Dharma is not seen, non-Dharma is not seen, and so forth.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti said so it is, Bhagavan and so forth.

original: chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pas mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pas mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of not seeing dharmas because they are inconceivable is Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be seen, and so forth.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the Bhagavan said to the Venerable Subhuti so it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩrin po che'i phung po zhes pa ni 'bras bu rin po ches yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rnams kyi rgyu'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'bras bu rin po che rab tu sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩdag pa'i phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o // rin po che'i phung po zhes pa ni 'bras bu rin po ches yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rnams kyi rgyu'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'bras bu rin po che rab tu sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'o // dag pa'i phung po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The application of non-conceptuality is Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be seen, and so forth.üîΩThe application of giving the jewel of the result is Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be seen, and so forth.üîΩThe application of the pure aggregates and so forth is Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be seen, and so forth.

original: de rnams nyid kyi @132a * //
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyi @132a * //
translated: Those very ones are the cause of the jewel of the result, because they are the cause of the turning of the Dharma wheel of perfect enlightenment, which is the jewel of the result.

original: 'bras bu rnams ni nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag pa mthong bas so zhes pa ni dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag pa mthong bas so zhes pa ni dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The result is seen to be pure like space. This is the application of purity.

original: ngo mtshar to zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar to zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Marvelous, etc.

original: yi ger bri ba ni bri bar nus pa'o //üîΩrab tu bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: yi ger bri ba ni bri bar nus pa'o // rab tu bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Writing means being able to write.

original: rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba la yi dam ma nyams pa ni dum bur ma gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba la yi dam ma nyams pa ni dum bur ma gyur ba'o //
translated: Not being fully accomplished means not being fully arisen. Not impaired means not broken.

original: mtshams las mi 'da' ba ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams las mi 'da' ba ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Not transgressing the boundary is the application with a boundary.

original: yon tan ni sbyor ba'i bsngags pa rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni sbyor ba'i bsngags pa rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: Qualities are the praise of the application.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In that regard, the treatise says:

original: bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
analyzed: bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
translated: Conquering the power of Mara, etc.,

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
translated: are the fourteen qualities.

original: zhes pa ste de la de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste de la de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Regarding that, Then, etc.

original: dgongs par 'gyur ba ni dran par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs par 'gyur ba ni dran par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Intention means recollection.

original: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba ni rjes su mthun pas gnas pa la sogs pas zhes pa ni bdud kyi mthu rnam par bcom pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba ni rjes su mthun pas gnas pa la sogs pas zhes pa ni bdud kyi mthu rnam par bcom pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be taken care of‚Äù means by living in accordance with it and so forth. This is the quality of destroying the power of Mara.

original: sh'a ri'i bu bar chad byed par mi nus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bar chad byed par mi nus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Shariputra, they will not be able to create obstacles‚Äù and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of being considered by the Buddha.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Having said this‚Äù and so forth.

original: mthu ni nus pa la byin gyi rlabs ni nus pa lhag par skyed ba'o //
analyzed: mthu ni nus pa la byin gyi rlabs ni nus pa lhag par skyed ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Power‚Äù means ability. ‚Äú Blessing‚Äù means producing an extraordinary ability.

original: yongs su bzung ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Taking care of‚Äù means accepting.

original: mkhyen pa ni de la dgongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni de la dgongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Knowing‚Äù means having the intention toward that.

original: byin gyis rlob pa ni rang gis byas pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa ni rang gis byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Blessing‚Äù means doing it oneself.

original: gzigs pa ni sha'i mig gis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni sha'i mig gis so //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù means with the fleshly eye.

original: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du gzigs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis kun du gzigs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚Äú Looking‚Äù means with the eye of a Buddha. This is the quality of being seen by the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú The bodhisattva who‚Äù and so forth.

original: de bzhin nyid ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye ba'i yon tan no //
translated: The reality of the path to perfect complete enlightenment is the quality of being close to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And also, etc.

original: don du gnyer ba chen po ni de nas brtsams nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba chen po ni de nas brtsams nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyis so //
translated: Great pursuit is by means of the Bodhisattva stages, beginning from that.

original: phan yon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: phan yon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i'o //
translated: Great benefit is the excellence of the Bodhisattvas.

original: 'bras bu chen po ni srid pa dga' bar spyod ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po ni srid pa dga' bar spyod ces pa ste /
translated: Great fruit is the enjoyment of existence,

original: rus dang rigs dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rus dang rigs dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: by means of the excellence of lineage, family, characteristics, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa che ba ni rjes la bla na med pa'i byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa che ba ni rjes la bla na med pa'i byang chub pa'o //
translated: Great maturation is the subsequent unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'bad pa ni dub pa ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa ni dub pa ste /
translated: Exertion is fatigue.

original: yongs su dub pa ni bya bas so zhes pa ni don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yongs su dub pa ni bya bas so zhes pa ni don chen po nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: Exhaustion is from activity. These are the qualities of great meaning, etc.

original: 'di dag @132b ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag @132b ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: These, etc.

original: mdo sde ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sutras are the perfection of wisdom and so forth.

original: 'das nas zhes pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas so //
analyzed: 'das nas zhes pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas so //
translated: After means after passing into parinirvana.

original: bar ta ni shar phyogs kyi yul lo //
analyzed: bar ta ni shar phyogs kyi yul lo //
translated: Vartta means in the east.

original: mngon par gsar la gsar bas snying por byung bas snying po'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsar la gsar bas snying por byung bas snying po'o //
translated: Since it is newly arisen and fresh, it is the essence, and since it arises as the essence, it is essence.

original: de thob nas gdul bya rnams la 'di zhes pa ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: de thob nas gdul bya rnams la 'di zhes pa ni de ltar ro //
translated: Having attained that, for the sake of disciples, it is like this.

original: chos ni chos 'di bstan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: chos ni chos 'di bstan pa'i phyir la /
translated: The Dharma is for the sake of teaching this Dharma.

original: 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ste /
translated: It is the Vinaya.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Because it subdues afflictions and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas lo stong phrag lngar 'jig rten du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas lo stong phrag lngar 'jig rten du gnas pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavan abides in the world for five thousand years after passing into parinirvana.

original: de nas nub pa'i tshe de'i dus dang nye ba na byang zhes pa ni cha gzhan rnam par gcad pa ste /
analyzed: de nas nub pa'i tshe de'i dus dang nye ba na byang zhes pa ni cha gzhan rnam par gcad pa ste /
translated: Then, at the time of its disappearance, in the vicinity of that time, in the north excludes other directions.

original: bod kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bod kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the Tibetan region and so forth.

original: bstan pa der rgyas pa nas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa ni bstan pa rgyas pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: bstan pa der rgyas pa nas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa ni bstan pa rgyas pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The teaching will spread there and flourish means the quality of the flourishing teaching.

original: yun ring po nas theg pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yun ring po nas theg pa la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: For a long time and so on.

original: dri bar byas pas na yongs su dris pa'o //
analyzed: dri bar byas pas na yongs su dris pa'o //
translated: Since it is asked, it is fully asked.

original: yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su zhus pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su zhus pa'o //
translated: Since it is fully known, it is fully inquired.

original: de'i phyir yongs su 'dri bar byas pas yongs su dris pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su 'dri bar byas pas yongs su dris pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is fully inquired, it is fully asked.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims la sogs pa zhes pa ni dkar po'i chos yongs su skyong ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims la sogs pa zhes pa ni dkar po'i chos yongs su skyong ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Morality is morality and so on. This is the quality of fully protecting virtuous dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that? And so on.

original: tshe rabs 'phos kyang zhes pa ni de'i byang gi tshe rabs de las 'das pa rnams las yang ngo //
analyzed: tshe rabs 'phos kyang zhes pa ni de'i byang gi tshe rabs de las 'das pa rnams las yang ngo //
translated: Even if reborn means in the future lives after that one.

original: yang dag par spyod pa ni sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag par spyod pa ni sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: Right conduct is the practices.

original: mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes pa ni skyes bu'i brjod pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes pa ni skyes bu'i brjod pa'i yon tan no //
translated: Delighting is desiring. This is the quality of human expression.

original: de dag la zhen pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la zhen pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those are attachment and so on.

original: 'dun pa'am sngags kyis zhes pa ni bsam pas sam brjod pas so zhes pa ni mi phyed pa nyid kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'am sngags kyis zhes pa ni bsam pas sam brjod pas so zhes pa ni mi phyed pa nyid kyi yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy aspiration or mantra‚Äù means by thought or by utterance. This is the quality of indivisibility.

original: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni skye bo mang po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ni skye bo mang po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy them‚Äù and so on is the quality of generating the roots of virtue of many beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhag par bya'o ni 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o ni 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be placed‚Äù is just by engaging.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni bsgom pa rab kyi sa yang dag par bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni bsgom pa rab kyi sa yang dag par bsgrub pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be taught‚Äù is by accomplishing the stage of highest meditation.

original: yang dag par dgod par bya ba ni brtan par byed par bya ba'o zhes pa ni dam bcas pa'i dngos po'i don bsgrubs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yang dag par dgod par bya ba ni brtan par byed par bya ba'o zhes pa ni dam bcas pa'i dngos po'i don bsgrubs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be established‚Äù is by making firm. This is the quality of accomplishing the meaning of the pledged entity.

original: de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'o //üîΩmos @133a * //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'o // mos @133a * //
translated: Thus, accomplishing the welfare of others as it has been explained.

original: pa rgya chen po can zhes te /
analyzed: pa rgya chen po can zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúOf vast aspiration‚Äù means

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sbyin pa rgya chen po sbyin pa nyid dang gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rnam par smin pa rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin cing sems can rnams kyi don du rgya chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sbyin pa rgya chen po sbyin pa nyid dang gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rnam par smin pa rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin cing sems can rnams kyi don du rgya chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs
translated: Giving extensive gifts of objects such as form, and also taking up the extensive ripening of the roots of virtue that are accumulated, and taking up the extensive ripening for the sake of sentient beings,

original: su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rgya chen po'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rgya chen po'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
translated: is the quality of taking up the extensive result.

original: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, someone‚Äù and so on.

original: lhag par dmigs par bya ba dang yang dag par 'pho bar bya ba'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rgya chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: lhag par dmigs par bya ba dang yang dag par 'pho bar bya ba'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rgya chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The object of special observation and the object of perfect transference are the quality of perfectly accomplishing the extensive benefit of others.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen this was said‚Äù and so on.

original: chung ngu na zhes pa ni de rnams kyi yongs su dag pa'i don dang phan pa la'o //
analyzed: chung ngu na zhes pa ni de rnams kyi yongs su dag pa'i don dang phan pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the very least‚Äù means in terms of the meaning of their purification and benefit.

original: tshol bar 'gyur ba la kha cig dag gis rnyed par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: tshol bar 'gyur ba la kha cig dag gis rnyed par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSome will find‚Äù means that some will find it.

original: btsal zhing ni 'di nas der song nas so //
analyzed: btsal zhing ni 'di nas der song nas so //
translated: Searching is from here to there.

original: rjes su btsal ba ni 'dir thob par 'gyur zhes thos nas so //
analyzed: rjes su btsal ba ni 'dir thob par 'gyur zhes thos nas so //
translated: Following is from hearing that it will be obtained here.

original: yongs su btsal ba ni yang dag par ro //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba ni yang dag par ro //
translated: Thoroughly searching is correctly.

original: nye bar 'ongs par 'gyur ba ni nye bar na'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'ongs par 'gyur ba ni nye bar na'o //
translated: Approaching is near.

original: nye bar gzhol bar 'gyur ba ni 'bad par gyur pas rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gzhol bar 'gyur ba ni 'bad par gyur pas rnyed pa'o //
translated: Approaching is attaining through effort.üîΩFacing is hearing without effort.

original: nye bar phyogs pa ni 'bad pa med pas thos zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: nye bar phyogs pa ni 'bad pa med pas thos zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of attaining the six perfections.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor ba rnams sems la bzhag cing 'dzin pas de'i phan yon rnams kyi le'u ste le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sbyor ba rnams sems la bzhag cing 'dzin pas de'i phan yon rnams kyi le'u ste le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the chapter on the benefits of the practice explained above, the tenth chapter.

original: // / sbyor ba la bar chad byed pa'i skyon gyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba la bar chad byed pa'i skyon gyi dbang du byas pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The faults that interrupt the practice are presented in the treatise.

original: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhi bcas pa //
analyzed: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhi bcas pa //
translated: The faults are four sets of ten,

original: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
translated: to be understood as definitely six.

original: zhes te / bzhi bcu rtsa drug po 'dir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / bzhi bcu rtsa drug po 'dir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: These forty-six are mentioned from ‚Äúthen‚Äù and so on.

original: yongs su brjod ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni sbyong pa rnam pa thams cad kyi nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su brjod ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni sbyong pa rnam pa thams cad kyi nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúcompletely‚Äù and so on indicate the characteristics of all the purifications.

original: yun ring mo zhes pa ni yun ring pos pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs nas des yun ring mo nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ni spobs pa yun ring mo'i skyon no //
analyzed: yun ring mo zhes pa ni yun ring pos pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs nas des yun ring mo nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ni spobs pa yun ring mo'i skyon no //
translated: ‚Äú For a long time‚Äù means that one will attain enlightenment after a long time, since one has completed the perfections after a long time. This is the fault of long-winded eloquence.

original: de skyes na yang zhes te /
analyzed: de skyes na yang zhes te /
translated: ‚Äú Even if it arises‚Äù means

original: rnam par g-yengs par 'gyur pa ni rgod par 'gyur ba ste /üîΩthabs la mi mkhas pas shin tu myur bar de las skyes pas nga rgyal skye la des byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas par byed nas nga rgyal gyis dman pa'i rigs su @133b skyes nas yun ring pos byang chub thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni spobs pa
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs par 'gyur pa ni rgod par 'gyur ba ste / thabs la mi mkhas pas shin tu myur bar de las skyes pas nga rgyal skye la des byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas par byed nas nga rgyal gyis dman pa'i rigs su @133b skyes nas yun ring pos byang chub thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni spobs pa
translated: ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù means agitation.

original: myur ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: myur ba'i skyon no //
translated: Through lack of skill in means, one becomes conceited by the arising of that eloquence, and through that one despises other bodhisattvas. Through that conceit, one is born into an inferior family, and one attains enlightenment after a long time. This is the fault of slow eloquence.

original: glal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: glal bar byed pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Yawning‚Äù means

original: dregs pa dang bcas pas lus brkyang ba dang rgod pa ste /
analyzed: dregs pa dang bcas pas lus brkyang ba dang rgod pa ste /
translated: ‚Äústretching‚Äù and ‚Äúagitation‚Äù through arrogance.

original: gad rgyangs byed pa dang bteg pa ste dregs pas ldang bar byed pa ste zhes pa ni lus kyi las kyi yon tan dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gad rgyangs byed pa dang bteg pa ste dregs pas ldang bar byed pa ste zhes pa ni lus kyi las kyi yon tan dang bral bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúLaughing, jumping, and rising with conceit‚Äù means being devoid of the good qualities of physical action.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDistracted‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa phan tshun dang ldan pas zhes pa ni gzhan rnams kyi dran par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phan tshun dang ldan pas zhes pa ni gzhan rnams kyi dran par byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving consciousnesses that are mutually possessed‚Äù means that one is mindful of others.

original: rang gi ni dran pa mi 'thob ces pa ste spyod lam ji ltar bde bar gnas pas brjod pas so zhes pa ni sems kyi yon tan dang bral ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: rang gi ni dran pa mi 'thob ces pa ste spyod lam ji ltar bde bar gnas pas brjod pas so zhes pa ni sems kyi yon tan dang bral ba'i skyon no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù means that one does not attain mindfulness, and ‚Äúone should speak with whatever posture is comfortable‚Äù means the fault of being devoid of the good qualities of mind.

original: phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMutually‚Äù and so on.

original: bzhad gad byed pa ni phan tshun lta bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhad gad byed pa ni phan tshun lta bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLaughing‚Äù means looking at each other.

original: tshogs pa dang mi ldan zhes pa ni ji srid du tshogs pa nyid la glegs bam kun 'phrog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs pa dang mi ldan zhes pa ni ji srid du tshogs pa nyid la glegs bam kun 'phrog par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot having an assembly‚Äù means that as long as there is an assembly, the scriptures will be taken away.

original: de srid du tshogs pa min zhes pa ni rnal 'byor la mi phan pa'i kha ton la sogs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de srid du tshogs pa min zhes pa ni rnal 'byor la mi phan pa'i kha ton la sogs pa'i skyon no //
translated: ‚ÄúAs long as there is no assembly‚Äù means the fault of recitation and so on that is not conducive to yoga.

original: bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase by me and so on.

original: de lta de ltar zhes pa ni sngon du bshad pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de lta de ltar zhes pa ni sngon du bshad pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The phrase in such and such a way refers to the above explanations.

original: nges par 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ba ni gnas par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa kha phyir phyogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ba ni gnas par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa kha phyir phyogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
translated: The phrase will not certainly come to be means will not be present. This is the error of apprehending the signs of external objects.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase Moreover and so on.

original: spangs pa ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: spangs pa ni sems kyis so //
translated: The phrase will be abandoned means by the mind.

original: bor ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
analyzed: bor ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
translated: The phrase will be discarded means by body and speech.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni bslab pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni rgyu las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni bslab pa mthar thug par 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni rgyu las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: The phrase will certainly emerge means will go to the culmination of the training. This is the error of falling away from the cause.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase For example and so on.

original: zan ni zas so //
analyzed: zan ni zas so //
translated: The phrase food means nourishment.

original: bor ba ni btang ba'o //
analyzed: bor ba ni btang ba'o //
translated: The phrase will be discarded means will be given up.

original: kham ni kha zas so //
analyzed: kham ni kha zas so //
translated: The phrase morsel means food.

original: kun chub par byed pa ni mngon par sbyor bar ro //
analyzed: kun chub par byed pa ni mngon par sbyor bar ro //
translated: The phrase will be understood means will be applied.

original: yal ga dang lo ma ni mdo sde rnams la'o //
analyzed: yal ga dang lo ma ni mdo sde rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase branches and leaves refers to the s≈´tras.

original: dul ba ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dul ba ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The phrase tamed means the faculties.

original: zhi ba ni sems pa dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni sems pa dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase peaceful means the mind is tamed.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni nges par rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni nges par rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The formation is the definite completion.üîΩThe not to be trained in is the non-apprehension of those by their own nature.

original: bslab par mi bya zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyis kyang mi dmigs pas zhes pa ni gya nom pa'i ro myang bas nyams pa'i skyon no //üîΩ'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bslab par mi bya zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyis kyang mi dmigs pas zhes pa ni gya nom pa'i ro myang bas nyams pa'i skyon no // 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe appearance is the clarity.

original: snang ba ni gsal ba dang bcas par ro //üîΩder rtogs pa ni mthong nas so //
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal ba dang bcas par ro // der rtogs pa ni mthong nas so //
translated: The realization is the seeing.üîΩ The color and shape is the color-form. The fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....

original: kha dog dang dbyibs ni kha dog gi dbyibs so zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i theg pa las nyams pa'i skyon @134a * //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs ni kha dog gi dbyibs so zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i theg pa las nyams pa'i skyon @134a * //
translated: The fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....

translated: The fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....

original: tshe 'di la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i chos la thob pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i chos la thob pa'o //
translated: The fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....

analyzed: len pa med pa ni cung zhig yongs su mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the enjoyment of the sublime is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....üîΩThe fault of the degeneration of the unsurpassed vehicle is indicated by the passage beginning with for example, just as....

original: dus rtag tu byang chub par ma gyur pa'i rtag par de'i so sor skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus rtag tu byang chub par ma gyur pa'i rtag par de'i so sor skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not permanent because it does not arise individually at all times.üîΩIt is not continuous because it does not exist individually by itself.

original: rgyun du ni so sor bdag gi dngos pos so zhes pa ni ched du bya ba las nyams pa'i skyon no zhes pa ni bcu tshan dang po'o //
analyzed: rgyun du ni so sor bdag gi dngos pos so zhes pa ni ched du bya ba las nyams pa'i skyon no zhes pa ni bcu tshan dang po'o //
translated: The fault of falling from the purpose is the first group of ten.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste shing mkhan ni shing bzo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste shing mkhan ni shing bzo ba'o //
translated: For example, a carpenter, etc.

original: ri rab kyi steng du blta na sdug ces bya ba ni brgya byin gyi gser gyi grong khyer la de'i dbus su rnam par rgyal ba zhes pa'i khang bzangs te /
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng du blta na sdug ces bya ba ni brgya byin gyi gser gyi grong khyer la de'i dbus su rnam par rgyal ba zhes pa'i khang bzangs te /
translated: On the top of Mount Meru, there is a golden city of Indra called Sudar≈õana. In the middle of that, there is a palace called Vaijayanta.

original: lo gas re rer dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: lo gas re rer dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu ste /
translated: Each side is 250 yojanas.

original: gcig tu bsdus pas dpag tshad stong la nyi ma dang zla ba ni ri rab kyi phyed kyi thad ka'i phyi rol gyi nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i shel gyi khang pa zlum po ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus pas dpag tshad stong la nyi ma dang zla ba ni ri rab kyi phyed kyi thad ka'i phyi rol gyi nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i shel gyi khang pa zlum po ste /
translated: In total, it is 1,000 yojanas. The sun and moon move in the sky outside, halfway up Mount Meru, in a circular crystal palace.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang dpag tshad lnga bcu pa'i steng /üîΩde'i dbus kyi thad ka'i tshad kyis de dag la ste /

translated: The palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.

original: 'jig rten du 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor los sgyur ba ste /
translated: The palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.

original: yang shes pa ni skyes bu med par nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang lte bar bcas pa ste /üîΩlcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser gyi rnams ji ltar rigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang shes pa ni skyes bu med par nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang lte bar bcas pa ste /üîΩlcags dang zangs dang dngul dang gser gyi rnams ji ltar rigs pa'o //
translated: The palace of the gods of the Thirty-three is one yojana in height and width, and the palace of the YƒÅma gods is two yojanas in height and width.üîΩThe palace of the gods of

original: kha dog ni 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i la sogs pa bzhin la dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i gzi brjid kyis mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i la sogs pa bzhin la dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i gzi brjid kyis mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: His complexion is like the Jambu River, etc., and his shape is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being, and his splendor overwhelms all men.

original: mthu ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can la /
analyzed: mthu ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can la /
translated: His power is that he has a halo,

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa ste /
translated: and his perfection of magical power is that he has the seven jewels:

original: 'khor lo dang / glang po dang / rta dang / bud med dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag dang / nor bu rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / glang po dang / rta dang / bud med dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag dang / nor bu rnams so //
translated: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the woman, the treasurer, the gem, and the minister.

original: rib rib por byed pa ni rmongs par byed cing yongs su mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / chung ba'i phyir ri bo de gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' la 'byung bar @134b 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rib rib por byed pa ni rmongs par byed cing yongs su mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / chung ba'i phyir ri bo de gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' la 'byung bar @134b 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: The mountain is called ‚ÄúMisty‚Äù because it is obscured by the clouds of ignorance, and because it is small.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the Bodhisattva appears‚Äù means when the Bodhisattva is born.

original: thob pa ni rnyed pa tsam gyis te /
analyzed: thob pa ni rnyed pa tsam gyis te /
translated: ‚ÄúAttainment‚Äù means merely to obtain.

original: mdor bsdus pa la sogs pa thos pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par ldog cing kha phyir bltas par 'gyur zhes pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang chos mthun pa sprul pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa la sogs pa thos pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par ldog cing kha phyir bltas par 'gyur zhes pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang chos mthun pa sprul pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: The phrase they turn away from the brief sutras, etc., and become outwardly oriented refers to the fault of falling from the emanation body, which is similar to a universal monarch.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is thus: for example, etc.

original: ro ni drug ste rdzas kyi dbye bas phan tshun sbyar ba las ni brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro ni drug ste rdzas kyi dbye bas phan tshun sbyar ba las ni brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: The six tastes are sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent. From the mutual combination of the substances, there are one hundred tastes.

original: de'i ro brgya pa'i kha zas spangs pa ni sems kyis la bor ba ni lus kyis so zhes pa ni kha zas ro brgya dang chos mthun pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no /
analyzed: de'i ro brgya pa'i kha zas spangs pa ni sems kyis la bor ba ni lus kyis so zhes pa ni kha zas ro brgya dang chos mthun pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no /
translated: The phrase the food of the one hundred tastes is abandoned means that it is mentally rejected, but physically it is not rejected. This refers to the fault of falling from the enjoyment body, which is similar to the one hundred tastes.

original: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is thus: for example, etc.

original: zab pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rtse mo'i phyir dang 'od gsal zhing dri ma med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i chos kyi sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: zab pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i rtse mo'i phyir dang 'od gsal zhing dri ma med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i chos kyi sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of falling away from the Dharma Body, which is similar to a precious jewel, is profound because it is the peak of benefiting others, and luminous and stainless.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc. refers to the following.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar rnams kyi spobs pa bcom ldan 'das ma la med pa'i phyir na sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed do zhes pa ni de dang de la spobs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar rnams kyi spobs pa bcom ldan 'das ma la med pa'i phyir na sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed do zhes pa ni de dang de la spobs pa'i skyon no //
translated: Since the Blessed Lady does not have eloquence in regard to form, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects, it causes the mind to be distracted. This is the fault of eloquence in regard to this and that.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having thus spoken, etc. refers to the following.

original: de ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brir med de /
analyzed: de ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brir med de /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is not written,

original: gzugs dang dri la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang ro gcig pas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang dri la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang ro gcig pas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from form, smell, etc., and because it exists, being of one taste with the nonexistent realm of phenomena.

original: yi ge med pa ni chos thams cad la yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni chos thams cad la yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of syllables is because all phenomena are without syllables.

original: yi ge med pa ma yin pa ni yi ge 'di rnams de'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge med pa ma yin pa ni yi ge 'di rnams de'i rgyu mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: The non-absence of syllables is because these syllables are the natural outcome of that.

original: 'di rnams kyis kyang de rnams gsal bar byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis kyang de rnams gsal bar byed pas so //
translated: Because these [syllables] also clarify that [absence of syllables].

original: de rnams kyis ni gzhan pa'i don des mtshon du med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni gzhan pa'i don des mtshon du med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by those [syllables], the meaning of others is understood through that [absence of syllables].

original: de nyid bris nas yi ge dang yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa'i skyon bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid bris nas yi ge dang yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa'i skyon bzhi'o //
translated: Having written that, there are four faults of clinging to syllables and the absence of syllables.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: yul ni ma ga dh'a la sogs pa'o //üîΩgrong ni phyug po ma yin pa rnams gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni ma ga dh'a la sogs pa'o // grong ni phyug po ma yin pa rnams gnas pa'o //
translated: The country is Magadha and so forth.üîΩThe town is where the poor live.

original: phyug po rnams gnas pa ni grong khyer ro //
analyzed: phyug po rnams gnas pa ni grong khyer ro //
translated: The city is where the rich live.

original: grong khyer nyid kyi tshong pa mang po gnas pa ni grong rdal lo //
analyzed: grong khyer nyid kyi tshong pa mang po gnas pa ni grong rdal lo //
translated: The market town is where many merchants live in the city itself.

original: ljongs ni yul gyi ming k'a sha la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ljongs ni yul gyi ming k'a sha la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The region is the circle of the country's name, such as Kashmir, etc.

original: de'i tshogs ni yul 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i tshogs ni yul 'khor ro //
translated: The assembly of that is the country.

original: rgyal @135a * //
analyzed: rgyal @135a * //
translated: The king is the lord of the country.

original: po'i pho brang yod pa'i grong khyer rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ro //
analyzed: po'i pho brang yod pa'i grong khyer rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor ro //
translated: The city where the king's palace is located is the royal palace.

original: kun ston pa ni tshig rkyang pa'i snyan dang gas so //
analyzed: kun ston pa ni tshig rkyang pa'i snyan dang gas so //
translated: The reciter is the single word.

original: la gcan ni sho gam gyi gcod pa'o //üîΩbi shi ka ni srang bar ro //
analyzed: la gcan ni sho gam gyi gcod pa'o // bi shi ka ni srang bar ro //
translated: The market is the place of taxation.üîΩThe market is the place of weighing.

original: shi bi ka ni shing gi khyogs khri'o //
analyzed: shi bi ka ni shing gi khyogs khri'o //
translated: The bier is the wooden bier.

original: 'tsho ba'i don gyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i don gyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
translated: The requisites for livelihood are the requisites for life.

original: de ltar bzhad gad dang sngon gyi byung tshul lo zhes pa ni 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon zhes pa ni bcu tshan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhad gad dang sngon gyi byung tshul lo zhes pa ni 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon zhes pa ni bcu tshan gnyis pa'o //
translated: Thus, laughter and past events are the faults of distraction in attention to going, etc. This is the second set of ten.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc. refers to the following.

original: blta bar bya ba rgyal po la sogs pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba rgyal po la sogs pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The object of seeing is attention to the king, etc.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of distraction.

original: la gcan gyi cho lo lta ba ni sho gam gyi gnas su sho 'gyed pa la sogs pa la lta ba'o //
analyzed: la gcan gyi cho lo lta ba ni sho gam gyi gnas su sho 'gyed pa la sogs pa la lta ba'o //
translated: The gambling game is the game of dice, etc. at the place of taxation. Looking is looking at it.

original: yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, etc. refers to the following.

original: me la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni thob bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: me la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni thob bar bya ba ste /
translated: The mental contemplation of fire and so on is the object to be attained.üîΩ

original: yid la byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: yid la byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of distraction by attention is to attention to fire, etc.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩbar chad byed pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / bar chad byed pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the fault of distress and taste is stated:

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o //üîΩbkur sti ni gus pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o // bkur sti ni gus pa'o //
translated: Distress is from the loss of robes, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //üîΩde rnams kyi ro myang ba ni shin tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o // de rnams kyi ro myang ba ni shin tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Taste is from excessive delight in gain, honor, and fame.

original: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pa las rnam par nyams pa rnams kyis so zhes pa ni gdung ba dang ro myang ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pa las rnam par nyams pa rnams kyis so zhes pa ni gdung ba dang ro myang ba'i skyon no //
translated: Distress is from the loss of robes, etc. by those who have lost them. Taste is from excessive delight in gain, honor, and fame.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the fault of lack of skill in means is stated:

original: thabs mkhas pa ni gang gis dman pa'i byang chub tu mi ltung ba'o zhes pa ni thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ni gang gis dman pa'i byang chub tu mi ltung ba'o zhes pa ni thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Lack of skill in means is the cause of falling into the Disciples' Nirvana.

original: de dag gis mdo sde zab mo dag las de'i lam gyi skyon no //
analyzed: de dag gis mdo sde zab mo dag las de'i lam gyi skyon no //
translated: These are the faults of the path in the profound scriptures.

original: 'dir gzhan yang zhes pa'i gzhan tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yang zhes pa'i gzhan tshig gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two other words,

original: chos nyan pa ni slob ma la /
analyzed: chos nyan pa ni slob ma la /
translated: listening to the Dharma is for the disciple,

original: chos ston pa ni bla ma'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa ni bla ma'o //
translated: teaching the Dharma is for the guru.

original: snyom las ni le lo la /
analyzed: snyom las ni le lo la /
translated: Laziness is for the lazy,

original: bya ba mang po dang ldan pa ni khyim pa rnams te /
analyzed: bya ba mang po dang ldan pa ni khyim pa rnams te /
translated: those who have many activities are householders,

original: de yang le lo 'o zhes 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de yang le lo 'o zhes 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis bcom pa'o //
translated: and that is also laziness. Thus, they are destroyed by aspiration and laziness.

original: gzhan yang gi tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gi tshig gnyis te /
translated: There are also two other words.

original: tha na zhes pa ni lhag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tha na zhes pa ni lhag pa med pa'o //
translated: At the end means without remainder.

original: snyog pa dang ldan pa'i sgra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snyog pa dang ldan pa'i sgra zhes pa'o //
translated: The word endowed is a verbal root.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni don shes pas so //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni don shes pas so //
translated: The wise one is one who knows the meaning.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa ni gnyis ka'i 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa ni gnyis ka'i 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Endowed with mindfulness is the retention of both.

original: spong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni las byed pa pos te /
analyzed: spong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni las byed pa pos te /
translated: One will abandon is by the agent of the action.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don te /
translated: It means one will go.

original: 'dir 'dun pa dang yul gzhan du 'gro bas nyams pa dang / @135b mgo smos pas go ba dang / cig shos nyid kyis nyams pa dang / rnam par spros te go ba dang / cig shos nyid kyis nyams pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir 'dun pa dang yul gzhan du 'gro bas nyams pa dang / @135b mgo smos pas go ba dang / cig shos nyid kyis nyams pa dang / rnam par spros te go ba dang / cig shos nyid kyis nyams pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: Here, degeneration through aspiration and going to another place, understanding through mere mention, degeneration through the other, understanding through elaboration, degeneration through the other, and superknowledge.

original: cig shos kyis nyams pa'o zhes pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyis nyams pa'o zhes pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of degeneration through the other is as follows.

original: de ltar bcu tshan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcu tshan gsum pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are three sets of ten.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc. refers to the following.

original: zang zing ni rdzas la de lhur len pa ni rin che bar byed pas na zhes pa 'di ni zang zing lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing ni rdzas la de lhur len pa ni rin che bar byed pas na zhes pa 'di ni zang zing lhur len pa'o //
translated: Material things are substances. Taking them to heart means making them precious. This is taking material things to heart.

original: de bzhin du rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa'o //
translated: Similarly, taking gain, etc., to heart.

original: 'dod pa chung ba ni ji tsam gyis rang nyid 'tsho ba de tsam 'dod ces pa ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba ni ji tsam gyis rang nyid 'tsho ba de tsam 'dod ces pa ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: Having few desires means desiring only what is necessary for one's own livelihood. This is having few desires.

original: chog shes pa ni lhag pa mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chog shes pa ni lhag pa mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Contentment means not desiring more.

original: rab tu dben pa ni khyim pa dang mi 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ni khyim pa dang mi 'brel ba'o //
translated: Solitude means not associating with householders.

original: de ltar nor sbyin par mi 'dod pa ni zang zing 'dod pa la sogs mi sbyin pas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nor sbyin par mi 'dod pa ni zang zing 'dod pa la sogs mi sbyin pas nyams pa'o //
translated: downfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through wanting to listen and through stinginess with the Dharma.üîΩAlso, those who want to listen...üîΩThose who want to listen are those who want sound.üîΩThose who want to give are those who give without regard for their own wealth.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, there are three downfalls:üîΩdownfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through wanting to listen and through stinginess with the Dharma.üîΩAlso, those who want to listen...

original: nyan par 'dod pa ni sgra'o //
analyzed: nyan par 'dod pa ni sgra'o //
translated: Those who want to listen are those who want sound.

original: yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa ni ltos pa med par sbyin pas so //
analyzed: yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa ni ltos pa med par sbyin pas so //
translated: Those who want to give are those who give without regard for their own wealth.

original: de ltar yang nyams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang nyams pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, there are three downfalls:üîΩdownfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through wanting to listen and through stinginess with the Dharma.üîΩAlso, those who want to listen...üîΩThose who want to listen are those who want sound.

original: dad pa dang cig shos kyis nyams pa dang / sbyin par 'dod pa dang / len par mi 'dod pas nyams pa dang / nyan par 'dod pa dang / chos la ser snas nyams pa'o gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang cig shos kyis nyams pa dang / sbyin par 'dod pa dang / len par mi 'dod pas nyams pa dang / nyan par 'dod pa dang / chos la ser snas nyams pa'o gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who want to give are those who give without regard for their own wealth.üîΩThus, there are three downfalls:üîΩdownfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through wanting to listen and through stinginess with the Dharma.üîΩAlso, those who want to listen...

original: de zhes pa ni gang zhig nyan par 'dod pa la sngon gyi skye ba rnams la dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba de la yod pas de'i des chos kyi bar chad du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni gang zhig nyan par 'dod pa la sngon gyi skye ba rnams la dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba de la yod pas de'i des chos kyi bar chad du 'gyur ba'o //
