translated: Those who want to listen are those who want sound.üîΩThose who want to give are those who give without regard for their own wealth.üîΩThus, there are three downfalls:üîΩdownfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through wanting to listen and through stinginess with the Dharma.üîΩAlso, those who want to listen...üîΩThose who want to listen are those who want sound.üîΩThose who want to give are those who give without regard for their own wealth.üîΩThus, there are three downfalls:

original: 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: downfalls through faith and its opposite, downfalls through wanting to give and not wanting to take, and downfalls through

original: so so'i tshig dang so so'i kun tu spong ba zhes pa ni mdo sde gzhan med pa des 'dod pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i tshig dang so so'i kun tu spong ba zhes pa ni mdo sde gzhan med pa des 'dod pa nyams pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeach one‚Äôs own‚Äù and ‚Äúeach one‚Äôs own rejection‚Äù is a corruption of the text, since there is no other s≈´tra.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù and so forth.

original: mi 'dod pa ni nyan par mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni nyan par mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot desiring‚Äù means not desiring to listen.

original: las ka gzhan gyi brel bas so //
analyzed: las ka gzhan gyi brel bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBeing busy with other work‚Äù means being occupied with other activities.

original: 'dir 'dod pa dang snyob las kyis nyams pa dang / gzhan 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa dang snyob las kyis nyams pa dang / gzhan 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pas nyams pa'o //
translated: Here, the corruption is by desire and laziness, and by the desire and non-desire of others.

original: de nas kyi gzhan gyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gnyid lhur len pa dang 'dod pa gnyid kyis nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi gzhan gyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gnyid lhur len pa dang 'dod pa gnyid kyis nyams pa'o //
translated: Then, the two phrases ‚Äúand so on‚Äù and so forth refer to the corruption of sleep and desire by sleep.

original: gzhan yang gi tshig gcig gis ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs nas srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gi tshig gcig gis ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs nas srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i skyon no //
translated: Moreover, the one phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the corruption of turning one‚Äôs back on existence out of fear of suffering.

original: gzhan yang tshig gcig gis ni bde 'gro'i bde ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal ba'i phyir zhes srid pa la rgyab @136a * //üîΩkyis phyogs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig gcig gis ni bde 'gro'i bde ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal ba'i phyir zhes srid pa la rgyab @136a * //üîΩkyis phyogs pa'i skyon no //
translated: Moreover, the one phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the corruption of turning one‚Äôs back on existence because the pleasures of the happy realms are also suffering.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gcig gis ni gcig tu dang 'khor lhur len pas nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gcig gis ni gcig tu dang 'khor lhur len pas nyams pa nyid do //
translated: The words and so on indicate the degeneration of the bodhisattva vow by being attached to solitude and to retinue.

original: rjes su chags pas 'dod pa dang / go skabs mi phyed pas nyams pa dang / mu ge la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro bas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pas 'dod pa dang / go skabs mi phyed pas nyams pa dang / mu ge la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro bas nyams pa'o //
translated: Degeneration by attachment to desire, by not giving an opportunity, by going to a place with famine, and by not going to a place without famine.

original: de la gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa nyid kyi bar ni bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa nyid kyi bar ni bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //
translated: Among them, being alone and being attached to a retinue are the fourth set of ten.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words and so on and so forth.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bas nyams pa'o //
translated: Degeneration by going to and not going to a place with danger.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words and so on and so forth.

original: khyim la lta ba dang bya ba mang po'i chos bstan pa rnams so sor spong ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: khyim la lta ba dang bya ba mang po'i chos bstan pa rnams so sor spong ba'i skyon no //
translated: The faults of abandoning the teachings on observing the household and having many activities.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: The words and so on and so forth.

original: dge sbyong gi cha byad can du 'ongs pa ni bdud kyis the tshom skyed pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi cha byad can du 'ongs pa ni bdud kyis the tshom skyed pa'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of generating doubt in those who come in the guise of ascetics through Mara.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words and so on and so forth.

original: sprul pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / rang nyid sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyi bdud kyis zab mo'i chos la spyod pa rnams dman pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / rang nyid sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyi bdud kyis zab mo'i chos la spyod pa rnams dman pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of the prediction to the lesser enlightenment of those who practice the profound Dharma by the Buddha's magical creation of a community of monks and himself in the form of a Buddha.

original: de ltar rab 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas gzhi'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rab 'byor zhes pa la sogs pas gzhi'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, Subhuti, and so on, speaks of the meaning of the basis.

original: bdud kyi las rnams ni mang ba ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams ni mang ba ste /
translated: The works of Mara are many.

original: de rnams la yid ches pa ni blo chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams la yid ches pa ni blo chung ba nyid do //
translated: To have confidence in them is to be of little intelligence.

original: ji ltar bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par sbyor ba de ltar sangs rgyas rnams thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par sbyor ba de ltar sangs rgyas rnams thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as Mara engages them, so all the Buddhas will protect the Bodhisattvas.

original: bdud kyi las bsal bar byed pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: bdud kyi las bsal bar byed pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter, on the elimination of the works of Mara.

original: // / mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: // / mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the characteristics, the treatise states:

original: mtshon bya gang gis shes bya ba //
analyzed: mtshon bya gang gis shes bya ba //
translated: What is to be characterized?

original: de yi mtshan nyid rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: de yi mtshan nyid rnam gsum ste //
translated: Its characteristics are threefold:

original: shes dang khyad par dang byed pa //
analyzed: shes dang khyad par dang byed pa //
translated: Knowledge, distinction, and function.

original: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon par byed //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon par byed //
translated: The essence of that is indicated.

original: ces te / mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ces te / mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics are of four kinds:

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyi rol son //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyi rol son //
translated: The arising of the Tathagatas, the nature of the world‚Äôs non-destruction, the conduct of the minds of sentient beings, and their inclusion and external manifestation.

original: mi zad pa yi rnam pa dag / chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de //
analyzed: mi zad pa yi rnam pa dag / chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de //
translated: The aspects of inexhaustibility, the great, the immeasurables, the unobservable, the unmanifest, and the inconceivable.

original: phye ba la sogs zhes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
analyzed: phye ba la sogs zhes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
translated: The divisions, and so forth, of those, and also the others.

original: de @136b bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: de @136b bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: These are the consciousnesses of suchness.

original: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya ni //
analyzed: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya ni //
translated: The realization of suchness by the Sage, and the teaching of it to others.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //üîΩshes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi // shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
translated: These are the characteristics of the knowledge of all things.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the path.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of all bases.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of all times.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of practice.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of suffering.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of origin.

original: shes pa 'di rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of cessation.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of peace.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of emptiness.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of signlessness.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of wishlessness.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the formless.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the desireless.üîΩThese are the characteristics of the knowledge of the aspects of the unconditioned.

original: zhes te / de'i sems kyis bsdus pa ni lhan cig tul phyi rol du son pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: zhes te / de'i sems kyis bsdus pa ni lhan cig tul phyi rol du son pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The mind is the mind of the bodhisattva, and together with means that the mind and the body are in unison.üîΩThe external is the external world. Distraction is the distraction of the mind.

original: rgya chen po ni yangs pa ste /
analyzed: rgya chen po ni yangs pa ste /
translated: The vast is the great.

original: 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The great is the realm of desire, which is the object of the first dhyana.

original: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa ste /üîΩ'dod pa bas gzugs khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa ste / 'dod pa bas gzugs khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great is the realm of form, which is the object of the second dhyana.

original: gang tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa la'o //
analyzed: gang tshad med pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa la'o //
translated: The immeasurable is the realm of the formless, which is the object of the third dhyana.

original: 'dir phye ba dang btsums pa de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: 'dir phye ba dang btsums pa de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Here, the opening and closing of those is by the consciousness of suchness.

original: rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid rnams te gzhan rnams la yang bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid rnams te gzhan rnams la yang bstan pa ste /
translated: The concepts are the suchnesses, and the others are also taught.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: ma zhes pa ni yum mo //
analyzed: ma zhes pa ni yum mo //
translated: The mother is the mother.

original: reg par mi gnas pa ni bde bar mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: reg par mi gnas pa ni bde bar mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Not dwelling in contact means not dwelling in bliss.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba ni yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba ni yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: The unpleasant is the pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of suffering.

original: legs par bzung ba ni legs par rgyas pas rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: legs par bzung ba ni legs par rgyas pas rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is well-taken is that which is well-nourished, because it is nourished.

original: sba ba ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: That which is hidden is that which is protected.

original: bcos pa ni sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: bcos pa ni sbyong ba ste /
translated: That which is cured is that which is purified,

original: nad sel ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nad sel ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it removes disease.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes pa ni yul dang dbang po dang shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i reg pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes pa ni yul dang dbang po dang shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i reg pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The feeling of suffering is suffering, because it is the cause of suffering, since contact arises from the union of object, sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: mi ma yin pa ni ye 'drog la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa ni ye 'drog la /
translated: The nonhuman is the demon.

original: kun tu bab pa ni thog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu bab pa ni thog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all-pervading is lightning, etc.

original: bdag gir byed pa ni rang gir 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: bdag gir byed pa ni rang gir 'gyur bar ro //
translated: The appropriated is that which is made one‚Äôs own.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a kya thub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a kya thub pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is Shakyamuni.

original: bzhugs gyur pa ni chos kyi skus so //üîΩ'tsho ba nyid bzhugs pa ste /üîΩlongs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so zhes pa ni ji srid du sku tshe bzhugs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: bzhugs gyur pa ni chos kyi skus so // 'tsho ba nyid bzhugs pa ste / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so zhes pa ni ji srid du sku tshe bzhugs pa'i bar te /
translated: The abiding is the dharma body.üîΩThe living is the enjoyment body.üîΩThe abiding is as long as the life of the body.

original: sprul pa'i skus so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus so //
translated: The abiding is the emanation body.

original: ston pa ni thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the one who causes attainment.

original: 'di nyid la zhes pa ni skyed pa po nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'di nyid la zhes pa ni skyed pa po nyid kyis te /
translated: In this very life is by the very act of generation.üîΩ The demonstrator is the one who realizes the nature of emptiness and so forth.

original: kun tu ston pa po ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos kun tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mas go skabs phye ba ste /
analyzed: kun tu ston pa po ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos kun tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das mas go skabs phye ba ste /
translated: This is the opportunity given by the Bhagavatƒ´.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the arising of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then and so forth.

original: 'jig pa ni rnam par 'jig pa ste /üîΩ'jig @137a * //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rnam par 'jig pa ste / 'jig @137a * //
translated: Destruction is complete destruction.

original: par 'gyur zhing rab tu 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par 'gyur zhing rab tu 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: It is destroyed and completely destroyed.

original: skad cig ma'i phyir dang rgyud 'gag pa'i phyir zhes pas 'jig rten te byed pa po yang ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyir dang rgyud 'gag pa'i phyir zhes pas 'jig rten te byed pa po yang ngo //
translated: Because of being momentary and because of the cessation of the continuum, it is the world and also the agent.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni yi ge rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni yi ge rnam pa la'o //
translated: The etymology is in terms of the aspects of the syllables.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni des 'dir ci zhig shin tu nges zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni des 'dir ci zhig shin tu nges zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: How is intended as What is ascertained by that here?

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Thus and so forth is the summary. This is the knowledge of the world.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, etc.

original: sems can rnams yang dag par med pa dang ngo bo nyid med pas na tshad med pa dang grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yang dag par med pa dang ngo bo nyid med pas na tshad med pa dang grangs med pa'o //
translated: Since sentient beings are utterly nonexistent and essenceless, they are immeasurable and innumerable.

original: sems can dngos po med ces pa ni sems can med pas sems can gyi spyod pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med ces pa ni sems can med pas sems can gyi spyod pa rnams kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since sentient beings are unreal, the conduct of sentient beings also does not exist.

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyang 'jig rten pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyang 'jig rten pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The world is the sentient beings, because sentient beings are the world. This is the knowledge of the conduct of the immeasurable minds of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te bsdus pa zhes pa ni sgro btags pa thams cad 'dir zad par byed pas sems rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te bsdus pa zhes pa ni sgro btags pa thams cad 'dir zad par byed pas sems rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, etc. refers to two verses. The mind is naturally included because all superimpositions are exhausted here.

original: gnas de ni 'dir zad pa la /
analyzed: gnas de ni 'dir zad pa la /
translated: That place is exhausted here.

original: de yang sems rang bzhin gyis ni mi zad pas mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems rang bzhin gyis ni mi zad pas mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since the mind is naturally inexhaustible, it is inexhaustible.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Distraction is externalized.

original: mtshan nyid med ces pa ni gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid la 'dir mi zad pa ni cha shas kyang med pas na mi zad pa dang ma bsdus pa dang ma g-yengs pa'i zhes pa ni sems bsdus pa dang g-yengs pa'i shes pa'o
analyzed: mtshan nyid med ces pa ni gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid la 'dir mi zad pa ni cha shas kyang med pas na mi zad pa dang ma bsdus pa dang ma g-yengs pa'i zhes pa ni sems bsdus pa dang g-yengs pa'i shes pa'o
translated: As for without characteristics, it is because of emptiness of intrinsic identity that there is no exhaustion here, since there is no part that is exhausted. As for not collected, not distracted, it is the mind that is collected and distracted.

original: // gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, and so on and so forth.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni de'i sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag gis so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni de'i sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag gis so //
translated: The consecration is by that mind's emptiness and compassion, which are its nature.

original: gnas pa med pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: The non-abiding is without beginning or end,

original: don dam par na 'dir don du na ngo bo nyid med pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na 'dir don du na ngo bo nyid med pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: since ultimately here there is no entity, that is, no intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir na 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid med pas 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid med pas 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no characteristic of the conditioned, there is no cessation and so on.

original: rten med pa ni dbang po drug po rnams kyis kyang de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa ni dbang po drug po rnams kyis kyang de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-support is because the six sense faculties do not perform their function with respect to it.

original: tshad med pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: It is incalculable because it is immeasurable.

original: chos kyi dbyings bzhin du don dam par na 'jig pa mi 'thad pas zad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings bzhin du don dam par na 'jig pa mi 'thad pas zad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Like the dharmadhatu, ultimately, destruction is not tenable, so there is no exhaustion.

original: gang gis de ltar mi gnas pa la sogs pas so zhes pa ni sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar mi gnas pa la sogs pas so zhes pa ni sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: By whom? By one who is not abiding in that way, and so on. This is the consciousness of the aspect of the inexhaustibility of mind.

original: mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang zhes pa'i dang ni rjes su bshad pa bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang zhes pa'i dang ni rjes su bshad pa bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The ‚Äúand‚Äù in ‚Äúinexhaustible aspect‚Äù and so on includes the following explanations.

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa @137b dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / zhum pa dang rab tu bzung ba'i shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa @137b dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / zhum pa dang rab tu bzung ba'i shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i shes pa yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of affliction and non-affliction, the consciousness of depression and great grasping, and the consciousness of that which is contaminated and uncontaminated are included.

original: de la dang po gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po gsungs pa ni /
translated: The first of these is stated

original: gzhan yang zhes pa gnyis kyis te /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa gnyis kyis te / kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: with ‚ÄúMoreover‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩAfflicted and non-afflicted means

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: afflicted by affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis dri ma can du byas pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis dri ma can du byas pa la /
translated: It is stained by the afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa de rnams med de des na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas gnag du kun tu mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa de rnams med de des na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas gnag du kun tu mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The absence of afflictions is the absence of those afflictions. Therefore, because of the absence of afflictions, it does not dwell in the black.

original: ke ta'i sgra ni gnas ma sems kyi chos nyid la ni yang dag par gnas pa med de de rnams ni glo bur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ke ta'i sgra ni gnas ma sems kyi chos nyid la ni yang dag par gnas pa med de de rnams ni glo bur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúabides‚Äù means that it does not truly abide in the reality of the mind, because those are adventitious.

original: rang bzhin zhes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma med pa'i rtag par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma med pa'i rtag par kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means that the reality of the mind is the nature itself, which is naturally luminous, stainless, and permanent. ‚ÄúAfflicted‚Äù and ‚Äúunafflicted‚Äù refer to the consciousnesses that are afflicted and unafflicted.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /üîΩ'di zhes pa ni gnas med pa ni kun tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te / 'di zhes pa ni gnas med pa ni kun tu gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù are two words.üîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means that it does not dwell in the absence of a dwelling.

original: gnas med pa nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas med pa nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: It dwells in the absence of a dwelling.

original: sems gnas pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes pa ni sems gnas pa dang rab tu gzung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes pa ni sems gnas pa dang rab tu gzung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The mind is not by nature still. This is the knowledge of apprehending the mind as still.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: And also, there are two words.

original: zag pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa rnams la /
analyzed: zag pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa rnams la /
translated: The defilements are false imagination.

original: de dang sbyor bas zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de dang sbyor bas zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Because it is connected with that, it is associated with defilements,

original: gang du yod pa ma yin pa'i rtog pas yod pa min pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yod pa ma yin pa'i rtog pas yod pa min pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it imagines the nature of desire, form, and formlessness, which do not exist, through false imagination.

original: dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid gzhol ba la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid gzhol ba la /
translated: Non-entity is the inclination towards emptiness.

original: 'di rnams kyis zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa la gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa la gzhol ba'o //
translated: By these, there is the inclination towards the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir na lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is spontaneous,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams su rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams su rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in the nature of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de la zag pa med pa'o zhes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems kyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'o zhes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems kyis shes pa'o //
translated: Therein, the absence of defilements is the knowledge of the mind as associated with defilements and as free from defilements.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two phrases ‚ÄúMoreover, ‚Äù and so on,

original: gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and ‚Äúthat which, ‚Äù and so on,

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: indicate that the mind‚Äôs possession of desire is not the nature of the mind.

original: de'i phyir na 'dod chags med pa dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa gnyis sems dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dod chags med pa dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa gnyis sems dang bral ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind‚Äôs being without desire and the mind‚Äôs being with desire are both separate from the mind.

original: stong pa nyid pas de ltar @138a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid pas de ltar @138a * //
translated: Since they are empty, in that way

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa kho na 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa kho na 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do zhes pa'i don to zhes pa ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: the mind that is with desire is itself without desire. This is the meaning. This is the knowledge of the mind‚Äôs being with desire and being without desire.üîΩThe two phrases ‚ÄúMoreover, ‚Äù and so on,

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: indicate the knowledge of the mind‚Äôs being with hatred and being without hatred.üîΩThe two phrases ‚ÄúMoreover, ‚Äù and so on,

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
translated: indicate the knowledge of the mind‚Äôs being with delusion and being without delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi sems myong bas bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags la sogs pa can du ni ji ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi sems myong bas bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags la sogs pa can du ni ji ltar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could the Bhagavat come to possess attachment and so on through experiencing the minds of others who possess attachment and so on?

original: gang du rang gi bag chags kyi mthu las 'ongs pa'i 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa can du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang du rang gi bag chags kyi mthu las 'ongs pa'i 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa can du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He would come to possess attachment and so on through attachment arisen from his own latent propensities,

original: gzhan gyi bag chags kyi stobs las 'ongs pas ni ma yin pas na bcom ldan 'das myong bar byed pa por nye bar gzhag par mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bag chags kyi stobs las 'ongs pas ni ma yin pas na bcom ldan 'das myong bar byed pa por nye bar gzhag par mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: but not through the power of others‚Äô latent propensities. Therefore it is not established that the Bhagavat is the experiencer.

original: tshad med pa dang zhes pa bstan bcos su rjes su dang bshad pa ni /üîΩde ltar rgya chen po ma yin pa dang rgya chen po'i shes pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang zhes pa bstan bcos su rjes su dang bshad pa ni / de ltar rgya chen po ma yin pa dang rgya chen po'i shes pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang ste /
translated: The treatise commentary explains immeasurable as follows:

original: chen por gyur pa'i shes pa rnams bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa'i shes pa rnams bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Thus it has the meaning of subsuming the consciousnesses that are not vast and vast, that are not great and great.

original: 'dir gzhan yang tshig gnyis ni kun nas slong ba ni rgya chen po dang skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yang tshig gnyis ni kun nas slong ba ni rgya chen po dang skye ba ste /
translated: Here, moreover, the two terms motivation and birth are vast.

original: de kho na nyid du ni de dang sbyor ba so sor bkag pas kun slong ba med pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni de dang sbyor ba so sor bkag pas kun slong ba med pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: In reality, the application of that is individually prohibited.üîΩThe arising of the very extensive is prohibited.

original: shin tu 'phro zhing skye ba so sor bkag pa kun nas slong ba med pa dang mi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu 'phro zhing skye ba so sor bkag pa kun nas slong ba med pa dang mi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application without motivation is without motivation and without application.

original: chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis so //
translated: By the nature of things.

original: mi 'bri ba ni bsal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'bri ba ni bsal ba med pa ste /
translated: The non-decrease is the non-elimination.

original: de'i phyir rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not extensive.

original: mi 'phel bas na de'i phyir rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phel bas na de'i phyir rgya chen po ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it does not increase, therefore it is not extensive.

original: rnam par grol ba med pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba med pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The absence of liberation is the absence of special progress.

original: rnam par bral ba med pa'i phyir dang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par bral ba med pa'i phyir dang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of separation and the absence of transformation.

original: sems rnams zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems rnams zhes pa ste /
translated: The minds means the minds of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems kyi chos nyid la'o zhes pa ni sems rgya chen po dang rgya chen po ma yin pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid la'o zhes pa ni sems rgya chen po dang rgya chen po ma yin pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: In the reality of mind means in the knowledge of the extensive and non-extensive mind.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis te //
translated: Moreover, the two phrases beginning with moreover.

original: rgyang ring po nas drung du 'gro ba dang 'ong pa dang drung nas rgyang ring por 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang yongs su mi 'gro bas na ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas drung du 'gro ba dang 'ong pa dang drung nas rgyang ring por 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang yongs su mi 'gro bas na ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is not understood because of going from far away to near, and coming from near to far, and not going at all.

original: de rnams med pas na chen por gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams med pas na chen por gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of those, it is not a great state.

original: sems de dag mnyam pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pas mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems de dag mnyam pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pas mnyam pa ste /
translated: The sameness of those minds is sameness by the sameness of the absence of essence.

original: mnyam pa ni de rnams dang rang @138b bzhin gyis te /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni de rnams dang rang @138b bzhin gyis te /
translated: Sameness is by their own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa'o zhes pa ni chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang chen por gyur pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa'o zhes pa ni chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang chen por gyur pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúit is by nature sameness‚Äù is the knowledge of the mind that is not a great state and the mind that is a great state.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the mind is not supported by anything.

original: rten med pa'i phyir ni sems kyi chos nyid kyis te //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ni sems kyi chos nyid kyis te //
translated: Because of the absence of a support, it is by the reality of the mind.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i dang / rnam par shes pa rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i dang / rnam par shes pa rnams bzung ste /
translated: The knowledge of the mind that is not in equipoise and the mind that is in equipoise, the knowledge of the mind that is liberated and the mind that is not liberated, and the knowledge of the mind that is conscious and the mind that is not conscious are taken.

original: 'dir gsungs pa ni yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa ni yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: Here, the two words ‚Äúalso‚Äù are stated.

original: de yang rten med pa'o zhes pa dang / tshad med pa'i zhes pa ni sems tshad med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rten med pa'o zhes pa dang / tshad med pa'i zhes pa ni sems tshad med pa shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the words ‚Äúwithout support‚Äù and ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù refer to the knowledge of immeasurable minds.

original: bstan bcos su rnam shes dang zhes pa'i rang gis ni sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa'i shes pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos su rnam shes dang zhes pa'i rang gis ni sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa'i shes pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: In the treatise, the words ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù and so on refer to the knowledge of visible and invisible phenomena, the knowledge of obstructed and unobstructed phenomena, the knowledge of superior and non-superior phenomena,

original: mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rnams bzung ste /
translated: the knowledge of equipoise and nonequipoise, and the knowledge of liberated and unliberated phenomena.

original: 'dir gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: Here, the two words ‚Äúalso‚Äù are stated.

original: mnyam pa ni bltar med pa la blta bar bya ba de rnams de ltar bstan du med pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni bltar med pa la blta bar bya ba de rnams de ltar bstan du med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEqual‚Äù means that which is invisible is seen. Those are taught to be invisible.

original: gang du sems kyi rang bzhin ni sems kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang du sems kyi rang bzhin ni sems kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Where the nature of mind is the absence of the nature of mind.

original: de nyid kho na 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa'i dbus kyi tshig phyis pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kho na 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ces pa'i dbus kyi tshig phyis pas so //
translated: The middle word own-being is omitted.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rig pa na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sems kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rig pa na /
translated: Because of the absence of characteristics means that when the characteristic of mind is known,

original: don dam par de gang du med pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i ngo bo la don phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa des dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de gang du med pa'i phyir dang dngos po'i ngo bo la don phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa des dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not ultimately found anywhere, and it is devoid of that superimposition of the nature of entities in a distorted way.

original: spyan gsum ni sha dang lha dang shes rab kyi'o //
analyzed: spyan gsum ni sha dang lha dang shes rab kyi'o //
translated: The three eyes are the flesh eye, the divine eye, and the eye of wisdom.

original: thams cad la zhes pa ni chos dang sangs rgyas kyis kyang zhes pa ni sems bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes pa ni chos dang sangs rgyas kyis kyang zhes pa ni sems bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: All means that even the Dharma and the Buddha are also known.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two words also and again are used.

original: med pa zhes pa ni med cing yod pa ma yin pa la yod pa nyid du rgyud las 'khor ba thog ma med par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: med pa zhes pa ni med cing yod pa ma yin pa la yod pa nyid du rgyud las 'khor ba thog ma med par brtags pa ste /
translated: Nonexistent means that what does not exist and is not existent is imagined in the continuum as existent, and cyclic existence is imagined to be beginningless.

original: gang don dam pa stong pa nyid de de'i phyir na dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur ba ste stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang don dam pa stong pa nyid de de'i phyir na dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur ba ste stong pa'o //
translated: That which is ultimate emptiness is therefore empty of being under the power of an object.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is obstructed because it is harmed by valid cognition.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang yod pa dang med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa dang gnyis dang yang dag pa dang bden pa nyid du @139a * //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang yod pa dang med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa dang gnyis dang yang dag pa dang bden pa nyid du @139a * //
translated: It is permanent and impermanent, existent and nonexistent, and the two aspects of apprehended and apprehender.

original: sgro btags pa de med pas gnyis su med pa yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: sgro btags pa de med pas gnyis su med pa yang dag pa ste /
translated: Since that superimposition does not exist, it is nondual and real.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par ni ma byung ma skyes shing kun tu 'byung ba gzhan du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par ni ma byung ma skyes shing kun tu 'byung ba gzhan du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Because ultimately it does not occur, is not born, and does not arise, and dependently arisen in the relative.

original: de ltar na tshad ma rnams kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma rnams kyis mi gnod pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, because it is not harmed by valid cognition, it is unobstructed.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge that is obstructed and unobstructed.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: There are two more phrases.

original: gang zhes pa ni bla na yod pa yang bla na yod pa min te de la rlom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhes pa ni bla na yod pa yang bla na yod pa min te de la rlom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúhighest‚Äù is not even the highest, because there is no conceit about it.

original: rdul phra mo tsam yang zhes pa ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i bden pa myong ba yod ces pa gang brtags pa de la rdul phra mo tsam yang nye bar dmigs su med de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdul phra mo tsam yang zhes pa ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i bden pa myong ba yod ces pa gang brtags pa de la rdul phra mo tsam yang nye bar dmigs su med de ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot even an atom‚Äù means that the experience of the truth of nonduality, free from object and subject, which is imagined to exist, is not even observed as an atom, because it is essenceless.

original: 'dir gsungs pa ni spros pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa ni spros pa med ces pa'o //
translated: What is stated here is ‚Äúwithout conceptual elaboration.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du nye bar mi dmigs pa ni bla ma'i phyir bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar mi dmigs pa ni bla ma'i phyir bla na med pa ste /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúunobservable‚Äù is the highest because of the highest teacher.

original: dbus kyi tshig phyis pa'o zhes pa ni sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi tshig phyis pa'o zhes pa ni sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe middle word is omitted‚Äù means the cognition of the highest and the nonhighest mind.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù is two words. ‚ÄúEquality‚Äù is the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: des mnyam zhing de nyid du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: des mnyam zhing de nyid du 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is equalized and enters that.üîΩ‚ÄúNot so‚Äù is

original: de ltar min pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar min pa zhes pa ste /
translated: It is not like that.üîΩ

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i mi mnyam pa ni mi mnyam par 'gro zhing ro sna tshogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i mi mnyam pa ni mi mnyam par 'gro zhing ro sna tshogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The unequal and equal unequal is unequal movement, because of the variety of tastes.

original: de'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúnot in equipoise‚Äù

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang bzhag pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang bzhag pa'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
translated: refers to the consciousness of a mind that is not in equipoise and is in equipoise.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two words ‚Äúfurthermore‚ÄùüîΩrefer to the consciousness of a mind that is not liberated and is liberated.

original: rnam par ma grol ba ni kun rdzob tu glo bur gyi sgrib pa'i 'ching ba yod pas la /
analyzed: rnam par ma grol ba ni kun rdzob tu glo bur gyi sgrib pa'i 'ching ba yod pas la /
translated: The not liberated is not liberated by the nature of things because of the existence of the bondage of adventitious obscurations in the conventional.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The liberated is liberated by the nature of things.

original: gang du dngos po med pa dang / dngos po yod pa nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag de ni de ltar med pa'i phyir zhes ngo bo nyid dang bral bas rnam par grol ba'o zhes pa ni rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang du dngos po med pa dang / dngos po yod pa nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag de ni de ltar med pa'i phyir zhes ngo bo nyid dang bral bas rnam par grol ba'o zhes pa ni rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i sems kyi shes pa'o //
translated: Since there is no entity and the nature of things is free from the existence of entities, it is said that ‚Äúit is thus non-existent,‚Äù and ‚Äúliberated‚Äù refers to the consciousness of a mind that is not liberated and is liberated.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúfurthermore‚Äù and so on.

original: bltar med pa ni don dam par so sor rang gis rig par byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar med pa ni don dam par so sor rang gis rig par byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not seen because it is not to be individually cognized ultimately.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not to be cognized because it is not to be cognized by others.

original: gzung du med pa ni rang dang gzhan gnyi gas so //
analyzed: gzung du med pa ni rang dang gzhan gnyi gas so //
translated: It is not apprehended because it is not apprehended by either oneself or others.

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes pa ni sems can gyi bdag nyid kyis 'jig rten na'o zhes pa ni bltar med pa'i sems kyi shes @139b pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes pa ni sems can gyi bdag nyid kyis 'jig rten na'o zhes pa ni bltar med pa'i sems kyi shes @139b pa'o //
translated: The world is the world of sentient beings. The mind is not seen in the world.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa'i tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúand also‚Äù are also.

original: phye ba ni yod pa la mi mthong ba'i tshul gyis kun tu gnas pa'o zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni grangs can gyi'o //
analyzed: phye ba ni yod pa la mi mthong ba'i tshul gyis kun tu gnas pa'o zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni grangs can gyi'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the opening is the existence of the self that is not seen in the mode of not seeing.

original: btsums pa ni dgag pa ste /
analyzed: btsums pa ni dgag pa ste /
translated: The closing is the negation.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jig rten zhes pa ni rgyang 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jig rten zhes pa ni rgyang 'phen pa'o //
translated: The LokƒÅyatas say that the world is the totality of all.

original: kun tu phye ba ni de dag 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu phye ba ni de dag 'dus pa ste /
translated: The opening is the collection of those.

original: 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir dang tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gcer bu pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir dang tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir zhes pa ni gcer bu pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of abiding as one with the arising and non-arising‚Äù is the Jaina.

original: rab tu bshad pa ni de dag dgag pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu bshad pa ni de dag dgag pa ste /
translated: The explanation is the refutation of those:

original: 'byung ba yang ma yin la mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba yang ma yin la mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNeither arising nor non-arising‚Äù is the LokƒÅyata.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa ni gang zag smra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa ni gang zag smra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNeither the same nor different‚Äù is the person-proponents.

original: de ltar na btags pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na btags pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the imputed and so forth should be understood as appropriate.

original: de thams cad ni phung po lnga po la brten pa'o zhes pa ni phye ba dang btsums pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad ni phung po lnga po la brten pa'o zhes pa ni phye ba dang btsums pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll of those are based on the five aggregates‚Äù is the consciousness of opening and closing.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni de bzhin nyid dang de'i bdag nyid du shes pas ni de bzhin nyid kyis rnam pa'i phye ba dang / btsums pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni de bzhin nyid dang de'i bdag nyid du shes pas ni de bzhin nyid kyis rnam pa'i phye ba dang / btsums pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of form and so forth are the consciousness of opening and closing in terms of suchness and its nature.

original: de ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, ‚Äù and so forth.

original: de bzhin nyid du rab tu shes par byed cing de bzhin nyid gcig pa can du rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du rab tu shes par byed cing de bzhin nyid gcig pa can du rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: One should understand it as suchness and establish it as the sameness of suchness.

original: 'di rnam pa rgya chen pos gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnam pa rgya chen pos gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is stated in an extensive way:

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang du ma dang gcig nyid dang du ma nyid de dag dang bral ba nyid de de dag ni dngos pa'i chos kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang du ma dang gcig nyid dang du ma nyid de dag dang bral ba nyid de de dag ni dngos pa'i chos kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is free from entity and nonentity, from one and many, and from plurality, because it is the nature of entities.

original: tha dad pa dgag pa tsam ni de'i gcig pa nyid ces pa'i don te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dgag pa tsam ni de'i gcig pa nyid ces pa'i don te /
translated: The mere negation of difference is the meaning of its oneness.

original: gang du du ma'i phyir dang sna tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes gcig nyid dang / du ma nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dang / zad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang du du ma'i phyir dang sna tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes gcig nyid dang / du ma nyid dang bral ba'i phyir dang / zad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Where there is no multiplicity and no variety, it is free from one and many, because it is unborn in reality, and because it is inexhaustible.

original: zad pa ni phri ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni phri ba'o //
translated: Exhaustion is subtraction.

original: de dang ldan pa rnams kyi mi dang glang po dang rta la sogs pa rnams su tha dad par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa rnams kyi mi dang glang po dang rta la sogs pa rnams su tha dad par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma yin la /
translated: Those who possess it are different as humans, elephants, horses, and so on, but they are not like space.

original: de bzhin nyid la ni gnas skabs tha dad pas kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ni gnas skabs tha dad pas kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Also, the reality of the ultimate is not different due to different situations, because it is immutable.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la ni de la dngos po'i chos kyi dbye ba med de gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la ni de la dngos po'i chos kyi dbye ba med de gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the character of realitylessness, there is no division of things, because it is nondual.

original: dbyig pa gcig bcad kyang du mar 'gyur ba bzhin du de ltar phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe @140a * //üîΩna ; gsungs pa ni gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes te /
analyzed: dbyig pa gcig bcad kyang du mar 'gyur ba bzhin du de ltar phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe @140a * // na ; gsungs pa ni gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes te /
translated: If it were so, then the reality of the aggregates, etc. would be different, just as when one stick is cut, many sticks result.üîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúBecause it is nondual.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir des gcod pa la sbyor ba med ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir des gcod pa la sbyor ba med ces pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that because of realitylessness, there is no application of cutting it.

original: 'jig rten kun tu ston par 'gyur zhes pa ni de gzhan la bstan pa shes pa'o zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid mngon par byang chub pa gzhan la bstan pa'i shes pa'o zhes pa ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun tu ston par 'gyur zhes pa ni de gzhan la bstan pa shes pa'o zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid mngon par byang chub pa gzhan la bstan pa'i shes pa'o zhes pa ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The treatise states:üîΩEmptiness, the absence of characteristics,üîΩThe abandonment of wishes,üîΩThe non-arising, non-ceasing, and so forth,üîΩThe non-disturbance of reality,

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan ma med nyid la //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan ma med nyid la //
translated: The non-composition, non-conceptuality,üîΩAnd the absence of characteristics in differentiation,

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
translated: The section on the knowledge of the path

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
translated: Includes the characteristics of knowledge.

original: zhes bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: zhes bstan bcos las te /
translated: As stated in the treatise.

original: lam shes nyid kyi shes pa ni rgyu la /
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi shes pa ni rgyu la /
translated: The knowledge of the knowledge of the path is in the cause.

original: shes pa la ltos pa ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa la ltos pa ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: The reliance on knowledge is aspiration.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, it is stated:

original: de nas yang lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, again, ≈öakra, Lord of the Gods... and so forth.

original: chos zhes pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Dharma means knowledge.

original: 'dir shes pa rnams kyis de'i dmigs bya gzhan brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir shes pa rnams kyis de'i dmigs bya gzhan brjod de /
translated: Here, the other objects of those knowledges are stated.

original: de bshad pas kyang de rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bshad pas kyang de rtogs pa ste /
translated: By explaining them, they are understood.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la gcig pa'i tshig ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la gcig pa'i tshig ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúemptiness, etc.‚Äù are singular because they have the same object.

original: mtshan nyid rnams zhes pa ni mang ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams zhes pa ni mang ba'i tshig ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúcharacteristics‚Äù is plural.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad par phye bas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad par phye bas so //
translated: Because they are distinguished as different characteristics.

original: gzhag ces pa ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gzhag ces pa ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means established.

original: 'jig rten gyi brda las don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgro'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi brda las don dam par yod pa ni ma yin no zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgro'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the door of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is that ultimately there is no existence, but conventionally there is existence.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad ni gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad ni gcig tu byas te /
translated: The eight beginning with non-arising are taken as one.

original: stong pa nyid tsam gyi phyir la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid tsam gyi phyir la /
translated: Because of mere emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Emptiness is just the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa la ni stong pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa la ni stong pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In the absence of intrinsic nature, emptiness does not arise.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Nor is there any cessation,üîΩor any affliction,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩrnam par byang bar gyur pa yod pa ma yin zhing srid pa med pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am / rnam par byang bar gyur pa yod pa ma yin zhing srid pa med pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa la /
translated: or any purification.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Emptiness is the dharmadhatu,

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the cause of the dharmas of the Aryas.

original: rtag par de bzhin no zhes pas de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rtag par de bzhin no zhes pas de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is thusness because it is always thus.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-differentiation because it is unchanging.üîΩHow is it not impermanent, painful, empty,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa can ji ltar min zhes pa ni @140b 'bri ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa can ji ltar min zhes pa ni @140b 'bri ba la /
translated: and insubstantial?

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir mi gnas shing nam mkha' dang 'dra bas bsdus kyang ma bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gnas shing nam mkha' dang 'dra bas bsdus kyang ma bzhag pa ste /
translated: Because it is not established by being included, like space, since it does not abide.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i grangs kyis ma yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i grangs kyis ma yin zhing gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the number of forms, etc., nor by the characteristics of forms, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni rang nyid kyis med pa'i phyir na de rnams la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni rang nyid kyis med pa'i phyir na de rnams la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since forms and so forth are not themselves, they also do not have the characteristics of forms and so forth.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du de la brten pa ma yin zhes pas de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du de la brten pa ma yin zhes pas de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence, suffering, and so forth are not the essence of forms and so forth, and they are not based on them, and thus they do not exist in that way.

original: byis pas yongs su brtags pa'o zhes pas gzung du med do zhes pa ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas yongs su brtags pa'o zhes pas gzung du med do zhes pa ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Imagined by fools‚Äù means that they are ungraspable. This is the knowledge of non-arising and non-ceasing.

original: 'di dag ma bzhag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ma bzhag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú These are not established‚Äù and so forth.

original: bskyod pa zhes pa ni rnam par dkrugs pa'am gnod par ro zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa zhes pa ni rnam par dkrugs pa'am gnod par ro zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Shaken‚Äù means disturbed or harmed. This is the knowledge of the undistracted true nature.

original: 'di dag ni gang gis kyang lag gis ma bzhag ces pa la sogs pas ni 'dus ma byas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gang gis kyang lag gis ma bzhag ces pa la sogs pas ni 'dus ma byas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú These are not placed by anyone with the hand‚Äù and so forth is the knowledge of the unconditioned.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the venerable one, and so forth.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni rnam par rtog par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni rnam par rtog par ma byas pa'o //
translated: The full enlightenment is the non-conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir zab mo'o zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab mo'o zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the profound is the non-conceptual intuition.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes pa'i chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba byas pa'o zhes pa ni rab tu dbye ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes pa'i chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba byas pa'o zhes pa ni rab tu dbye ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, etc. , are the intuition free from attachment, the intuition unobstructed as to all things, and the intuition of the perfection of wisdom itself, which is analyzed as to the characteristics of the conventional.

original: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The intuition free from attachment, etc. ,

original: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod yul te /
translated: The intuition free from attachment is the sphere of non-apprehension.üîΩThose who abide in that, the characteristics of form, etc. , are ultimately non-apprehended.

original: de la gnas pa rnams kyang don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni dmigs pa med pa'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa rnams kyang don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni dmigs pa med pa'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the absence of characteristics.

original: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
analyzed: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
translated: It is based on one‚Äôs own Dharma.

original: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
translated: The place, the respect, the guru, the pleasing, the worship of that, the absence of action, the knowledge of all, the teaching of the unseen, the emptiness of the world, the expression, the knowledge, the manifestation,

original: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: the teaching of the inconceivable, and the peace itself.

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
translated: In the cessation of the world‚Äôs perceptions,

original: rnam mpa kun mkhyen tshul @141a * //
analyzed: rnam mpa kun mkhyen tshul @141a * //
translated: by the method of knowing all aspects,

original: gyis ni // shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: gyis ni // shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: it is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: zhes bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: zhes bstan bcos las te /
translated: Thus it is taught in the treatise.

original: shes pa zhes pa ni thams cad 'brel lo //
analyzed: shes pa zhes pa ni thams cad 'brel lo //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù is related to everything.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, it is said:

original: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how?‚Äù and so on.

original: chos zhes pa ni mdor bstan la /
analyzed: chos zhes pa ni mdor bstan la /
translated: ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù is the brief teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPraj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ‚Äù is the extensive explanation.

original: mi gnas pas zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pas so zhes pa ni rang gi chos la brten cing gnas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pas zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pas so zhes pa ni rang gi chos la brten cing gnas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of non-abiding means because of non-attachment, and refers to the cognition that is based on and abides in one's own Dharma.

original: chos la zhes pa ni chos la gus par byed pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos la zhes pa ni chos la gus par byed pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the Dharma refers to the cognition that is respectful toward the Dharma.

original: bla na med pa ni bla ma'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni bla ma'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase unsurpassed refers to the cognition of the guru.

original: rjed par zhes pa ni mnyes pa'i shes pa'o ;
analyzed: rjed par zhes pa ni mnyes pa'i shes pa'o ;
translated: The phrase to be revered refers to the cognition of pleasing.

original: / mchod par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / mchod par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase to be worshipped and so forth.

original: rab tu bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mchod par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mchod par shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase to be fully accomplished by thorough meditation refers to the cognition of worship.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni byed pa po med pa nyid kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni byed pa po med pa nyid kyi shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase Furthermore, and so forth, refers to the cognition of the absence of an agent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun tu 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun tu 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase the perfection of wisdom, and so forth, refers to the cognition of engagement.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra gnyis pa ni ji ltar yang sngon du'o //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra gnyis pa ni ji ltar yang sngon du'o //
translated: Having said this, the second phrase beginning with the venerable one is as before.

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid de'i phyir shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid de'i phyir shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are emptiness. Therefore, there is no knower and no seer.

original: mi gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since it does not abide in the mode of existence or nonexistence,

original: 'dir shes pa dang gnas med pas shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa dang gnas med pas shes pa po med cing mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: here, since there is no cognition or abode, there is no knower and no seer.

original: 'dir de kho na nyid du ni yang dag pa'i chos rtogs nas 'jig rten ma mthong ba nyid ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir de kho na nyid du ni yang dag pa'i chos rtogs nas 'jig rten ma mthong ba nyid ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Here, in reality, having realized the true Dharma, the nonseeing of the world is seeing.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar snang ba nyid kyi dngos po'o zhes pa ni ma mthong ba ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar snang ba nyid kyi dngos po'o zhes pa ni ma mthong ba ston pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Conventionally, things are just as they appear. This is the cognition that teaches nonseeing.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for ‚Äújust as,‚Äù and so on,

original: 'jig rten ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces da ltar 'jig rten las gsal bar byed /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces da ltar 'jig rten las gsal bar byed /
translated: the world, which has the character of the five aggregates, is clarified right now as emptiness and essencelessness.

original: de ltar shes par byed cing de ltar mthong bar byed pa ni gdul bar bya ba rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas skyed par byed do zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam
analyzed: de ltar shes par byed cing de ltar mthong bar byed pa ni gdul bar bya ba rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas skyed par byed do zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam
translated: Thus, the one who causes to understand and the one who causes to see, in accordance with the order, generates in those to be trained the knowledge that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: par gsal bar byed pa shes pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: par gsal bar byed pa shes pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of seeing that is the direct perception of the knowledge that illuminates the aspects of emptiness.

original: dbang rten du gyur pa zhes pa'am kha cig ste /
analyzed: dbang rten du gyur pa zhes pa'am kha cig ste /
translated: The one who is the basis of the sense faculties, or some say,

original: dbang rten la gnas pa'i phyir mthong ba po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbang rten la gnas pa'i phyir mthong ba po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the one who is the basis of the sense faculties, is the meaning of the one who sees.

original: de ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i @141b ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i @141b ston pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the inconceivable world is the knowledge of the inconceivable teacher.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni zhi ba nyid ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni zhi ba nyid ston pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the one who teaches peace is the knowledge of the teacher.

original: de ltar 'jig rten dben pa ni stong pa la 'jig rten ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi 'du shes de'i rnam par dag cing 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dben pa ni stong pa la 'jig rten ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi 'du shes de'i rnam par dag cing 'gags pa ste /
translated: Thus, the world is empty, the world is the perception of the world, its purification and cessation.

original: de ltar na stong pa la gang du 'jig rten gyi dbye ba 'di rnams gzung ba 'di rnams yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa la gang du 'jig rten gyi dbye ba 'di rnams gzung ba 'di rnams yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in emptiness, these divisions of the world and these things that are apprehended would not exist.üîΩThe world and the world beyond are taught to be thus equal.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol de ltar mnyam par bstan te zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi 'du shes 'gog pa'i shes pa ste /
