analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa ni ngo bo nyid du'o // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste / rnam par brtags pa nyid ni dmigs pa med do //
translated: not existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,

original: gzhol ba dang bab pa dang 'bab @147b pa ni sgra'i rten gyi don la ste /
analyzed: gzhol ba dang bab pa dang 'bab @147b pa ni sgra'i rten gyi don la ste /
translated: not existent nor non-existent,

original: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi dbye bas so //üîΩrgyud ces pa ni sems kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi dbye bas so // rgyud ces pa ni sems kyi rgyud do //
translated: not existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,üîΩnot existent nor non-existent,

original: nam mkha' la gzhol ba zhes pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gzhol ba zhes pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'o //
translated: not existent nor non-existent,

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus,üîΩin the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: the rest is self-evident.

original: de ltar nam mkha' lta bu nyid la gang du yul dang dus kyi tshad gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' lta bu nyid la gang du yul dang dus kyi tshad gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is immeasurable because it is like space, and cannot be grasped in terms of a measure of place or time.

original: de nyid tshad dang bral bas tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid tshad dang bral bas tshad med pa ste /
translated: It is immeasurable because it is free from measure.

original: de ni gzugs nas ni srid du mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de ni gzugs nas ni srid du mi gnas pa yang ma yin zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: It is not non-abiding in form, up to it is not non-abiding in existence.

original: thob pa ni tshigs kyi lam la mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba'i lam mo//
analyzed: thob pa ni tshigs kyi lam la mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba'i lam mo//
translated: Attainment is the path of preparation, which is the clear realization of the path.

original: khong du chud pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Understanding is the path of seeing.

original: lam ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa la dmigs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa la dmigs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path is the mundane path of meditation that focuses on the mundane dhyanas and formless states.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The result of the path is the supramundane path of meditation.

original: ye shes ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i chung ngu'i lam mo rnam par shes pa ni chung ngu'i 'bring la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bring gi lam mo //
analyzed: ye shes ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i chung ngu'i lam mo rnam par shes pa ni chung ngu'i 'bring la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bring gi lam mo //
translated: Wisdom is the small path of the nature of the small and so on. Consciousness is the medium path of the characteristics of the medium and so on.

original: skye ba ni chen po'i chung ngu'i la sogs pa'i ngo bo chen po'i lam mo //
analyzed: skye ba ni chen po'i chung ngu'i la sogs pa'i ngo bo chen po'i lam mo //
translated: Birth is the great path of the nature of the small of the great and so on.

original: 'jig pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs kyi sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs kyi sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: Destruction is the path of preparation, the method for abandoning afflictions on the path of meditation.

original: 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pas rnam par grol ba thob pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pas rnam par grol ba thob pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: Arising is the uninterrupted path that obtains liberation through abandoning afflictions.

original: 'grib pa ni nyon mongs pas dben pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni nyon mongs pas dben pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: Diminution is the path of liberation that manifests the wisdom that is free of afflictions.

original: 'gags pa ni sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa spong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: Cessation is the special path that is the nature of the path of preparation, the uninterrupted path, and the path of liberation that abandons obscurations together with their imprints.

original: sgom pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te 'joms par bya ba'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi 'joms pa po'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te 'joms par bya ba'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi 'joms pa po'o //
translated: Meditation is the vajra-like samadhi, the destroyer of all obscurations to be destroyed.

original: rnam par sgom pa ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mi skye ba dang zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sgom pa ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mi skye ba dang zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the path of completion, the knowledge of non-arising and exhaustion.

original: yul ni yul thun mong la'o //
analyzed: yul ni yul thun mong la'o //
translated: The object is the common object.

original: phyogs ni bye brag go /
analyzed: phyogs ni bye brag go /
translated: The aspect is the specific.

original: 'di rnams la yul dang dus kyis mi khyab pa nyid kyis tshad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'di rnams la yul dang dus kyis mi khyab pa nyid kyis tshad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir la /
translated: These are immeasurable because they are not pervaded by place and time, and they are not endowed with measure.

original: gzhal du med pa ni de'i ngo bo dang mi sbyor pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ni de'i ngo bo dang mi sbyor pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Immeasurable is the application of not applying to their nature.

original: gzhan du na zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la ste /
translated: Otherwise, in the nature of form and so forth,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: it is intended that form and so forth are endowed with measure.

original: gzugs la sogs pa @148a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa @148a * //
translated: Form and so forth

original: nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces pa ni /
translated: are omniscience.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa nyid stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par rtogs pas sangs rgyas nyid la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa nyid stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par rtogs pas sangs rgyas nyid la /
translated: Because, for the yogi, form, etc. are realized as being of one taste with emptiness, and thus,

original: gzhan du ni 'di dang gzugs zhes pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'di dang gzugs zhes pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid brjod pa ste /
translated: in another way, the words ‚Äúform‚Äù and ‚Äúthis‚Äù refer to the reality of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes pa ni de ltar dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes pa ni de ltar dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction. This is the nature of the object of observation.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn, etc.

original: zab mo zhes pa ni mos par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zhes pa ni mos par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Profound means difficult to believe.

original: gting dpag par dka' ba ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gting dpag par dka' ba ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Difficult to fathom means not by the wisdom of reflection.

original: blta bar dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i sgom pas kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: blta bar dka' ba ni 'jig rten pa'i sgom pas kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Difficult to see means not by the meditation of the world.

original: rtogs par dka' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
translated: Difficult to realize means not by the supramundane.

original: don gyi dbang du ni de'i rgyus brtson pa chung ba nyid la gzhol bar mdzad pa ni dman pas kun tu spangs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang du ni de'i rgyus brtson pa chung ba nyid la gzhol bar mdzad pa ni dman pas kun tu spangs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that, due to that, those of little effort are engaged in the inferior, and are completely abandoned.

original: gang du sus kyang min zhes pa ni bya ba dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang du sus kyang min zhes pa ni bya ba dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNowhere, by no one‚Äù is the negation of action.

original: nam mkha' zhes pas ni las so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pas ni las so //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace‚Äù is the object.

original: bdag ces pas ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: bdag ces pas ni byed pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf‚Äù is the agent.

original: chos thams cad ni thob par bya ba rnams la 'ong ba med pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni thob par bya ba rnams la 'ong ba med pas so //
translated: All phenomena are without coming in regard to what is to be attained.

original: 'gro ba med pa ni spang bya rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa ni spang bya rnams la'o //
translated: They are without going in regard to what is to be abandoned.

original: mi mthun pa'i zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIncongruent‚Äù is non-erroneous,

original: gang du gzung du med pa la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du gzung du med pa la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no apprehension of what is non-existent.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pas phyin ci log la yid ches pa'o zhes pa ni mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pas phyin ci log la yid ches pa'o zhes pa ni mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Thus, the world is deluded by error‚Äîthis is the incongruent nature.

original: lha rnams ni brgya byin la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: lha rnams ni brgya byin la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGods‚Äù are exemplified by Indra and so forth.

original: de'i le'u ni lha'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: de'i le'u ni lha'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter on the gods.

original: // / de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Blessed One said this to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: thogs pa ma mchis pa ni gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa ma mchis pa ni gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnimpeded‚Äù is because there is no harm.

original: 'dir mtshan nyid ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan nyid ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Here, the characteristic is the nature of non-obstruction.

original: dngos po thams cad ces pa ni dngos po rnams thams cad la rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces pa ni dngos po rnams thams cad la rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll things‚Äù means that all things are not perceived.üîΩ‚ÄúThe characteristic of the rival of the second‚Äù means that it is free from contradiction because it does not exist in the individual characteristics.

original: gnyis pa'i 'dra ba'i so sor 'gran pa po'i mtshan nyid 'di'o zhes pa ni so so'i mtshan nyid la de med pas 'gal ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do ;
analyzed: gnyis pa'i 'dra ba'i so sor 'gran pa po'i mtshan nyid 'di'o zhes pa ni so so'i mtshan nyid la de med pas 'gal ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of unobstructedness‚Äù means that it is not a basis.

original: / gnas ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: / gnas ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúA basis‚Äù means a support.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa de la med pas na gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa de la med pas na gnas med pa'o //
translated: It is not a basis for good or bad destinies or for nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mngon par 'grub pa ma mchis pa zhes pa ni gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa ma mchis pa zhes pa ni gang du yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-establishment‚Äù means that it does not abide anywhere.

original: gang yang mngon par grub pa med cing gang la skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang mngon par grub pa med cing gang la skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not established anywhere, and it does not arise anywhere.

original: lam thams cad ces pa ni @148b 'dir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam rnams med pa'i phyir lam med pa'o zhes pa ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: lam thams cad ces pa ni @148b 'dir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam rnams med pa'i phyir lam med pa'o zhes pa ni gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAll paths‚Äù means that here, because of not connecting with the arising of existence and nonexistence, etc., and because of the nonexistence of the paths of good and bad destinies and of nirvana, there is no path. This is the nature of the groundless.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Bhagavan, etc.

original: rjes su skyes zhes pa ni pha dang bu dag ma skyes pas don dam du 'dra ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: rjes su skyes zhes pa ni pha dang bu dag ma skyes pas don dam du 'dra ba'i phyir la /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means that because of the nonarising of father and son, they are ultimately the same.

original: gal te ma skyes pa na de dag ji ltar pha dang bu dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa na de dag ji ltar pha dang bu dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are nonarisen, how can they be father and son?

original: kun rdzob tu zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that they are conventionally.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa la 'ong ba ni rnam par gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa la 'ong ba ni rnam par gzhig pa'o //
translated: The future is the nonarisen, and coming is destruction.

original: rjes su skyes zhes pa ni rjes su rtogs pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su skyes zhes pa ni rjes su rtogs pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means arisen from subsequent realization.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur bas 'gro ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGoing‚Äù is going because of going.

original: de bkag pa ni 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de bkag pa ni 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The negation of that is the nature of non-going.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde bzhin nyid du chos thams cad gnas pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de bzhin nyid du chos thams cad gnas pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir na /
translated: The reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.

analyzed: rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o // gang la yang thogs pa med pa ni thams cad du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.

original: de la thogs pa med pa ni gang du na yang de bzhin nyid de nyid yod na de las gzhan du thogs pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩlan ni ji ltar zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de la thogs pa med pa ni gang du na yang de bzhin nyid de nyid yod na de las gzhan du thogs pa nyid do zhe na / lan ni ji ltar zhes pa ste /
translated: The reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.üîΩThe reality of the Tathagata is the reality of the world.üîΩThe reality of the world is the reality of the Tathagata.

original: gcig tu ba las gang du nyid med pa ste /üîΩgnyis kyi dbye ba de la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu ba las gang du nyid med pa ste /üîΩgnyis kyi dbye ba de la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality

original: gcig la yang 'brel pa can gyi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig la yang 'brel pa can gyi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they are the same, they would become different due to the division of the related.

original: dper na sngon gyi nam mkha' dang phyi ma'i nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sngon gyi nam mkha' dang phyi ma'i nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the space of the past and the space of the future.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid do zhes 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid do zhes 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, it would be the suchness of form and the suchness of sensation.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: To that, it is said:

original: gnyis su byar med ces pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med ces pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the two is undifferentiated.üîΩHere, ‚Äúalways‚Äù means ‚Äúagain and again,‚Äù ‚Äúnondual‚Äù means ‚Äúinseparable by oneself,‚Äù and ‚Äúsuchness‚Äù means ‚Äúinseparable by others.‚Äù ‚Äú

original: 'dir yang yang rtag tu de ltar zhes pa dang / gnyis su med pa ni rang nyid kyis dbyer med pa dang / de bzhin nyid ni gzhan gyis kyang dbyer med ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni med ces pa ste /üîΩgang gang la rten pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang yang rtag tu de ltar zhes pa dang / gnyis su med pa ni rang nyid kyis dbyer med pa dang / de bzhin nyid ni gzhan gyis kyang dbyer med ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid de gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni med ces pa ste / gang gang la rten pa'am /
translated: The suchness of the two‚Äù is the reason.

original: rgyur gyur pa de ni de yis nges par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa de ni de yis nges par gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistent‚Äù means that whatever is the support or cause of something is definitely that.

original: dper na khron pa'i chu nas kyi ljang bu bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dper na khron pa'i chu nas kyi ljang bu bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: For example, it is like the water of a well and the green sprouts.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang nas kyang ma yin zhing gang gi yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang nas kyang ma yin zhing gang gi yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Suchness is not from anywhere and does not exist anywhere.
Therefore,

original: phyir na gang du yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gang gi yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir na gang du yang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gang gi yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: since it is not connected anywhere, it is not anyone‚Äôs.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa'o zhes pa grub pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa'o zhes pa grub pa la /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, it is said that it is born after the TathƒÅgata.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs pa ni /
translated: Another reason is stated:

original: de lta bas na zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore,

original: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces pa yang ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid 'dir rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces pa yang ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid 'dir rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: unfabricated suchness is also unfabricated suchness here because it is permanent.

original: nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni rtag par de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni rtag par de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po'i phyir te /
translated: It never becomes otherwise suchness because it is always the entity of suchness.

original: gnyis su med pa ni dus kyi dbye bas kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam pa thams cad du zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni dus kyi dbye bas kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // rnam pa thams cad du zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thams cad do //
translated: It is nondual because it does not become different even by a division of time.üîΩIn every way means in all world systems.

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po thams cad la'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po thams cad la'o //
translated: All phenomena means all entities.

original: mi rtog pa ni de rnams thams cad la mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni de rnams thams cad la mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Non-conceptuality is because of non-conceptuality about all of those.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid la rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid la rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-discrimination is because of the abandonment of all discriminations in suchness.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni thams cad du rtogs pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni thams cad du rtogs pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med pas so //
translated: Similarly means that because of non-realization and non-discrimination in all ways,

original: bskal pa ma yin pas ni ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa ma yin pas ni ma bcad pa'o //
translated: non-division is because of non-division into time periods.üîΩNon-differentiation is because of non-apprehension of a differentiator as different.üîΩNon-duality is because of non-apprehension of a duality as different.üîΩNon-otherness is because of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.

original: tha mi dad pas ni gzhan du 'byed pa po ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: tha mi dad pas ni gzhan du 'byed pa po ma dmigs pas so //
translated: The suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.

original: gnyis pa med pas 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la /
analyzed: gnyis pa med pas 'di ni gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la /
translated: The suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.

original: de'i rjes su bgrod cing nye bar son pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob la don dam par ni ma yin zhing zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bgrod cing nye bar son pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni kun rdzob la don dam par ni ma yin zhing zhes pa ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni de ltar song ba la song ba med pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pas mthong bas zhes pa la dgongs pa'o zhes pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni de ltar song ba la song ba med pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pas mthong bas zhes pa la dgongs pa'o zhes pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an otherness as different.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is the one who has gone to that, who has arrived at that.üîΩThe suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of non-apprehension of an other

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'dir de bzhin nyid la thams cad du rab tu dbye ba rnams med kyi tha dad pa med par bstan pas dbye ba dgag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rnams la dmigs pa med pas de bzhin nyid dmigs pa ni bcu drug
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / 'dir de bzhin nyid la thams cad du rab tu dbye ba rnams med kyi tha dad pa med par bstan pas dbye ba dgag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi de bzhin nyid rnams la dmigs pa med pas de bzhin nyid dmigs pa ni bcu drug
translated: The reality of the Tathagata, etc.

original: gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Here, in reality, there are no divisions of any kind, and so the negation of divisions is taught by the non-difference. The reality of these forms, etc. is not an objective support, and so reality is the essence of the sixteen.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: The greatness of these realities is stated:

original: 'di bstan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di bstan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is taught, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid du gshegs shing mkhyen pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gshegs shing mkhyen pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la /
translated: The Tathagata is one who has gone and knows in reality, and so

original: sdug ces pa la sogs pa ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: sdug ces pa la sogs pa ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
translated: The meaning of the words, etc. is a special activity.

original: 'dir khams gsum g-yo ba'i don du gsungs dang sgra'i don la ste /
analyzed: 'dir khams gsum g-yo ba'i don du gsungs dang sgra'i don la ste /
translated: Here, it is said to be for the sake of shaking the three realms, and so

original: sdug la chung ngu dang @149b 'bring dang chen po bya ba'i dbye bas te ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug la chung ngu dang @149b 'bring dang chen po bya ba'i dbye bas te ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the words is that there are eighteen great portents, by the division of the activities of the small, medium, and great in the unpleasant, etc.

original: de la 'gul ba ni mtha' dag go //
analyzed: de la 'gul ba ni mtha' dag go //
translated: The entire earth shook.

original: g-yo ba ni cha shas so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni cha shas so //
translated: It trembled in part.

original: ma lus pa shin tu 'gul ba ni 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa shin tu 'gul ba ni 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: It trembled completely and violently.

original: chem chem ni sgra'o //
analyzed: chem chem ni sgra'o //
translated: It rumbled.

original: 'ur 'ur ni dbyig pas brdungs pa'i khar rnga bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ur 'ur ni dbyig pas brdungs pa'i khar rnga bzhin no //
translated: It rumbled like a kettledrum beaten by the hand.

original: kun tu 'ur 'ur ni 'brug sgra chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: kun tu 'ur 'ur ni 'brug sgra chen po bzhin no //
translated: It rumbled like a great thundercloud.

original: rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa ni ji ltar sa gzhi'i shar phyogs mtho na ni nub phyogs dma' la /
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa ni ji ltar sa gzhi'i shar phyogs mtho na ni nub phyogs dma' la /
translated: It shook in six ways: when the eastern side rose, the western side sank;

original: shar phyogs dma' na ni nub phyogs mtho ba'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs dma' na ni nub phyogs mtho ba'o //
translated: when the eastern side sank, the western side rose.

original: lho phyogs mtho na ni byang phyogs dma' la byang phyogs mtho na ni lho phyogs dma' ba'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs mtho na ni byang phyogs dma' la byang phyogs mtho na ni lho phyogs dma' ba'o //
translated: When the southern side rose, the northern side sank; when the southern side sank, the northern side rose.

original: dbus mtho na ni mtha' dma' la //üîΩmtha' mtho na ni dbus dma'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbus mtho na ni mtha' dma' la //üîΩmtha' mtho na ni dbus dma'o zhes pa'o //
translated: When the center rose, the edges sank;üîΩwhen the center sank, the edges rose.

original: 'di rnams g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / lha rnams bcom ldan 'das la mnyan pa dang ldan pa rnams dga' zhing rang sa nas spro ba 'di nas de ru yongs su bskyod pa dang / bstan pa spang ba bskyod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / lha rnams bcom ldan 'das la mnyan pa dang ldan pa rnams dga' zhing rang sa nas spro ba 'di nas de ru yongs su bskyod pa dang / bstan pa spang ba bskyod pa ni /
translated: These are the movements, etc., and the gods, endowed with listening to the Lord, are delighted and move from their own places to here, and the movement of abandoning the teaching.

original: chos rin po che'i bdag nyid chen por zhes par byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi mthas so //
analyzed: chos rin po che'i bdag nyid chen por zhes par byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi mthas so //
translated: The great identity of the precious Dharma is made by the one who is the great identity of the precious Dharma, and by the end of reality.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni 'dir nye bar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni 'dir nye bar mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Non-existence is non-apprehension here.

original: gang gis zhes pa ni rang gi chos rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa ni rang gi chos rnams kyis te /
translated: By whom means by one's own dharmas.

original: byed pa po dang gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rjes su skye bar bya ba'i las kyi de bzhin nyid la ji ltar spyad de /
analyzed: byed pa po dang gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rjes su skye bar bya ba'i las kyi de bzhin nyid la ji ltar spyad de /
translated: The agent and the one who is to be born after the Tathagata's Dharma, how does one practice in the suchness of that action?

original: de tsam la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de tsam la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of abiding in just that,

original: rigs yin pas 'dab chags la lus chen po'i phyir na bya chen no //
analyzed: rigs yin pas 'dab chags la lus chen po'i phyir na bya chen no //
translated: it is a family, and because of the great body of the bird, it is a great bird.

original: bar du zhes pa ni ji srid du sa'i dbus kyi 'du shes kyis te /
analyzed: bar du zhes pa ni ji srid du sa'i dbus kyi 'du shes kyis te /
translated: In the middle means for as long as there is the perception of the center of the earth.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par byas pas na de gsal bar byed par 'dod nas /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par byas pas na de gsal bar byed par 'dod nas /
translated: Since it has been stated that the aids to liberation are to be expressed, wishing to clarify that,

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said, ‚ÄúOne should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhes pa ni chos thams cad don dam par shes nas spyod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya zhes pa ni chos thams cad don dam par shes nas spyod pa byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should cultivate the perfection of wisdom‚Äù means that having understood all phenomena ultimately, one should engage in the conduct.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la mtshan ma med par byed pa'i don du thabs rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems rtag par mi gtang zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la mtshan ma med par byed pa'i don du thabs rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems rtag par mi gtang zhing /
translated: For the sake of making the perfections of generosity and so on free of signs, one should not abandon the mind of omniscience at all times.

original: bsod nams thams cad kyang byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyang byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: One should also dedicate all merit to enlightenment and rejoice in it.

original: de'i thabs la mkhas pa ni 'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩmtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: de'i thabs la mkhas pa ni 'dir bstan bcos las / mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: The skill in means for that is taught in this treatise:üîΩSkill in the signless

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
translated: and in the accomplishment of generosity and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la //
translated: This realization of all aspects

original: thar ba'i cha dang mthun par @150a * //
analyzed: thar ba'i cha dang mthun par @150a * //
translated: is the aid to liberation.

original: 'dod ; / ces pa ste mtshan ma thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar ma dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad rang gi rgyud las 'byung bar yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ni mkhas pa la /
analyzed: 'dod ; / ces pa ste mtshan ma thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar ma dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thams cad rang gi rgyud las 'byung bar yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ni mkhas pa la /
translated: The definition of the perfection of wisdom is the correct accomplishment of all the qualities of the Buddha, such as generosity, through the wisdom that is skilled in the uncommon essence of the signs, the nature of the signs, and the aspect of the consciousness that does not observe signs.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of method.

original: thar pa'i cha ni snod de /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha ni snod de /
translated: The part of liberation is the vessel.

original: de thob pa la phan pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa la phan pa'o //
translated: It is beneficial for attaining that.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni yum chen mor lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni yum chen mor lnga gsungs te /
translated: Its divisions are stated in the Great Mother as five:

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos las /
translated: As the treatise says:

original: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // bsam pa phun sum tshogs dran dang // rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // bsam pa phun sum tshogs dran dang // rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: Concentration is non-conceptual.üîΩWisdom is the knowledge of all aspects of phenomena.

original: shes pa'i shes rab rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes rab rnam pa lnga //
translated: These are the five aspects.

original: zhes te thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: This is the stage conducive to liberation.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes te /
translated: When this was said,

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩrdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las / rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis //
translated: here in the treatise it is said:üîΩPerfect enlightenment is easy for the sharp-witted,

original: rtogs bla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed //
analyzed: rtogs bla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed //
translated: but difficult for the dull-witted to realize.

original: ces te 'di rnams kyi go skabs ni /
analyzed: ces te 'di rnams kyi go skabs ni /
translated: The opportunity for these is as follows:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya, etc.

original: 'dir tshogs chen pos kun tu 'byung zhes pas na 'byung bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshogs chen pos kun tu 'byung zhes pas na 'byung bar dka' ba'o //
translated: Here, since it is said arises in the great assembly, it is difficult to arise.

original: shes rab 'chal ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtul po'i khyad par gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rtul po'i khyad par gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: The words corrupt wisdom, etc. clarify the special dullness of the stage conducive to liberation.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnon po rnams kyis ni rang nyid mngon par byung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnon po rnams kyis ni rang nyid mngon par byung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes pa'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculties who are in accord with liberation do not become perfect buddhas after they have manifested themselves.

original: rnam grangs 'dis zhes pa ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis zhes pa ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas so //
translated: By this enumeration, all phenomena are the same.

original: bdag nyid mngon par byang chub ces pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par byang chub ces pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI myself will fully awaken‚Äù meansüîΩthat sentient beings are primordially just so.

original: sems can rnams gdod ma nyid nas de bzhin zhes pa ni rgol ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams gdod ma nyid nas de bzhin zhes pa ni rgol ba la /
translated: This is a response to the objection.

original: rab 'byor la de ma bsgrubs par thob pa'i gang dag thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu la de ni de rnams yod pa ma yin zhing 'dir thob par mi srid pas 'byung bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor la de ma bsgrubs par thob pa'i gang dag thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu la de ni de rnams yod pa ma yin zhing 'dir thob par mi srid pas 'byung bar dka' ba'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, those who have not accomplished that, who are of lesser faculties in accord with liberation, do not have that, and it is difficult for them to attain it here.

original: de yang byis pas ni kun nas sgro btags pa de nyid kyi dngos pos byang chub par rlom la /
analyzed: de yang byis pas ni kun nas sgro btags pa de nyid kyi dngos pos byang chub par rlom la /
translated: Moreover, childish beings imagine that they are awakened by the entity of that superimposition.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: Since that is not real, they do not attain it.

original: de ltar yang byang chub ni rnam par @150b rtog pas sam /
analyzed: de ltar yang byang chub ni rnam par @150b rtog pas sam /
translated: Thus, enlightenment is not attained through conceptualization.

original: gzhan du rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i dngos po'i phyogs gnyis char gyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par rtog pas sprul pa'i dngos po'i phyogs gnyis char gyis kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, enlightenment is not tenable in either of the two ways of imagining it, imagining it as a transformation or imagining it as a real thing.

original: byang chub ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because enlightenment is non-conceptual and because imagination does not arise.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pas kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like‚Äù means like space.

original: de ni ma yin zhes pa ni de nyid min te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin zhes pa ni de nyid min te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not‚Äù means it is not that.

original: phyir mi ldog pa bsgrub par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni gang phyir ldog pa'i chos de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa bsgrub par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni gang phyir ldog pa'i chos de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: With the desire to establish the irreversible, he says, ‚ÄúBecause that dharma which is reversible,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos thams cad la gnas med pa nyid du sbyor ba'i rigs pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la gnas med pa nyid du sbyor ba'i rigs pas /
translated: By the reasoning that connects all dharmas with the absence of a locus,

original: de chos nyid la gnas shing /üîΩchos nyid kho na ni dag pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: de chos nyid la gnas shing / chos nyid kho na ni dag pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: he abides in reality.üîΩReality itself is pure enlightenment.

original: de yang rang bzhin nyid kyis dag pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin nyid kyis dag pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: And that is pure by nature.

original: chos rnams kyi tshul du skye ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bye brag gi de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pas na yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi tshul du skye ba'i de kho na nyid kyi bye brag gi de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pas na yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The reality of the suchness of the reality of the arising of things is called suchness. It is not existent because it does not arise as reality.

original: rab tu 'byed par byed pa rnams la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'byed par byed pa rnams la zhes pa ni /
translated: In the case of those who discriminate,

original: brtag par bya ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba rnams la'o //
translated: in the case of those who investigate.

original: de la khyad par med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de la khyad par med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Therein, the absence of difference is due to the nonapprehension of the three kinds of discrimination of the bodhisattva.

original: bye brag med pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig par kun tu rtogs so //
analyzed: bye brag med pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig par kun tu rtogs so //
translated: The absence of distinction is the realization of the identity of taste with suchness.

original: tha dad du byar med pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bye brag las bzlog nas tha dad du byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad du byar med pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bye brag las bzlog nas tha dad du byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of differentiation is because it is impossible to differentiate it by reversing the distinctions as they have been explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dis nges par 'byung ba'o zhes pa'i bar gyi rgya chen pos ni rnon po rnams kyis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung ba'o zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dis nges par 'byung ba'o zhes pa'i bar gyi rgya chen pos ni rnon po rnams kyis thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung ba'o zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The extensive passage up to here explains that those of sharp faculties, through the aids to penetration, will themselves emerge in perfect enlightenment.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The aids to penetration are four:

original: de la drod kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la drod kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to heat, the treatise says:

original: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni //
translated: The object of the heatsüîΩis said to be all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags //üîΩde dag la ni sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yin par bsngags // de dag la ni sems mnyam sogs //
translated: They have the aspects of the four noble truths,

original: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do //
translated: and are the ten kinds of sameness of thought, etc.

original: zhes te / 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes te / 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩgnas par bya ba ni spro bas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste / gnas par bya ba ni spro bas so //
translated: Then, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who is skilled in the aids to penetration, should be taught the path of application.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.

original: bslab par bgyi ba ni goms pas so //üîΩsems can rnams la sems mnyam zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems gzhan bcu gsungs te /
analyzed: bslab par bgyi ba ni goms pas so // sems can rnams la sems mnyam zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems gzhan bcu gsungs te /
translated: He should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.üîΩHe should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize the aids to penetration and to make them grow.

original: dge ba ni g-yo med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: dge ba ni g-yo med pa'i sems so //
translated: He should be taught the path of application in order to stabilize

original: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: Non-violence is compassion.

original: ma dang pa'i sems dang bu dang bu mo'i sems dang mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon byed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid sdig pa las @151a * //
analyzed: ma dang pa'i sems dang bu dang bu mo'i sems dang mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon byed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid sdig pa las @151a * //
translated: The mind of a mother, the mind of a son or daughter, and the mind of a protector for those who are unprotected, and oneself turning away from evil,üîΩand abiding in generosity, etc.

original: ldog cing // sbyin la sogs la gnas pas gzhan //
analyzed: ldog cing // sbyin la sogs la gnas pas gzhan //
translated: are the causes of the bodhisattva's happiness.

original: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //üîΩrtser 'gyur zhes par bstan bcos las te de dag dang ma bral bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid // rtser 'gyur zhes par bstan bcos las te de dag dang ma bral bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The treatise declares, They are the causes of the bodhisattva's happiness.

original: de gsungs pa ni /üîΩbdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni / bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse says,üîΩThe bodhisattva's happiness is said to be from the absence of the three faults and the presence of the three virtues.üîΩThe three faults are: One's own evil, the evil of others, and the non-abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.

original: sdig pa ni mi dge ba bcu yongs su rgyal ba ni goms pa'o //üîΩma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces pa la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni mi dge ba bcu yongs su rgyal ba ni goms pa'o // ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces pa la sogs pa ni lugs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.

original: de la bden pa gnyis ma rtogs pa'i shes pa dang phyin ci log tu shes pa dang the tshom ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis ma rtogs pa'i shes pa dang phyin ci log tu shes pa dang the tshom ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others, and the abandonment of both.üîΩThe three virtues are: One's own good, the good of others

original: des mi dge ba 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams gsum gyi las 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mi dge ba 'dod pa na kun tu spyod pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams gsum gyi las 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It creates nonvirtuous actions that are always practiced in the desire realm, and it creates virtuous contaminated actions in the three realms.

original: des yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid can dang 'chi ba dang skye ba'i ngang du gyur pa'i srid pa bar ma do 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid can dang 'chi ba dang skye ba'i ngang du gyur pa'i srid pa bar ma do 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It creates the mental consciousness that is the characteristic of birth and death, and it creates the intermediate existence that is the continuum of death and birth.

original: srid pa ma son pa'i thogs pa med pas bar du yul der sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa ma son pa'i thogs pa med pas bar du yul der sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since existence is uninterrupted, it connects to the next existence in the intermediate state.

original: ma'i lto bar mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig la ma zhig pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'dus byas pas skye ba 'dzin pa'i nur nur po'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga'i nang du gtogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes te /
analyzed: ma'i lto bar mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig la ma zhig pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'dus byas pas skye ba 'dzin pa'i nur nur po'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga'i nang du gtogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes te /
translated: When the intermediate existence enters the womb, the five aggregates of the kalala stage of the new birth are included in the mental consciousness of the mother who is not dead, and of the being of the intermediate state who is attached to the place of birth.

original: yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third link.

original: de las rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs te /
analyzed: de las rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs te /
translated: From that, the condition of consciousness is name and form.

original: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni khyer zhes pas ni yang srid par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni khyer zhes pas ni yang srid par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling, perception, the formations, and consciousness are called ‚Äúcarried along‚Äù because they generate rebirth.

original: gzugs ni nur nur po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni nur nur po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Form is the stage of the embryo.

original: de las mig la sogs pa ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: de las mig la sogs pa ni skye mched drug go //
translated: From that, the six sense bases.

original: de las dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa rnams phan tshun du rig nas tshor ba dang bskyed pa la mngon du byed pa ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: de las dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa rnams phan tshun du rig nas tshor ba dang bskyed pa la mngon du byed pa ni rig pa'o //
translated: From that, the coming together of the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses, which are established as cause and effect, mutually recognize each other, and generate feeling.

original: de las bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de las bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: From that, the feeling of pleasure, etc.

original: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yang srid pa la mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bo ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yang srid pa la mngon par dga' ba'i ngo bo ni srid pa'o //
translated: From that, the craving for the pleasure of existence, which has the nature of delighting in existence that has the characteristic of being desired.

original: de las 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po len pa'i dbye ba dga' ba'i ngo bo'i ngo bo de dang bral bar ma gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhis khyad par gyi srid pa la mngon @151b par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po len pa'i dbye ba dga' ba'i ngo bo'i ngo bo de dang bral bar ma gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhis khyad par gyi srid pa la mngon @151b par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: From that, there is grasping, which is of four kinds: grasping the self as desirable, as a view, as morality and spiritual discipline, and as beneficial.

original: de las 'du byed pa'i sa bon ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pas mi slu bas skye ba skyed pa la mngon par phyogs pas srid pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'du byed pa'i sa bon ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pas mi slu bas skye ba skyed pa la mngon par phyogs pas srid pa'o //
translated: From that, there is becoming, which is the orientation toward the production of birth by the non-deceptive seeds of karma, ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: de las skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩming dang gzugs kyis rim gyis skye ba'o //
analyzed: de las skye bar 'gyur te / ming dang gzugs kyis rim gyis skye ba'o //
translated: From that, there is birth.üîΩFrom that, there is old age and death.

original: des rga shi la sogs pa'o zhes phan tshun gyi rgyun can gyi yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: des rga shi la sogs pa'o zhes phan tshun gyi rgyun can gyi yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are twelve members, which are mutually causal.

original: de ni gang zhig 'chi ba'i bar ma dor yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ni gang zhig 'chi ba'i bar ma dor yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: This is not the case for those who die in the intermediate state,

original: rdzus te skye ba la yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba la yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: or for those who are born supernaturally,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par yang ma yin no //
translated: or for those in the form and formless realms.

original: de la yan lag dang po gnyis ni skye ba snga ma'i'o //
analyzed: de la yan lag dang po gnyis ni skye ba snga ma'i'o //
translated: The first two members are of the former birth.

original: bar gyi brgyad po ni da ltar byung ba'i skye ba'i'o //
analyzed: bar gyi brgyad po ni da ltar byung ba'i skye ba'i'o //
translated: The middle eight are of the present birth.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i 'o zhes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang bar ma rnams su rnam par gzhag pa ni kun tu rmongs pa med pa ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i 'o zhes pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dang bar ma rnams su rnam par gzhag pa ni kun tu rmongs pa med pa ni mi 'jug go //
translated: Birth and old age and death are of the future birth. The arrangement of former, later, and intermediate is not for the purpose of confusion.

original: dang po dang gzhan brgyad pa dang dgu pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang gzhan brgyad pa dang dgu pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The first, the eighth, and the ninth are afflictions.

original: gnyis pa dang bcu pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcu pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The second and the tenth are the afflictions of karma.

original: lhag ma ni skye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las dang skye ba kun tu 'phen la /
analyzed: lhag ma ni skye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o // nyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las dang skye ba kun tu 'phen la /
translated: The rest are the afflictions of birth.üîΩAfflictions are the projecting cause of karma and birth.

original: bden pa mthong ba ni bden pas las dang yang srid pa mi 'phan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i rten cing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni bden pas las dang yang srid pa mi 'phan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i rten cing 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because of the vision of the truth, karma and rebirth are not projected by the truth. This is the dependent origination of the twelve members.

original: nyon mongs pa las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi ngo bo'i 'khor ba la thog ma med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las dang skye ba'i rgyun gyi ngo bo'i 'khor ba la thog ma med de /
translated: Samsara, which is the continuum of afflictions, karma, and birth, is beginningless.

original: thog ma yod na thog ma la rgyu med ba can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma yod na thog ma la rgyu med ba can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it had a beginning, it would follow that it would have no cause at its beginning.

original: tha ma ni rgyu zad pas rigs te /
analyzed: tha ma ni rgyu zad pas rigs te /
translated: It has an end, because its cause is exhausted.

original: sa bon zad pas myu gu bzhin te /
analyzed: sa bon zad pas myu gu bzhin te /
translated: Like a sprout from an exhausted seed,

original: skye ba ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: birth depends on a cause.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas so sor bskyed pa'i stong pa dang / snying rje ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa'i gnyen po bsgoms pas ma rig pa rim gyis zad nas 'khor ba pa'i sems can grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da'
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas so sor bskyed pa'i stong pa dang / snying rje ro gcig pa'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa'i gnyen po bsgoms pas ma rig pa rim gyis zad nas 'khor ba pa'i sems can grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da'
translated: Therefore, through cultivating the antidote to ignorance, which is the perfection of wisdom, the nature of enlightenment, the single taste of emptiness and compassion, which is generated by the buddhas, ignorance gradually diminishes and countless sentient beings in samsara attain nirvana.

original: ba'i phyir thams cad rgyun chad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba'i phyir thams cad rgyun chad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that everything would be annihilated.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhes lung las gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhes lung las gsungs te /
translated: It is stated in the scriptures that all of these beings will become buddhas.

original: 'dir ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed ces pa nas ji srid du skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: 'dir ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed ces pa nas ji srid du skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur zhes te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúthrough the cessation of ignorance, the karmic forces cease‚Äù up to ‚Äúthrough the cessation of birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, suffering, anxiety, and turmoil cease.‚Äù

original: de la phung po yongs su smin pa ni rgas pa'o //
analyzed: de la phung po yongs su smin pa ni rgas pa'o //
translated: Here, the full maturation of the aggregates is old age.

original: @152a * // phung po rnying pa zhig pa shi ba'o //
analyzed: @152a * // phung po rnying pa zhig pa shi ba'o //
translated: The disintegration of the old aggregates is death.

original: shi bar gyur pa las rmongs pas mngon par chags pas snying mi bde ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa las rmongs pas mngon par chags pas snying mi bde ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: From the occurrence of death, through delusion, there is attachment, and from that, mental pain, which is grief.

original: mya ngan gyis kun nas bslangs nas ngag tu 'don pa ni smre sngags so //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis kun nas bslangs nas ngag tu 'don pa ni smre sngags so //
translated: From grief, there is lamentation, which is verbal expression.

original: dbang po rnams mi gsal ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams mi gsal ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The dulling of the faculties is suffering.

original: yid la gcags pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental anguish is anxiety.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba las byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba las byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste /
translated: From suffering and anxiety, there is turmoil.

original: gang du 'phags pas /
analyzed: gang du 'phags pas /
translated: As the ƒÄrya has said:

original: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: When ignorance ceases,

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: The karmic forces do not occur.

original: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gag par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The cessation of ignorance

original: shes pa de ni bsgom pas so //
analyzed: shes pa de ni bsgom pas so //
translated: is through the cultivation of that knowledge.

original: mod phal cher yang lugs las bzlog pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mod phal cher yang lugs las bzlog pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the sequence is mostly reversed:

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi la sogs pa 'gag ces pa nas ji srid du /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi la sogs pa 'gag ces pa nas ji srid du /
translated: ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of birth, aging and death cease,‚Äù and so on,

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa ni lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces pa la sogs pa ni lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: up to ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of ignorance, formations cease,‚Äù and so on.

original: yang dag par bskul ba ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: Exhortation is in regard to correct grasping.

original: bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa brjod pa'i yon tan brjod pa'o //
translated: Praise is the expression of good qualities.

original: mthun par dka' ba'i rjes su mthun pas so zhes pa ni rtse mor gyur pa'o //üîΩrang bzhin rten can bden shes pa'i //
analyzed: mthun par dka' ba'i rjes su mthun pas so zhes pa ni rtse mor gyur pa'o // rang bzhin rten can bden shes pa'i //
translated: Concordance is through following what is difficult.

original: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
analyzed: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
translated: The supreme mundane quality is the knowledge of the truths that is naturally based,

original: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //
analyzed: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //
translated: and the maturation of sentient beings and so on.

original: zhes pa bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: zhes pa bstan bcos las te /
translated: This is known from the treatise.

original: 'dir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de bzhin du bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise, the truths‚Äù and so on.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba dang / mngon du byed pa dang / bsgom pa rnams la rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i bya ba la ji srid du yang dag par bskul ba la sogs pa nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / spong ba dang / mngon du byed pa dang / bsgom pa rnams la rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i bya ba la ji srid du yang dag par bskul ba la sogs pa nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: In regard to the objects of the Truths of Suffering, etc., respectively, there is the function of arousing the activity of realizing the fruits of Stream-entry, etc., up to the full entrance into the Bodhisattva's faultlessness, in the case of the thorough knowledge of suffering, the abandonment of origination, the realization of cessation, and the cultivation of the path.

original: de ltar sems can zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems can zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the sentient beings and so on.

original: de ltar bzod par gyur pa dang chos mchog tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzod par gyur pa dang chos mchog tu gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, having become patient and having become of the highest stage of Dharma.

original: de ltar 'dod cing zhes pa la sogs pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod cing zhes pa la sogs pas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having desired and so on explain the fruits of the aids to penetration.

original: de bzhin nyid gtso bor bstan pa'i le'u ni de bzhin nyid kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gtso bor bstan pa'i le'u ni de bzhin nyid kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter which is primarily an exposition of thusness is the chapter on thusness.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter of the Great commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, called ‚ÄúIllumination of the Essential Meaning,‚Äù composed by the great pa·πá·∏çit AbhayƒÅkaragupta.

original: // / tshogs kyi @152b dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: // / tshogs kyi @152b dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the assembly, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the branches of ascertainment

original: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths of seeing and meditation

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gnas //
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide

original: de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: Are here the assembly of nonreturners.

original: zhes te phyir ldog par 'gyur ba ni phyir ldog pa la /
analyzed: zhes te phyir ldog par 'gyur ba ni phyir ldog pa la /
translated: To return is to return;

original: de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni phyir mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni phyir mi ldog pa ste /
translated: Not to be like that is nonreturn.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The assembly of nonreturners.

original: 'dir dbang po rab kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni tshogs kyi sa nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa dang snying rje chen po la sbyar nas tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa la /
analyzed: 'dir dbang po rab kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni tshogs kyi sa nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nges pa dang snying rje chen po la sbyar nas tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa la /
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas of highest acumen, from the level of accumulating, having applied the perfection of wisdom and great compassion, complete the two accumulations.

original: rtag par mngon par sbyor bar dga' bas phyir mi ldog pa can no //
analyzed: rtag par mngon par sbyor bar dga' bas phyir mi ldog pa can no //
translated: Because of always delighting in manifest application, one is irreversible.

original: dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' ba las sngon du de'i nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring ni rab tu dga' ba las sngon du de'i nges pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one of medium faculties is not irreversible because of not having previously ascertained that and so on.

original: dbang po rtul pos ni yang sa brgyad pa la sngon du bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i bya ba la nges par brtan po med pa'i ldog pa'i dogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul pos ni yang sa brgyad pa la sngon du bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i bya ba la nges par brtan po med pa'i ldog pa'i dogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one of dull faculties is not irreversible because of the arising of the doubt of reversal on the eighth ground, due to not having previously ascertained the activity of directly perceiving the unsurpassed suchness.

original: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung zhes pa ni tshogs kyi lam la shin tu mi zad pa'i nges pa can la ltos nas gsungs pas mngon par 'dod pa ni tshogs kyi sa la yang ste /
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung zhes pa ni tshogs kyi lam la shin tu mi zad pa'i nges pa can la ltos nas gsungs pas mngon par 'dod pa ni tshogs kyi sa la yang ste /
translated: From the branches of ascertainment means that because it is stated in dependence upon the path of accumulation, which is the ascertainment of the nondeficiency of the branches of ascertainment, the intended meaning is also the path of accumulation.

original: sogs zhes pa mthar med kyang dngos po la rnam par brtags nas mthar gnas pa nyid pas phyir mi ldog pa'i rigs phyir mi ldog pa can de rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sogs zhes pa mthar med kyang dngos po la rnam par brtags nas mthar gnas pa nyid pas phyir mi ldog pa'i rigs phyir mi ldog pa can de rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Although and so on is not stated, since one abides in the end by investigating entities, the four types of irreversible lineage are irreversible.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba shin tu de la srid pas zhes pa la sogs pa bshad la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba shin tu de la srid pas zhes pa la sogs pa bshad la /
translated: Since it is very possible for the thought of perfect enlightenment to arise in that way, it is said, ‚Äútherein lies the possibility of‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: bstan bcos su /
analyzed: bstan bcos su /
translated: Since it is very possible that the thought of perfect enlightenment will arise for them, the treatise states:

original: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
translated: Because of the signs of turning away from form and so on,

original: rnam pa nyi shu bskyed pa yis //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bskyed pa yis //
translated: and generating the twenty aspects,

original: nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
translated: those abiding in the branches of penetration

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: are characterized as irreversible.

original: zhes te 'dir ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'i rtags rnams te /
analyzed: zhes te 'dir ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'i rtags rnams te /
translated: Here, the signs of knowing the characteristics of irreversibility are:üîΩturning away from form and so on,üîΩthe exhaustion of doubt,

original: gzugs la sogs las ldog pa dang // the tshom mi dal zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs las ldog pa dang // the tshom mi dal zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
translated: abiding in one's own virtue,üîΩengaging others in that,üîΩgenerosity and so on based on others,

original: gzhan dag de la 'dzud pa dang // gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la som nyi med //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la 'dzud pa dang // gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la som nyi med //
translated: and being free of doubt about the profound meaning.

original: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
analyzed: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
translated: The obscurations of love and so on

original: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
translated: and not having parasites on the body.

original: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
translated: The training of the mind without crookednessüîΩis taking up the training, not being stingy,üîΩhaving the nature of the Dharma, going to the right place,üîΩseeking the hells for the sake of sentient beings,üîΩnot wanting to be led by others,

original: @153a * // len dang ser sna med pa dang // chos nyid ldan bar 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi 'dod dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston 'dud la //
analyzed: @153a * // len dang ser sna med pa dang // chos nyid ldan bar 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi 'dod dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston 'dud la //
translated: and bowing to those who show the path.üîΩThe practice that delights the buddhas

original: 'dud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: 'dud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: is the realization of ‚Äúbowing‚Äù

original: rtags ni nyi shu de rnams kyis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de rnams kyis //
translated: and the twenty signs.üîΩThe signs of heat, peak, forbearance,

original: drod dang rtse mo bzod pa dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod pa dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni //
translated: and the supreme mundane quality

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / ces pa bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / ces pa bstan bcos las te /
translated: are taught in the treatise.

original: rtags kyis mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rtags kyis mtshon pa ste /
translated: They are indicated by the signs.
