original: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: What is taught here

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: is from ‚ÄúThen‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di rnams kyis rnam par byed cing gsal par byed pas na rnam pa la /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis rnam par byed cing gsal par byed pas na rnam pa la /
translated: Since these illuminate and manifest, they are aspects.

original: 'di rnams kyis mtshon par byed pas na rtags so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis mtshon par byed pas na rtags so //
translated: Since these indicate, they are signs.

original: 'di rnams kyis gsal bar byed cing brtag par byed ce na mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis gsal bar byed cing brtag par byed ce na mtshan ma ste /
translated: Since these illuminate and investigate, they are characteristics.

original: don gcig kyang gsum po rnams kyis brjod pa ni don dag gzhan gyi dogs pa gcod pa'i don du'am rnam grangs kyis bshad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gcig kyang gsum po rnams kyis brjod pa ni don dag gzhan gyi dogs pa gcod pa'i don du'am rnam grangs kyis bshad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although they have the same meaning, the three are expressed in order to eliminate doubts about other meanings or to explain them by way of synonyms.

original: gang gi phyir ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Since there are no two,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi chos rnams thams cad ni don dam pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi chos rnams thams cad ni don dam pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de /
translated: all phenomena of form and so on are suchness because they do not exist ultimately.

original: de bzhin nyid la ni gcig pa nyid dang gnyis dang mang po med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ni gcig pa nyid dang gnyis dang mang po med pa ste /
translated: In suchness, there is no singularity, duality or multiplicity.

original: de'i phyir na de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pas dbyer med pa dang gnyis su byar med pas ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pas dbyer med pa dang gnyis su byar med pas ma bcad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, suchness is nondual, indivisible, and unobservable since it is not twofold.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the nature of conceptuality, it is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is not the domain of conceptualization.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni de ltar de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni de ltar de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, means thus, because suchness abides as the characteristic and is of one taste with suchness.

original: mi rtog pa ni yang dag par ro //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni yang dag par ro //
translated: Non-conceptual means correctly.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni phyin ci log tu'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni phyin ci log tu'o //
translated: Non-conceptualization means mistakenly.

original: thos nas kyang zhes pa ni thos pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: thos nas kyang zhes pa ni thos pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Having heard means after hearing.

original: song nas zhes pa ni dus phyis kyang ste /
analyzed: song nas zhes pa ni dus phyis kyang ste /
translated: Having gone means later.

original: nem nur mi byed pa ni gnod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nem nur mi byed pa ni gnod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not doubting means not harming.

original: yid gnyis mi byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid gnyis mi byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Not being two-minded means

original: rnam pa sna tshogs blo ni yid gnyis te ;
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs blo ni yid gnyis te ;
translated: various minds are two-minded.

original: de nyid mi byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi byed ces pa'o //
translated: That itself is not done.

original: 'di rnams rgyas par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di rnams rgyas par bshad de /
translated: These are explained in detail.

original: the tshom mi byed ces pa dang / rmongs par mi byed ces pas ni mi bsgrub pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi byed ces pa dang / rmongs par mi byed ces pas ni mi bsgrub pa dgag pa'o //
translated: Not doubting and not being confused means negating non-establishment.

original: de kho na nyid ltar zhes pa ni thams cad don dam par te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ltar zhes pa ni thams cad don dam par te /
translated: As such means ultimately, all.

original: kun rdzob tu ni gzugs la sogs pa de ltar lhag par mos shing ste dad pas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gzugs la sogs pa de ltar lhag par mos shing ste dad pas so //
translated: One should have faith in form and so forth in that way conventionally.

original: @153b khong du chud par byed pas ni shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: @153b khong du chud par byed pas ni shes rab kyis so //
translated: One should understand them with wisdom.

original: 'di rnams de ltar shes pa ni gtso che ba'i rtags te /
analyzed: 'di rnams de ltar shes pa ni gtso che ba'i rtags te /
translated: This is the sign of the preeminence of knowing them in that way.

original: 'di'i yongs su gcod pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i yongs su gcod pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The determination of this is stated:

original: mi lta zhes pa la sogs pa ste de ltar de nyid la de dag ces te /
analyzed: mi lta zhes pa la sogs pa ste de ltar de nyid la de dag ces te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not look at them in that way.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ldog pa'i rtags shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ldog pa'i rtags shes pa'o //
translated: One should know the sign of the reversal of form and so forth.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: others,

original: gzhan dag ste chos 'di la phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ste chos 'di la phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: the renunciates of other religions,

original: ngor blta ba ni gus par blta ba'o //
analyzed: ngor blta ba ni gus par blta ba'o //
translated: look at them with respect.

original: shes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: shes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: They know them with mundane wisdom.

original: mthong ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
translated: They see them with supramundane wisdom.

original: sbyin pa ni gus par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gus par sbyin pa'o //
translated: They give them with respect.

original: mi rten pa ni rten nam skyabs su 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rten pa ni rten nam skyabs su 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: They do not rely on them, that is, they do not go for refuge in them.

original: de'i bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis the tshom zad par gyur pas 'di rnams thams cad mi byed pa'o zhes pa ni the tshom zad pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de'i bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis the tshom zad par gyur pas 'di rnams thams cad mi byed pa'o zhes pa ni the tshom zad pa'i rtags so //
translated: Since he has eliminated doubt and uncertainty about the truth and the Jewels, he does not do any of these things. This is the sign of the elimination of doubt.

original: rab 'byor yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, Subhuti, etc.

original: ngan song ste dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro ni ngan song gis gzung la /üîΩkla klo dang / lha tshe ring por skyes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi thos pa dang / log par lta ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi khom pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa ni dud med kyi dngos po ste bud med nyid phal cher gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis dge ba'i las la mthu med pas mi khom pa'o zhes pa ni mi
analyzed: ngan song ste dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro ni ngan song gis gzung la / kla klo dang / lha tshe ring por skyes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi thos pa dang / log par lta ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi khom pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa ni dud med kyi dngos po ste bud med nyid phal cher gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis dge ba'i las la mthu med pas mi khom pa'o zhes pa ni mi
translated: The lower realms, i.e., the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals, are included in the lower realms,

original: khom pa zad pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: khom pa zad pa'i rtags so //
translated: and the characteristics of the unfree states, i.e., being born as a barbarian, a long-lived god, one who does not hear the Buddha's teachings, one with wrong views, or one with incomplete faculties, are illustrated by the state of being a woman, i.e., being a woman, because, for the most part, one is powerless to do virtuous actions due to being under the control of others. This is the sign of the elimination of the unfree states.üîΩAgain, Subhuti, etc.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line and other such things refers to the following.

original: srog gcod pa ni srog chags gzhan dang srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / de la gsod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar zhugs pa dang / de bsad pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag lngas so //üîΩrdzas gzhan gyis bdag tu byas pa la /üîΩbltas nas yid kyis bzung na mthus rku bas /
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni srog chags gzhan dang srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / de la gsod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar zhugs pa dang / de bsad pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag lngas so // rdzas gzhan gyis bdag tu byas pa la / bltas nas yid kyis bzung na mthus rku bas /
translated: Killing is with five members: the other being a living being, the perception of that other as a living being, the intention to kill, the effort to kill, and the death of the living being.

original: de'i rgyu sems kyis gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu sems kyis gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
translated: Taking what is not given is appropriating as one‚Äôs own the property of another through force or stealth.

original: gzhan gyi nor dang / der 'du shes pa dang de 'phrog par 'dod pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang de blangs pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag lngas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor dang / der 'du shes pa dang de 'phrog par 'dod pa dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang de blangs pa'o zhes pa ni yan lag lngas so //
translated: Stealing is with five members: the property of another, the perception of that, the intention to steal, the effort to steal, and the appropriation of that property.

original: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul dang dus dang bgrod pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa ste /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul dang dus dang bgrod pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa ste /
translated: Sexual misconduct is intercourse with a person with whom one should not have intercourse, in a place other than the vagina, at a time other than when the woman is ovulating, or with a motivation other than that of begetting a child.

original: gzhan gyi bud med dang / gzhan gyi 'du shes pa dang / de la mngon par bgrod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa @154a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med dang / gzhan gyi 'du shes pa dang / de la mngon par bgrod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa @154a * //
translated: Another‚Äôs wife,üîΩanother‚Äôs perception,üîΩthe desire to engage in that,üîΩand the commencement of the act.

original: dang bgrod pa'o zhes pa'i yan lag lngas so //
analyzed: dang bgrod pa'o zhes pa'i yan lag lngas so //
translated: The five branches of sexual misconduct are: another's wife, the perception of another, the desire to engage in sexual intercourse, the performance of the act of sexual intercourse, and the penetration.

original: gzhan la ngag gam lus kyis phan pa ma yin pa'i don bsgrubs pas na brdzun du smra ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ngag gam lus kyis phan pa ma yin pa'i don bsgrubs pas na brdzun du smra ba ste /
translated: Lying is the performance of an act of speech that is not beneficial for another.üîΩThe five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to deceive, the performance of the act of speech, and the other's understanding.üîΩSlander is the performance of an act of speech that divides others.

original: dngos po dang 'du shes dang bslu bar smra bar 'dod pa dang smra ba la nye bar zhugs pa dang gzhan yid ches par byas pa smras pa ni yan lag lnga'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'du shes dang bslu bar smra bar 'dod pa dang smra ba la nye bar zhugs pa dang gzhan yid ches par byas pa smras pa ni yan lag lnga'o //
translated: The five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to divide, the performance of the act of speech, and the other's understanding.

original: lus kyi so sor sgrub pa ni ngag gi las dang chos mthun pas ngag gi las te /üîΩ'dul ba so sor thar pa'i mdo'i mdor bstan du /
analyzed: lus kyi so sor sgrub pa ni ngag gi las dang chos mthun pas ngag gi las te / 'dul ba so sor thar pa'i mdo'i mdor bstan du /
translated: Harsh speech is the performance of an act of speech that is unpleasant for another.üîΩThe five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to speak unpleasantly, the performance of the act of speech, and the other's understanding.

original: cang mi smra bar gyur pa'i brdzun du smra bar 'gyur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: cang mi smra bar gyur pa'i brdzun du smra bar 'gyur zhes bshad do //
translated: Idle chitchat is the performance of an act of speech that is meaningless.üîΩThe five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to speak, the performance of the act of speech, and the other's understanding.üîΩCovetousness is the desire to make another's property one's own.üîΩThe five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to make it one's own, the performance of the act of covetousness, and the non-abandonment of that thought.üîΩHarmful intent is the desire to harm another.

original: gzhan dag nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis 'byed pa can gyi tshig ni phra ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis 'byed pa can gyi tshig ni phra ma'o //
translated: The five branches are: the thing, the perception, the desire to harm, the performance of the act of harmful intent, and the non-abandonment of that thought.üîΩWrong view is the denial of the four truths.üîΩThe five branches are: the thing, the perception, the denial, the performance of the act of wrong view, and the non-abandonment of that thought.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis mi snyan pa smra ba skyon sgrogs pa ni tshig rtsub mo'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis mi snyan pa smra ba skyon sgrogs pa ni tshig rtsub mo'o //
translated: Harsh speech is the speaking of unpleasant things with an afflicted mind, the proclaiming of faults.

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa gsum las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ngag 'khyal ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa gsum las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ngag 'khyal ba'o //
translated: Idle chatter is any affliction other than the three: lying, etc.

original: gang gzhan dag gi la de bdag gir gyur na zhes pa'i spro bas nges par 'dzin pa ni brnab sems so //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gi la de bdag gir gyur na zhes pa'i spro bas nges par 'dzin pa ni brnab sems so //
translated: Covetousness is the grasping of another's as one's own with the desire for possession.

original: sems can gzhan la gnod pa'i don du zhe sdang ba ni gnod sems so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la gnod pa'i don du zhe sdang ba ni gnod sems so //
translated: Ill will is the hatred of sentient beings for the purpose of harming them.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bya ba'i dngos po med ces skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bya ba'i dngos po med ces skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Wrong view is the denial that there is cause, effect, and action.

original: 'dir brnab sems la sogs par 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang gzhan la gnod pa la sogs pa ste bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su yi rang bar byed pas ni bcu gar yang 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brnab sems la sogs par 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang gzhan la gnod pa la sogs pa ste bgyis pa dang / bgyid du stsal bar 'gyur ba dang rjes su yi rang bar byed pas ni bcu gar yang 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, one becomes guilty of all ten courses of action by desiring covetousness, etc., by committing adultery, by harming others, etc., by causing others to do so, and by rejoicing in them.

original: de la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ste /
translated: Therein, the three roots are desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: de las ldang ba'i rnam pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gis nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba bcu gang yang las pas las kyi lam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de las ldang ba'i rnam pa bdun ni lus dang ngag gis nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba bcu gang yang las pas las kyi lam zhes pa ste /
translated: The seven types of action that arise from that are the ten paths of unvirtuous action, since they are any physical or verbal negative action.

original: las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: las kyi lam mo //
translated: They are paths of action.

original: de dang bral bas ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
analyzed: de dang bral bas ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
translated: The ten virtuous actions are the opposite of those.

original: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pas kun nas bslang ba ni thams cad kyang legs par spyod pa ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pas kun nas bslang ba ni thams cad kyang legs par spyod pa ste dge ba'o //
translated: All of them are good, virtuous, since they are motivated by nonattachment, nonhatred and non-ignorance.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gang zhig brtse ba can gyis ni //
analyzed: gang zhig brtse ba can gyis ni //
translated: the compassionate

original: gzhan la phan na thams cad bya //üîΩlas de dge ba yin no zhes //
analyzed: gzhan la phan na thams cad bya // las de dge ba yin no zhes //
translated: do everything to benefit others.üîΩThe perfect buddhas

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams kun gyis gsungs //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams kun gyis gsungs //
translated: have declared that action to be virtuous.

original: chang 'thung ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: chang 'thung ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: Drinking alcohol is a proscribed offense.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams la chang 'thung ba gcig pu las ci'i phyir ldog par bya zhe na bcas pa yin yang chang 'thungs pas sngon du goms pa'i bag chags kyi las ji ltar rigs @154b par rab tu zad pas bcu ga'i nyes pa spyodüîΩpa nyid gzhan du spyod par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams la chang 'thung ba gcig pu las ci'i phyir ldog par bya zhe na bcas pa yin yang chang 'thungs pas sngon du goms pa'i bag chags kyi las ji ltar rigs @154b par rab tu zad pas bcu ga'i nyes pa spyod pa nyid gzhan du spyod par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: Even though it is proscribed, one turns away from drinking alcohol because one completely exhausts the karma of habitual tendencies that are cultivated earlier, and one engages in the other ten misdeeds.

original: gang zag kha cig gis ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa de rnams kyi nang du chang 'thungs pa las ldog pa yang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag kha cig gis ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa de rnams kyi nang du chang 'thungs pa las ldog pa yang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Some individuals turn away from drinking alcohol because it is the cause of natural offenses.

original: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i sems nyid kyis lhag par kun tu spyod pas rang nyid kho na la mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur na de ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i sems nyid kyis lhag par kun tu spyod pas rang nyid kho na la mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur na de ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: That which is engaged in by a mind that is afflicted and that has an undesirable karmic maturation for oneself alone is a natural offense.

original: dper na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bcu po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bcu po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the ten misdeeds such as killing.

original: de bzhin du chang 'thung bas ltogs pa la sogs pa la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid du 'gyur bas btung ba bzhin du kun tu spyod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chang 'thung bas ltogs pa la sogs pa la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid du 'gyur bas btung ba bzhin du kun tu spyod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, since drinking alcohol is beneficial for the hungry and so on, it is not wrong to drink alcohol if one has the intention to benefit others.

original: de'i phyir na legs 'ongs kyis dgra bcom par gyur kyang chang 'thungs shing de nas brtsams nas log par bcas par 'dul ba las bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na legs 'ongs kyis dgra bcom par gyur kyang chang 'thungs shing de nas brtsams nas log par bcas par 'dul ba las bshad do //
translated: Thus, although Supu·π£pacandra became an arhat, he drank alcohol and from that point on he was expelled from the monastic community.

original: theg pa chen por yang gang zag thams cad kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen por yang gang zag thams cad kyis ma yin te /
translated: In the MahƒÅyƒÅna, it is not for all persons.

analyzed: 'dir chos ma yin pa'i dbang du byas te de'i phyir na las kyi lam bcu gcig tu ma bstan to //
translated: Here, it is from the perspective of non-Dharma, and therefore the eleven karmic paths are not taught.

original: 'dir mi dge ba'i las ni legs par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mi dge ba'i las ni legs par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, nonvirtuous karma is not well done.

translated: It is weak due to the force of regretting that one has done something that should not have been done and not doing it again, it is weak due to the force of the antidote that is applied for the sake of purifying contaminated karma, it is weak due to the force of restoration through obtaining the vow of restraint that one will not do it again and

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi rten gyi stobs kyi ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems ni dngos por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba ste /

original: de'i rtsa ba can gyi ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gyur te las thams cad rnam par sbyong bar byed de /

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi las thams cad dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las rnams rnam pa thams cad du mchog tu sbyong ste /

translated: Therefore, in the section on the knowledge of all aspects, in the commentary on the medium patience, it is explained: ‚ÄúThe noble one, because his mind does not arise with regard to all that is afflicted, realizes the complete purity of the body, etc.‚Äù

original: des zhes pa ste 'gro ba ni 'grong pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes pa ste 'gro ba ni 'grong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by that knowledge of all aspects. ‚ÄúGoing‚Äù means going forth.

original: log pa ni 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: log pa ni 'ong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúReturning‚Äù means coming back.

original: 'khrug pa ni rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni rnam par g-yengs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDisturbance‚Äù means distraction.

original: bul ba mi byed pa'i bul ba ni rnam par g-yengs pas so //
analyzed: bul ba mi byed pa'i bul ba ni rnam par g-yengs pas so //
translated: The dullness that is not dull is due to distraction.

original: mthong ba bzhin zhes pa ni bltas na la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin zhes pa ni bltas na la'o //
translated: As seen means as seen.

original: 'di rnams ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: These are the indications.

original: 'chag pa dang gnas pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba rnams la rnam par mi g-yeng pa'o zhes pa ni dran pa dang bcas pa'i shes bzhin gyi rtags so //
analyzed: 'chag pa dang gnas pa dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba rnams la rnam par mi g-yeng pa'o zhes pa ni dran pa dang bcas pa'i shes bzhin gyi rtags so //
translated: Walking, standing, sitting, and lying down are without distraction is the indication of mindfulness and introspection.

original: rab 'byor yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, and so on and so forth.

original: shig dang mi sbyor bas shig med pa la gzob pa dang ni gtsang sbra'o //
analyzed: shig dang mi sbyor bas shig med pa la gzob pa dang ni gtsang sbra'o //
translated: Cleanliness and purity are the absence of dirt, since one does not associate with it.

original: gnod pa med pa ni nad kyi'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni nad kyi'o //
translated: Non-harm is due to illness.

original: skyon nye bar 'tshe ba med do zhes pa ni chos gos la sogs pa gtsang ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: skyon nye bar 'tshe ba med do zhes pa ni chos gos la sogs pa gtsang ba'i rtags so //
translated: The absence of faults and calamities is the indication of purity in Dharma robes and so on.

original: gang dag zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who, and so on, and so forth.

original: mngon par 'phags pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o zhes pa ni srin bu mi 'byung ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: mngon par 'phags pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o zhes pa ni srin bu mi 'byung ba'i rtags so //
translated: Exalted means especially exalted. This is the indication of the absence of worms.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti said, and so on, and so forth.

original: sems la bya ba nyung ba ni 'dod pa chung ba'i phyir dang rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la bya ba nyung ba ni 'dod pa chung ba'i phyir dang rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind has few activities because of having few desires and because of being without distraction.

original: sems gang zhig gya gyu nas rang gi skyon 'chab ba'i thabs byed pa ni g-yo'o //
analyzed: sems gang zhig gya gyu nas rang gi skyon 'chab ba'i thabs byed pa ni g-yo'o //
translated: The mind that, through crookedness, makes a pretense to conceal its own faults is deceitful.

original: gang du gzhan slu ba'i don du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan kun tu ston pa ni sgyu'o //
analyzed: gang du gzhan slu ba'i don du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan kun tu ston pa ni sgyu'o //
translated: That which, for the purpose of deceiving others, displays unreal virtues is flattery.

original: 'khyog pa nyid kyis gya gyu ste /
analyzed: 'khyog pa nyid kyis gya gyu ste /
translated: Crookedness is crookedness through crookedness.

original: de ni gzhan slu ba'i phyir yon po ste /
analyzed: de ni gzhan slu ba'i phyir yon po ste /
translated: That is crooked because it deceives others.

original: de med pa ni gya gyu med pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de med pa ni gya gyu med pa'i rtags so //
translated: The absence of that is the sign of non-crookedness.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, he who is not attached to gain and honor, etc.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa nyid bkag pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis nye bar @156b mtshon pa'o zhes pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par len pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa lhur len pa nyid bkag pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis nye bar @156b mtshon pa'o zhes pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par len pa'i rtags so //
translated: The negation of being intent on gain, etc. is indicated by the virtues of training. This is the sign of taking up the virtues of training.

original: phrag dog ces pa ste gzhan gyi yon tan la de srid du phrag dog dang / ser sna mi 'dzin pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar mtshon pa'o zhes pa ni ser sna med pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rtags so //
analyzed: phrag dog ces pa ste gzhan gyi yon tan la de srid du phrag dog dang / ser sna mi 'dzin pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar mtshon pa'o zhes pa ni ser sna med pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rtags so //
translated: The phrase envy and so on indicates the six perfections' resistances.

original: chos zab mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos zab mo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase the profound Dharma and so on.

original: yang dag par zhes pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba la'o //
translated: The phrase in reality refers to the correct application.

original: chos nyid dang sbyor ba ni thams cad la kun tu 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni chos nyid dang ldan pa 'gro ba nyid kyi rtags so //
analyzed: chos nyid dang sbyor ba ni thams cad la kun tu 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni chos nyid dang ldan pa 'gro ba nyid kyi rtags so //
translated: The phrase the reality of all refers to the universal application.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the other perfections.üîΩThe phrase you should go again means that you should go again.üîΩThe phrase you should go again means that you should go again.üîΩThe phrase you should go again means that you should go again.üîΩThe phrase you should go again means that you should go again.

original: de ltar na yang zhes pa ni 'di 'dra ba zer ba na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes pa ni 'di 'dra ba zer ba na'o //
translated: Thus means in this way.

original: 'dir 'jig rten rnams kyi don du'o zhes pa ni sems can don du dmyal ba khas len pa ste dmyal ba tshol ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten rnams kyi don du'o zhes pa ni sems can don du dmyal ba khas len pa ste dmyal ba tshol ba'i rtags so //
translated: Here, for the sake of the world means accepting hell for the sake of sentient beings, which is a sign of seeking hell.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste gang khyod kyis thos pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa so sor bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste gang khyod kyis thos pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa so sor bshad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, and so forth refers to what you have heard, which is the individual explanations of the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: gang khyod kyis gzung ba zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su spongs shig pa'o//
analyzed: gang khyod kyis gzung ba zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su spongs shig pa'o//
translated: What you have grasped, which is the spirit of enlightenment and the practice of the perfections, you should completely abandon.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs par smra ba ni snyan dngags mkhan la de'i las ni snyan dngags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs par smra ba ni snyan dngags mkhan la de'i las ni snyan dngags so //
translated: The various expressions of what is not real are the poet, and his work is poetry.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbyings te rang bzhin no zhes pa ni gzhan gyis bkri bar mi 'dod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbyings te rang bzhin no zhes pa ni gzhan gyis bkri bar mi 'dod pa'i rtags so //
translated: The realm of non-returning, which is the nature, is a sign of not desiring to be led by others.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, and so forth refers to what you have heard, which is the individual explanations of the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: 'di nyid du khyod ces pa la sogs pas ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam 'dzin du 'jug pa ste mngon par mi 'grub cing zad par 'gyur zhes pa ni bdud kyi lam gzhan nye bar bstan pa la bdud ces bya ba rtogs pa'i rtags so //

translated: Here, you and so forth are to engage in holding the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.  Not actualizing and exhausting is the sign of realizing the other path of MƒÅra that is taught as MƒÅra.

original: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If, and so on.

original: gzhan las ni bdud la sogs pas theg pa chen po de dang bral ba'i phyir te gtong ba'i don du smra ba ni bral ba'i tshig la /
analyzed: gzhan las ni bdud la sogs pas theg pa chen po de dang bral ba'i phyir te gtong ba'i don du smra ba ni bral ba'i tshig la /

original: yongs su mnyam pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //

original: mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //

original: de dag ces pa ni bral ba'i tshig la /
analyzed: de dag ces pa ni bral ba'i tshig la /

original: de ltar rtags nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtags nyi shu'o //
translated: Thus there are twenty signs.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise says:

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug ni //

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
translated: The state of application and post-meditation,üîΩthe individual cessation of abiding,

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: and the non-apprehension of even an atom of phenomena,üîΩare the signs of the path of seeing.

original: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
translated: The state of certainty in one's own stage,üîΩabiding in the three stages,

original: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
analyzed: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
translated: and giving one's life for the sake of the Dharma,üîΩare the signs of the path of cultivation.üîΩThese sixteen moments

original: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: are the signs of irreversibility

original: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //üîΩphyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
analyzed: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi // phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
translated: for the wise abiding on the path of seeing.

original: ces pa ste mtshan nyid kyi rtags rnam pa bcu drug la rim pa bzhin du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ste mtshan nyid kyi rtags rnam pa bcu drug la rim pa bzhin du gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus it is said that the sixteen signs of the path of seeing are taught in order.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line and so on refers to the following.

original: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'dun pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'dun pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The reversal of aspiration is the reversal of aspiration and the reversal of intrinsic nature.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is form and so on.

original: mi skye ba shes pa'i bzod pa 'dis de ltar ro zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa'i bzod pa 'dis de ltar ro zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: By this acceptance of the knowledge of non-arising, it is so. This is the sign of the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma of suffering, which is the reversal of the notion of form and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, etc.

original: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'dun pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa zlog par byed pa ni 'dun pa dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: Turning away from aspiration is being free from aspiration.

original: shes par 'gyur zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: shes par 'gyur zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: One will know is by supramundane intuition.

original: don med par nyon mongs pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang bral bar byed pa la kun tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: don med par nyon mongs pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang bral bar byed pa la kun tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: The fetter of the useless is the connection with the absence of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi nges pa brtan pas te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i rtags @157b so //
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi nges pa brtan pas te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i rtags @157b so //
translated: Therein, etc. is the sign of the knowledge of the teaching of suffering, by the firmness of the certainty of perfect enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, etc.

original: de ltar ni theg pa dman pa la rnam par log pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de ltar ni theg pa dman pa la rnam par log pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: Thus, the sign of the acquiescence in the knowledge of the subsequent of suffering is the turning away from the Individual Vehicle.

original: de dag 'dod na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag 'dod na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If they wish, etc.

original: de ltar na bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su zad pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su zad pa ste /
translated: Thus, the exhaustion of the branches of the concentrations, etc.

original: 'dod pa skye pa'i rnam par 'ching ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba thob pas stobs chung ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa skye pa'i rnam par 'ching ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba thob pas stobs chung ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: The weakness of the fetters of desire, etc., which give rise to desire, is the sign of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: 'dir ming la ched cher byed pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems yang ba nyid pas so //
analyzed: 'dir ming la ched cher byed pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ni sems yang ba nyid pas so //
translated: Here, not being preoccupied with names, etc., is due to the lightness of mind.

original: de 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes pa la sogs pa can ni lus yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes pa la sogs pa can ni lus yang ba nyid do //
translated: His going and coming, etc., is due to the lightness of body.

original: de gnyi gas ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de gnyi gas ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: Both of these are the sign of the acceptance of the knowledge of the truth of origination.

original: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa nyid kyi rnam shes la thabs kyis des ldog pa ni 'dod pa la spyod pa dang thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa nyid kyi rnam shes la thabs kyis des ldog pa ni 'dod pa la spyod pa dang thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Just as explained, by means of that, his turning away from consciousness is the skillful conduct of one in the desire realm.

original: de ni chos shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de ni chos shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: That is the sign of the knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: don du mi gnyer zhes pa ni nges par yid bde ba bskyed pas dga' ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer zhes pa ni nges par yid bde ba bskyed pas dga' ba rnams la'o //
translated: Not being concerned with the meaning is for those who definitely generate mental satisfaction and delight.

original: shin tu bde ba skyed pa ni rang bzhin gyis dga' ba rnams la ste stong pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba skyed pa ni rang bzhin gyis dga' ba rnams la ste stong pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúvery‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEqual and unequal‚Äù means proper and improper.

original: kun tu 'joms pa ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'joms pa ni gnod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúComplete destruction‚Äù means harm.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bdun po rnams la /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bdun po rnams la /
translated: The five beginning with faith that are conducive to liberation and the four that are conducive to penetration are the seven moments of the path of seeing.

original: skyes bu dam pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu drug po rnams der sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu drug po rnams der sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The sixteen words beginning with ‚Äúholy being‚Äù should be applied there.

original: gang du seng ge bzang pos mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug thob pa la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du skyes bu dam pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu drug go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gang du seng ge bzang pos mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug thob pa la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du skyes bu dam pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu drug go zhes bshad de /
translated: In the SubƒÅhupariprcchƒÅs≈´tra, it is said that the sixteen words beginning with ‚Äúholy being‚Äù refer to the sixteen moments of the path of seeing, respectively.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: skad cig ma bdun pa'i bar du rtogs pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma bdun pa'i bar du rtogs pa'i skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the occasion for understanding up to the seventh moment.

original: rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: Always celibate is the sign of the receptivity to the cognition of the subsequent stage.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: sngags kyi rigs pa ni sngags kyi khyad pa te /
analyzed: sngags kyi rigs pa ni sngags kyi khyad pa te /
translated: The mantra-method is the mantra-distinction.

original: lha pha'i rnams so /
analyzed: lha pha'i rnams so /
translated: The gods are the fathers.

original: rtsi ni 'bras bu sbyin pa'i nang rnams so //
analyzed: rtsi ni 'bras bu sbyin pa'i nang rnams so //
translated: The medicine is the fruit-giving herbs.

original: lha mo'i sngags ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i sngags ni rigs pa'o //
translated: The goddess-mantra is the method.

original: sman ni rtsi'o //
analyzed: sman ni rtsi'o //
translated: The medicine is the herb.

original: stsogs pas ni 'khrul 'khor dang rgyud la sogs pa can bzung ngo //üîΩ'thab pa @158a * //
analyzed: stsogs pas ni 'khrul 'khor dang rgyud la sogs pa can bzung ngo // 'thab pa @158a * //
translated: The etc. includes the machines and the tantras, etc.

original: ni lus kyis so //
analyzed: ni lus kyis so //
translated: The fight is with the body.

original: rtsod pa ni ngag gi'o zhes pa ni 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i ste rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni ngag gi'o zhes pa ni 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i ste rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: The dispute is with the speech. This is the sign of the receptivity to the cognition of the subsequent stage, the purity of livelihood.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas rjes su sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas rjes su sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application is the application with the application.

original: des lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: des lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
translated: By that, the simultaneous application.

original: 'di'i 'thad pa ni yum chen mor de ltar yang de stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang dman pa'am khyad par can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i 'thad pa ni yum chen mor de ltar yang de stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang dman pa'am khyad par can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause he abides in emptiness, he does not see any phenomenon as inferior or superior.‚Äù

original: 'di rnams 'dir tshig gnyis kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di rnams 'dir tshig gnyis kyis gsungs so //
translated: These are stated here in two verses.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs las 'byung ba nyid ni 'du 'dzi'i yul yin pa'i phyir te 'du 'dzi la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs las 'byung ba nyid ni 'du 'dzi'i yul yin pa'i phyir te 'du 'dzi la dga' ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúemergence‚Äù is that the bodhisattva emerges from the side of affliction because he is not fond of the objects of distraction.

original: de nyid med pa nyid la gtam tsam yang med pa'i phyir gtam mo //
analyzed: de nyid med pa nyid la gtam tsam yang med pa'i phyir gtam mo //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúspeech‚Äù is that there is not even speech about nonexistence.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rgyal po'i la /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i de nyid gtam ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rgyal po'i la / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'i de nyid gtam ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúking‚Äù is that it is preeminent.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúspeech‚Äù is that it is the speech about the reality that stops affliction.

original: mngon sum du ma byas pa nyid kyi gtam tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma byas pa nyid kyi gtam tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmere speech‚Äù is that it is not direct realization.

original: de ltar gtam gyi don ni 'dir ji ltar rigs pas so zhes pas ni phung po la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de ltar gtam gyi don ni 'dir ji ltar rigs pas so zhes pas ni phung po la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the verse is as follows: ‚ÄúIn whatever way is appropriate, one should understand the signs of the receptivity to the knowledge of the factors with regard to cessation, the knowledge of the factors with regard to cessation, the subsequent receptivity to the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of the path.‚Äù

original: rkun po zhes pa ni sgrib pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rkun po zhes pa ni sgrib pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThief‚Äù refers to the five hindrances,

original: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni chos shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni chos shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: because they steal the wealth of virtue.

original: dmag mi zhes pa ni dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs te rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: dmag mi zhes pa ni dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs te rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: ‚ÄúArmy‚Äù refers to the accumulation of virtuous qualities,üîΩand ‚Äúbattle‚Äù refers to the harm caused by the opposing factors of that accumulation.

original: 'thab mo ni de'i sde'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis gnod pa ste 'thabs na thob par 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab mo ni de'i sde'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis gnod pa ste 'thabs na thob par 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The victory that occurs when one engages in battle is the liberation of cessation, nirvana.

original: de'i yang gnas gzhan du mi 'jug pa ni de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa med pas grong zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yang gnas gzhan du mi 'jug pa ni de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnams la rnam par rtog pa med pas grong zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Since one does not enter another abode, one is without conceptualization with regard to the eyes, etc.

original: grong ni mig la sogs pa lnga po ste /
analyzed: grong ni mig la sogs pa lnga po ste /
translated: The villages are the five beginning with the eye.

original: lus la dbang po bsags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus la dbang po bsags pa'i phyir te /
translated: The body is a collection of sense-faculties.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the world of sentient beings.

original: grong khyer ni sems can rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: grong khyer ni sems can rnams kyi rten yin pa'i phyir snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The city is the receptacle-world, because it is the support of sentient beings.

original: grong rdal ni dbang pos nges par bgrod bya yin pa'i phyir yul lnga rnams so //
analyzed: grong rdal ni dbang pos nges par bgrod bya yin pa'i phyir yul lnga rnams so //
translated: The villages are the five sense-objects, because they are to be traversed by the sense-faculties.

original: ljongs la sogs pa ni snod kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: ljongs la sogs pa ni snod kyi bye brag go //
translated: The country, etc., are the various parts of the receptacle-world.

original: bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa zad par gyur pa ni thar pa'o zhes pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa zad par gyur pa ni thar pa'o zhes pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The exhaustion of the discriminations of self and possession is liberation.üîΩThe statement of this is:

original: bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The absence of self, etc.

original: 'di yang gong du bshad pa rnams kyi bye brag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gong du bshad pa rnams kyi bye brag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is also a particular discrimination of the above.

original: dbang @158b po la sogs pa'i 'thab mo'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang bral ba la rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: dbang @158b po la sogs pa'i 'thab mo'i gtam gyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba la gnas pa dang bral ba la rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: The sign of subsequent knowledge is the absence of engagement in and subsequent engagement with the discourse of the battle of the sense-faculties, etc.

original: yum chen mor ni de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pas rjes su sbyor ba la sogs pas mi gnas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yum chen mor ni de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pas rjes su sbyor ba la sogs pas mi gnas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the Great Mother, it is said that he does not abide in the perfections such as generosity, because he is engaged in them.

original: de la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is as follows:üîΩThe discourse of the perfection of wisdom itself is the discernment of all things.

original: ma bral zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtam ni so sor rtogs pa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ma bral zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtam ni so sor rtogs pa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The omniscience is the thought of enlightenment.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyir 'thab mo ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyir 'thab mo ste /
translated: The quarrel is for the sake of the discordant side,

original: ser sna la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as stinginess, etc.

original: gnyen po'i phyir mtshang 'dru ba ste sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyir mtshang 'dru ba ste sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reproof is for the sake of the antidote, such as generosity, etc.

original: de dag gnyi ga sems la rgyu ba'i stobs mnyam pa nyid ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga sems la rgyu ba'i stobs mnyam pa nyid ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The dispute is the equality of the power of the movement of both of those in the mind.

original: gang du gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs stobs chung bar byas pa ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gang du gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs stobs chung bar byas pa ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The argument is where the discordant side is weakened by the antidote.

original: mi 'byed pa ni mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'byed pa ni mnyam pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The non-division is the knowledge of equality.

original: 'byed pa ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o zhes pa ste lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byed pa ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o zhes pa ste lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The differentiator is the discrimination of variety. This is the receptivity to the knowledge of the teaching with regard to the path.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: gal te zhes pa ni 'dir snga nas te /üîΩ'dir de la gsungs pa ni de la gang phyir ldog pa'am min pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa ni 'dir snga nas te / 'dir de la gsungs pa ni de la gang phyir ldog pa'am min pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: If is here in the sense of since.

original: de ltar na yang rang nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rang nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, what is said to him is: Since he does not see even an atom's worth of any dharma that would turn back or not turn back, in that way also he himself does not doubt the stage of non-returning.

original: zhum pa ni spro ba dman pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhum pa ni spro ba dman pa nyid do //
translated: Depression is the lack of enthusiasm.

original: nem nur ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa'o //
analyzed: nem nur ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa'o //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty about emptiness in all aspects.

original: rnam par sel ba ni dman par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sel ba ni dman par byed pa'o //
translated: Elimination is the making inferior.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni sems kyis bdag nyid phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni sems kyis bdag nyid phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: Non-returning is the mind's own certainty of non-returning.

original: gzhan gyis bkri ba'i dbang du mi 'gro zhes pa ni rang nyid phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la brtan zhing nges pa ste chos shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri ba'i dbang du mi 'gro zhes pa ni rang nyid phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la brtan zhing nges pa ste chos shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: Not going under the sway of being led by others is a sign of knowing the Dharma, in that one is stable and certain in one's own irreversible stage.

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If, on the other hand, he should say I will become a Buddha, and so on.

original: 'di nyid ces pa ni skye ba 'di nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces pa ni skye ba 'di nyid la'o //
translated: This very life means in this very lifetime.

original: gzhan du ma gsungs pa ni mkhas pa ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du ma gsungs pa ni mkhas pa ni rig pa ste /
translated: Not elsewhere means not in another life.

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha rnams dang rgyu rig pa la sogs pa dang / skar ma'i shes pa rnams so zhes pa ni don rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha rnams dang rgyu rig pa la sogs pa dang / skar ma'i shes pa rnams so zhes pa ni don rtogs pa ste /
translated: The wise are those who know the sixty-four arts, the knowledge of the causes and so on, and the knowledge of the stars.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: They will emerge in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas su byin gyis brlab pa ni sprul ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su byin gyis brlab pa ni sprul ba'o //
translated: The consecration as a Buddha is the emanation.

original: gnyis su med ces pa ni de kho na nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med ces pa ni de kho na nyid du'o //
translated: Non-duality is in reality.

original: de ltar ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: de ltar ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Thus, it is the work of Mara.

original: skye ba med pa'i chos zhes te de ltar de bzhin gshegs @159a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos zhes te de ltar de bzhin gshegs @159a * //
translated: The non-arisen Dharma, thus the Tathagata has said in the Mahayana,

original: pas gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po las /
analyzed: pas gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po las /
translated: the Mahayana is the teaching of the Tathagata.üîΩ The Mahayana is the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid la bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid la bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid can gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: One who is endowed with the meditation on non-difference will become perfectly enlightened.

original: gnas gsum ni sa gsum la /
analyzed: gnas gsum ni sa gsum la /
translated: The three places are the three stages.

original: der mi gnas pa'i shin tu ba la bdud kyis kyang mi phyed par nges par ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: der mi gnas pa'i shin tu ba la bdud kyis kyang mi phyed par nges par ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i rtags so //
translated: The sign of subsequent knowledge is the certainty that even Mara cannot divide one who is not situated there, who is extremely steadfast.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: bdag yongs su gtong ba ni 'tshong ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bdag yongs su gtong ba ni 'tshong ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Giving up the self is by selling, etc.

original: srog yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: srog yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Giving up life is by dying.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid pa ste /
translated: The Dharma taught by the Buddhas is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de la rang dang gzhan gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir srog kyang gtong ba dang / de yang sangs rgyas rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du dga' ba dang gus pa chos la byed de de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'o zhes shes shing bdag nyid kyis kyang 'dod na sangs rgyas nyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rang dang gzhan gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir srog kyang gtong ba dang / de yang sangs rgyas rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du dga' ba dang gus pa chos la byed de de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'o zhes shes shing bdag nyid kyis kyang 'dod na sangs rgyas nyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended by oneself and others, one gives up one's life for it, and one has the joy and respect for the Dharma that one has for the Buddhas, because one knows that it is the Dharma Body of the Tathagata, and because one sees the Buddha if one wishes.

original: nyan thos kyi yang zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i yang lha la sogs pa'i yang ngo zhes pa ni chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ste rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yang zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i yang lha la sogs pa'i yang ngo zhes pa ni chos kyi don du srog gtong ba ste rjes su shes pa'i rtags so //
translated: The Sravakas' is a synecdoche for the Bodhisattvas and the gods, etc. Giving up one's life for the sake of the Dharma is a sign of subsequent knowledge.üîΩThe chapter on the sixteen aspects, signs, and marks of the irreversible Bodhisattva is completed.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma bcu drug gsal bar byed pa'i le'u 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kye zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma bcu drug gsal bar byed pa'i le'u 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kye zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas
translated: The commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines called The Light of the Moon, composed by the great pandit Abhayakaragupta, is completed.

original: pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: pas mdzad pa las le'u bcu bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the seventeenth chapter, having sixteen verses, called ‚Äúthe section on the irreversible wheel.

original: // / nges par 'byed pa dang mthong ba'i lam dag gi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags grangs dang khyad par gyis bshad nas bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste de la gnyi gas kyang ji ltar brjod par mi nus pa 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: // / nges par 'byed pa dang mthong ba'i lam dag gi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags grangs dang khyad par gyis bshad nas bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste de la gnyi gas kyang ji ltar brjod par mi nus pa 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Having explained the signs of irreversibility in terms of the numbers and qualities of the paths of seeing and the path of seeing, the path of meditation is profound.üîΩThe treatise states:

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //üîΩzhes pa de la gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste // zhes pa de la gsungs pa ste /
translated: The path of meditation is profound.

original: gsol to zhes pa ni yon tan chen po'i tshogs te /
analyzed: gsol to zhes pa ni yon tan chen po'i tshogs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúplease‚Äù refers to the assembly of great qualities.

original: mchog tu zab pa ste gang yang bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su bar ma chad par 'bad pas thob ste /
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa ste gang yang bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis su bar ma chad par 'bad pas thob ste /
translated: It is supremely profound, attained through effort without interruption for two incalculable aeons.

original: de'i phyir dang khyad par du shes par mi nus pa'i phyir na tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang khyad par du shes par mi nus pa'i phyir na tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be known in particular.

original: kun tu brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir na dpag tu med pa'o //üîΩgrangs las shin tu 'das pas mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir na dpag tu med pa'o // grangs las shin tu 'das pas mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: It is infinite because it cannot be expressed.üîΩIt is limitless because it transcends enumeration.

original: mchog tu rgya che ba'i phyir na mu med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rgya che ba'i phyir na mu med pa'o //
translated: It is boundless because it is supremely vast.

original: mi 'phags pa ni yang dag par gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phags pa ni yang dag par gzung du med pa'o //
translated: The non-distinction of a person is the non-apprehension of a real person.

original: yang dag par shes par mi nus zhes pa ni bsgom @159b pa'i lam gyi zab pa nyid pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par shes par mi nus zhes pa ni bsgom @159b pa'i lam gyi zab pa nyid pas so //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit cannot be known by right knowledge,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩspyod de zhes pa ni bstan par nus kyang cung zhig sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la dgongs pa'o //üîΩthams cad zab ces pa ni khyab pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste / spyod de zhes pa ni bstan par nus kyang cung zhig sems can gyi don du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la dgongs pa'o // thams cad zab ces pa ni khyab pa'i don to //
translated: Subh≈´ti‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúThe Lord has said, ‚ÄòThe perfection of wisdom is profound, etc.,‚Äô‚Äù

original: gnas zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa la'o //üîΩbstan du gsol zhes pa ni gsal bar brjod pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa la'o // bstan du gsol zhes pa ni gsal bar brjod pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.

original: brtsams pa ni bstan par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: brtsams pa ni bstan par bya ba la'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.

original: shes par 'dod pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt is not possible to teach it,‚Äù is because of the profundity of the path of meditation.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩzab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //üîΩzab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /üîΩzab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //üîΩzab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
translated: The statement,

original: ces te / lam gyi zab pa dmigs pa stong pa nyid la sogs pas zab mo zhes pa la dgongs pa ste /üîΩde la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ces te / lam gyi zab pa dmigs pa stong pa nyid la sogs pas zab mo zhes pa la dgongs pa ste / de la gsungs pa ni /
translated: The profound of the path is the profound emptiness of the objective reference and so on.

original: zab ces pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa stong pa nyid la de nyid mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: zab ces pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa stong pa nyid la de nyid mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The profound is the non-substantiality of all dharmas, emptiness.

original: de nyid rig pas mtshan ma'i sgro btags pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas mtshan ma'i sgro btags pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very thing is signlessness, because the superimposition of signs is stopped by the knowledge of that very thing.

original: de nyid smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid smon pa med pa ste /
translated: That very thing is wishlessness,

original: de rig pas khams gsum pa la smon pa med do //üîΩde nyid ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste de rnams kyi yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rig pas khams gsum pa la smon pa med do // de nyid ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste de rnams kyi yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no wish for the three world-spheres by the knowledge of that very thing.üîΩ That very thing is the non-performance of action, because there is no performance of action for the sake of rebirth in those very things.

original: de nyid ma byung ste de rnams su las kyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma byung ste de rnams su las kyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That very thing is the non-arising, because there is no arising by action in those very things.

original: de nyid ni skye ba med pa ste de rnams la rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa des shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni skye ba med pa ste de rnams la rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa des shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very thing is the unborn, because there is no natural arising in those very things.

original: de nyid dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid dngos po med pa ste /
translated: That very thing is the insubstantial,

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not substantial.

original: de nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: That itself is free from passion,

original: de rigs pas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal kun tu 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rigs pas nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal kun tu 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the rational destruction of the latent impressions of the afflictions.

original: de nyid 'gog pa ste de rnams su yang srid pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'gog pa ste de rnams su yang srid pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is cessation, because it is the cessation of existence in those.

original: de nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: That itself is nirvana,

original: de rnams kyi bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the complete destruction of the latent impressions of those.

original: de nyid bral ba ste de rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang mchog tu bral ba'o zhes pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid bral ba ste de rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang mchog tu bral ba'o zhes pa'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: That itself is separation, because it is the supreme separation from the contaminated aggregates.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba 'debs shing 'dri ba ni chos rnams ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba 'debs shing 'dri ba ni chos rnams ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The request and question of Subhuti are about the emptiness, etc., of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates, elements, media, etc.

original: byis pa la gzung bya gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar zab pa 'di rang nyid kyis 'dri ba ni ji ltar zhes pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa la gzung bya gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar zab pa 'di rang nyid kyis 'dri ba ni ji ltar zhes pa ste /
translated: The question of the child, ‚ÄúHow is this profound?‚Äù is about the apprehended objects, form, etc.

original: gang la zhes pa ni gang du gzugs la sogs @160a * //
analyzed: gang la zhes pa ni gang du gzugs la sogs @160a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn which‚Äù refers to the suchness of form, etc.

original: ba'i de bzhin nyid de gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel ba las skye bar byed pa ni kun rdzob la de nyid don dam par ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba'i de bzhin nyid de gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel ba las skye bar byed pa ni kun rdzob la de nyid don dam par ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The production of form, etc., from dependent origination is conventional, but not ultimately,

original: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid ni zhib mo mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams las kyang bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i zab pa nyid ni zhib mo mkhas pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams las kyang bzlog pa ste /
translated: because here the profundity of form, etc., is to be known by the wise, and it is the opposite of form, etc.

original: de rnams la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa rnams bzhin du /
analyzed: de rnams la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa rnams bzhin du /
translated: Because, like illusory persons, etc.,

original: bden pa nyid du sgro btags pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du sgro btags pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do //
translated: they do not exist as true realities. This is freedom from the extreme of reification.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel pa las skyes pa rnams kyi de rnams bzhin du yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo rnams su yod pa nyid la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel pa las skyes pa rnams kyi de rnams bzhin du yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo rnams su yod pa nyid la /
translated: ‚ÄúNirvana is also taught‚Äù means that, like those produced from dependent origination, they exist as the nature of reality,

original: don dam par ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pas /
analyzed: don dam par ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pas /
translated: but ultimately they are of one taste with emptiness.

original: rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid pas so zhes pas ni /
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid pas so zhes pas ni /
translated: Since it is a non-abiding nirvana,üîΩit is free from the extreme of negation.

original: skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do zhes pa ni stong pa nyid zab pa'o //
analyzed: skur ba'i mtha' las grol ba nyid do zhes pa ni stong pa nyid zab pa'o //
translated: This is the profundity of emptiness.

original: de'i lam gsungs pa ni bstan bcos las /üîΩnges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
analyzed: de'i lam gsungs pa ni bstan bcos las / nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
translated: The path to that is stated in the treatise:üîΩThe factors conducive to penetrative insight,üîΩthe path of seeing,

original: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: and the path of meditationüîΩare the path of meditation that repeatedly contemplates,

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: measures, and ascertains.

original: zhes te myur ba ni rgyun la'o //
analyzed: zhes te myur ba ni rgyun la'o //
translated: Swift is in terms of the continuum.

original: rgyun dang ldan pas sems pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang dmigs pas /
analyzed: rgyun dang ldan pas sems pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang dmigs pas /
translated: The path of meditation that possesses the continuum has the nature of contemplation and so on and is the emptiness of the path of meditation and so on that is the object.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa la brten pa'i nges par 'byed pa yan lag la sogs pa ji ltar na bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yul yin na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa la brten pa'i nges par 'byed pa yan lag la sogs pa ji ltar na bsgom pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid yul yin na /
translated: How is it that the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on that are based on emptiness and so on are the object of the nature of the path of meditation?

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here the treatise says:

original: de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bzhed do zhes te /
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bzhed do zhes te /
translated: Since it is a continuum, it is asserted.

original: rgyun dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste de la snga nas reg pas yul yin te /
analyzed: rgyun dang ldan pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste de la snga nas reg pas yul yin te /
translated: The path of cultivation is continuous, and since it is preceded by the path of seeing, it is the object.

original: phyis yul can yin zhes pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyis yul can yin zhes pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no contradiction in saying that it is the object prior to the path of seeing and the subject on the path of cultivation.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the Bhagavat said, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes rab ces pa rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes rab ces pa rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom, etc. The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the discernment of emptiness, etc.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang de'i don du bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang de'i don du bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Since the path of seeing and the path of cultivation are conducive to that goal, they are the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la ni 'brel ba rnams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la ni 'brel ba rnams pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of relations:

original: de la 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'dzin zhes pa'i don to //
